enumMember.name: INACTIVE
enumMember.description: Function is INACTIVE.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Function is ACTIVE.

enum.name: NumOfCells
enum.description: Number of neighbor cells for each frequency band supported. Must be included in the measurement report.

enumMember.name: SIX
enumMember.description:
Reporting of the six strongest cells.
The MS reports the six strongest neighbor cells, with known and allowed National Color Code (NCC) part of Base Transceiver Station Identity Code (BSIC), irrespective of the band used.

enumMember.name: ONE
enumMember.description:
Reporting of the strongest cell.
The MS reports the strongest cell, with known and allowed NCC part of BSIC in each of the frequency bands in the neighbor cell list, excluding the frequency band of the serving cell. The remaining positions in the measurement report are used for reporting of cells in the band of serving cell. If there are still remaining positions, these are used to report the next strongest identified neighbors in the other band irrespective of the band used.

enumMember.name: TWO
enumMember.description:
Reporting of the two strongest cells.
The MS reports the two strongest cells, with known and allowed NCC part of BSIC in each of the frequency bands in the neighbor cell list, excluding the frequency band of the serving cell. The remaining positions in the measurement report are used for reporting of cells in the band of serving cell. If there are still remaining positions, these are used to report the next strongest identified neighbors in the other band irrespective of the band used.

enumMember.name: THREE
enumMember.description:
Reporting of the three strongest cells.
The MS reports the three strongest cells, with known and allowed NCC part of BSIC in each of the frequency bands in the neighbor cell list, excluding the frequency band of the serving cell. The remaining positions in the measurement report are used for reporting of cells in the band of serving cell. If there are still remaining positions, these are used to repor t the next strongest identified neighbors in the other band irrespective of the band used.

enum.name: CombinedCellType
enum.description: The type of the combined cell the MCTR serves.

enumMember.name: CCTYPE1
enumMember.description: Combined cell type 1. Combined cell with a main antenna site acting as the dominant radio transmitter and defining the outer cell coverage border. Extension antenna sites are used to provide coverage in areas where the main antenna site fails to provide coverage. The distance between extension antenna sites and the main antenna site is not longer than 2 kilometers.

enumMember.name: CCTYPE2
enumMember.description: Combined cell type 2. Combined cell with a main antenna site acting as the dominant radio transmitter and defining the outer cell coverage border. Extension antenna sites are used to provide coverage in areas where the main antenna site fails to provide coverage. The distance between at least one extension antenna site and the main antenna site is longer than 2 kilometers.

enumMember.name: CCTYPE3
enumMember.description: Combined cell type 3. Combined cell without a dominant main antenna site. The outer coverage border of the combined cell is defined by the aggregated coverage area provided by the main and the extension antenna sites. The distances between antenna sites part of the combined cell are relatively short, ranging from a few meters for the case with co-sited antennas up to a maximum distance of 1 to 2 kilometers for the non co-sited antennas.

enumMember.name: CCTYPE4
enumMember.description: Combined cell type 4. Combined cell without dominant radio transmitter and used for high speed trains. The main and extension antenna sites together define the coverage border of the combined cell. The maximum distance between neighboring antenna sites part of the combined cell is in the order of 1 kilometer.

enumMember.name: CCTXDD
enumMember.description: Combined cell for TX Delay Diversity. Combined cell used for TX Delay Diversity. Extension antenna site is used to boost the downlink output power. The power is distributed equally over main and extension antenna sites, half of the power on one antenna and the other half of the power on the other antenna. The main and extension antenna sites are co-located and cover the same area of the combined cell.

enum.name: InitDlPcType
enum.description: Initial power reduction level for PS Downlink Power Control.

enumMember.description: Initial power reduction level is set to 0 dB.
Initial power reduction level is set to -2 dB.
Initial power reduction level is set to -4 dB.
Initial power reduction level is set to -6 dB.
Initial power reduction level is set to -8 dB.

Initial power reduction level based on path loss. Initial power reduction level is set to -0 dB, -2 dB, -4 dB, -6 dB, -8 dB or -10 dB, whichever gives the greatest reduction without resulting in signal strength below -90 dBm.

enum.name: ConfigurationMethod
enum.description: The configuration method used during the radio network configuration process.

enumMember.name: CMD
enumMember.description: Commands associated with HFS expansion may be used. There is no deletion of BPCs at the time of recovery. However, the commands associated with the HFS expansion may be used to cause full use of recovered equipment. BPCs are only deleted at the time of the HFS expansion.

enumMember.name: NODEL
enumMember.description: HFS expansion possible and no deletion of previously configured BPCs. There is HFS expansion possible and no deletion of previously configured BPCs to incorporate recently available equipment into a partially configured channel group. This means that the recovered equipment may not be fully used.

enumMember.name: MINDIST
enumMember.description:
Minimum disturbance. The BPCs are configured within a cell to cause minimum disturbance to that cell, at the expense of recovery time. An attempt is made to hand over all existing calls. Auto HFS expansion is carried out if compatible equipment becomes available.
The availability of this value depends on commercial agreements.

enumMember.name: FASTREC
enumMember.description:
Cell fast recovered. The BPCs are configured within a cell so that the cell is recovered as quickly as possible at the expense of reduction in capacity and service within the cell. Auto HFS expansion is carried out if compatible equipment becomes available.
The availability of this value depends on commercial agreements.

enumMember.name: FASTREC
enumMember.description: Cell fast recovered. The BPCs are configured within a cell so that the cell is recovered as quickly as possible at the expense of reduction in capacity and service within the cell. Auto HFS expansion is carried out if compatible equipment becomes available.

enumMember.name: MINDIST
enumMember.description: Minimum disturbance. The BPCs are configured within a cell to cause minimum disturbance to that cell, at the expense of recovery time. An attempt is made to hand over all existing calls. Auto HFS expansion is carried out if compatible equipment becomes available. The availability of this parameter value depends on commercial agreements.

enumMember.name: AUTO
enumMember.description: Maximum TX power is set automatically for the TX when its superior TRXC is connected to the MCTR. In this mode the maximum TX power must not be changed manually. The maximum TX power is equal for all TXs using the MCTR and its value is calculated according to the following algorithm: the value of the parameter MAXPWR is divided by the value of the parameter MAXTRX. If value of any of these two parameters is changed, then the maximum TX power is recalculated for each TX with superior TRXC connected to the MCTR.

enumMember.name: MANUAL
enumMember.description: The maximum TX power is set manually with the parameter MPWR.

enumMember.name: PORT_C
enumMember.description: BTS port C.

enumMember.name: PORT_D
enumMember.description: BTS port D.

enum.name: VcoMode
enum.description: Enumeration used to mark Voice Capacity Optimization feature operational mode.

enumMember.name: BASIC
enumMember.description: Basic mode.
enumMember.statusInformation: This value must not be used.

enumMember.name: HIGHCAP
enumMember.description: High capacity mode. Optimized to avoid congestion in the network.

enumMember.name: BALANCED
enumMember.description: Balanced mode. Optimized to keep balance between quality and capacity in the network.

enum.name: CcchConfigurationMethod
enum.description: CCCH configuration method used during radio network configuration due to equipment state change.

enumMember.name: NORMAL
enumMember.description: Standard configuration.

enumMember.name: BCCHMOVE
enumMember.description: Allowed to move BCCH to another TRXC in order to fulfill CCCH channel requirements.

enumMember.name: HOTOHCS
enumMember.description: STS counter HOTOHCS is increased.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: STS counters HOATTLSS, HOATTHSS, HOTOHCS, HOTOKCL, HOTOLCL are increased.

enumMember.name: INACTIVE
enumMember.description: Function is INACTIVE.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Function is ACTIVE.

enumMember.name: NETWORK_MODE_2
enumMember.description: Network Mode of Operation II; no Gs interface exists.

enumMember.name: NETWORK_MODE_1
enumMember.description: Network Mode of Operation I; Gs interface exists.

enumMember.name: NETWORK_MODE_3
enumMember.description: Network Mode of Operation III; no Gs interface exists.

enumMember.name: GSM900
enumMember.description: Cell system type GSM 900.

enumMember.name: GSM1800
enumMember.description: Cell system type GSM 1800.

enumMember.name: GSM1900
enumMember.description: Cell system type GSM 1900.

enumMember.name: GSM800
enumMember.description: Cell system type GSM 800.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: All internal cells.

enum.name: MultiBandPdch
enum.description: Multi band handling at PDCH allocation.

enumMember.name: G1_BCCH
enumMember.description: Channels only in the BCCH frequency band are considered. If the BCCH is placed in G1-GSM 900, channels in P-GSM 900 and in G1-GSM 900 are considered. If the BCCH is placed in P-GSM 900, channels only in P-GSM 900 are considered.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: Channels in all frequency band are considered.

enumMember.name: P_G1_BCCH
enumMember.description: Channels only in the BCCH frequency band are considered. If the BCCH is placed in either P-GSM 900 or G1-GSM 900, channels in P-GSM 900 and in G1-GSM 900 are considered.

enumMember.name: NON_DTM
enumMember.description: Measurement results for DTM connections are not collected.

enumMember.name: DTM
enumMember.description: Measurement results for DTM connections are collected.

enumMember.name: BOTH
enumMember.description: Measurement results for DTM and non-DTM connections are collected.

enumMember.name: NON_ACT_VAMOS_PAIRS
enumMember.description: Measurement results for connections in active VAMOS pairs are not collected.

enumMember.name: ACT_VAMOS_PAIRS
enumMember.description: Measurement results for connections in active VAMOS pairs are collected.

enumMember.name: BOTH
enumMember.description: Measurement results for both connections in active and non-active VAMOS pairs are collected.

enumMember.name: NEVER
enumMember.description: Never sent. The message Classmark 48.008 Update to the MSC is never sent.

enumMember.name: SUPRESSED
enumMember.description: Supressed until handover. The sending of the message 48.008 Classmark Update to the MSC is suppressed until initiating the Inter BSC Handover.

enumMember.name: LOCATION_UPDATING_SUPRESSED
enumMember.description: Supressed until handover, if initial message was Location Updating. The sending of the message 48.008 Classmark Update to the MSC is only suppressed until initiating the Inter BSC Handover, if the initial message was Location Updating.

enumMember.name: ALWAYS
enumMember.description: Always sent. The message 48.008 Classmark Update to the MSC is always sent.

enumMember.name: PASSIVE
enumMember.description: ICM on TCH and SDCCH channels without any traffic is passive.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: ICM on TCH and SDCCH channels without any traffic is active.

enumMember.name: NOALLOC
enumMember.description: ICM is active, but used for statistical purposes and not at channel allocation.

enumMember.name: ETM4
enumMember.description:
Evo Exchange Terminal.
ETM4 devices are used for transmission type E1.

enumMember.name: RBLT
enumMember.description:
RBLT device type.
An RBLT device is a 64 kbps channel on the 2.048 Mbps link between the BSC and BTS. RBLT devices are used for transmission type E1.

enumMember.name: RBLT2
enumMember.description:
RBLT2 device type.
An RBLT2 device is a 64 kbps channel on the 155.520 Mbps link between the BSC and BTS, terminating on 1 board ET155 H/W. RBLT2 devices are used for transmission type E1.

enumMember.name: ETM5
enumMember.description:
Evo Exchange Terminal.
ETM5 devices are used for transmission type T1.

enumMember.name: RBLT3
enumMember.description:
RBLT3 device type.
An RBLT3 device is a 64 kbps channel on the 155.520 Mbps link between the BSC and BTS, terminating on 1 board ET155 H/W. RBLT3 devices are used for transmission type T1.

enumMember.name: RBLT24
enumMember.description:
RBLT24 device type.
An RBLT24 device is a 64 kbps channel on the 1.544 Mbps link between the BSC and BTS. RBLT24 devices are used for transmission type T1.

enum.name: CombinerType
enum.description: The combiner type used in the TG.

enumMember.name: FLT
enumMember.description: Filter combiner.

enumMember.name: HYB
enumMember.description: Hybrid combiner.

enumMember.name: EQUAL
enumMember.description: Forbidden cells are those for which most significant bits of the PCID are equal to the PCIDP.

enumMember.name: NOT_EQUAL
enumMember.description: Forbidden cells are those for which most significant bits of the PCID are not equal to the PCIDP.

enumMember.name: IPM
enumMember.description: IP mode.

enumMember.name: SCM
enumMember.description: Super channel mode.

enumMember.name: 480MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 0,48 s.

enumMember.name: 960MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 0,96 s.

enumMember.name: 1920MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 1,92 s.

enumMember.name: 3840MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 3,84 s.

enumMember.name: 7680MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 7,68 s.

enumMember.name: 15360MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 15,36 s.

enumMember.name: 30720MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 30,72 s.

enumMember.name: 61440MS
enumMember.description: NC reporting period is 61,44 s.

derivedDataType.name: MscSignalingPoint
derivedDataType.description:

For signalling networks based on CCITT standard, it is expressed as nei-dpc, where:
nei Network indicator Numeral 0 - 3
dpc Destination point code Numeral 0 - 16383
Example: 1-128
For signalling networks based on ANSI standard, it is expressed as n-c-m, where:
n Network code Numeral 0 - 255
c Cluster code Numeral 0 - 255
m Member code Numeral 0 - 255
Example: 0-60-133

secdec Seconds, decimal part, optional Digit string 0 - 99999999
Examples of valid strings: N03-00-00.16666667 N90-59-59 S3-00-00 S03-59-59.123

Cell Identity String.

mnc Mobile network code Digit string 00 - 99, 000 - 999
lac Location area code Numeral 1 - 65535
ci Cell identity Numeral 0 - 65535

derivedDataType.name: MscName
derivedDataType.description:
Defines a symbolic name for the MSC.
The MSC name ALL is not allowed. Symbolic name 1 - 7 characters. Symbolic name 1 - 8 characters, when Market Adaptation M-110 is active. 8 character name is allowed when Bsc.support8Char is set to 8.

derivedDataType.name: IPv4UnicastAddress
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression.
Address is to be specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading 0s. IPv4 address within range [1-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. Valid characters: 0123456789.
Example: 1.1.1.1, 1.1.255.255

derivedDataType.name: SimpleTime
derivedDataType.description: Represents a simplified representation of local time (ISO 8601). The following pattern describes the SimpleTime format: hh:mm Where: hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format HH:MM where HH = Two digits of hour (00 through 23) and MM = Two digits of minute (00 through 59). Example 16:20.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: UtranIdString
derivedDataType.description:
UTRAN cell identity String.
mcc Mobile country code Digit string 000 - 999
mnc Mobile network code Digit string 00 - 99, 000 - 999
lac Location area code Numeral 1 - 65535
ci Cell identity Numeral 0 - 65535
rncid Radio network controller identity Numeral 0 - 4095

derivedDataType.name: DeviceIdentity
derivedDataType.description:
Device Identity.
1-13 characters expressed as dety-n where:
dety Device type Identifier 1 - 7 characters
n Device number Numeral 0 - max The value max is determined by the SAE in the device owning block. Usually SAE 500. For details, see Application Information for appropriate block.

derivedDataType.name: G31SubscrPrioLevelId
derivedDataType.description: Subscriber priority level. The priority level 1 is the highest and the priority level 14 is the lowest.

rule.exceptionText: Valid subscriber priority levels are in range 0-14.

derivedDataType.description: Symbolic name for an antenna. Identifier 1 - 7 characters.

derivedDataType.name: MccString
derivedDataType.description:
Mobile country code.
Digit string 000 - 999

derivedDataType.name: UmfiString
derivedDataType.description:
UMFI string.
Expressed as mfddarfcn-mscrcode-diversity where:
mfddarfcn ARFCN for the UTRAN FDD cell Numeral 0 - 16383
mscrcode Scrambling code Numeral 0 - 511
diversity Diversity, with following values: DIV Diversity is applied for the UTRAN FDD cell. NODIV Diversity is not applied for the UTRAN FDD cell.
Example: 123-52-NODIV

derivedDataType.name: SubscriberProfileIdTableId
derivedDataType.description: Holds the defined SPID Table in BSC.

derivedDataType.name: SubscriberProfileIdId
derivedDataType.description: Holds the defined SPIDs for SPID Table.

derivedDataType.name: JbPtaType

derivedDataType.name: PHcsThrType

derivedDataType.name: TmfiString
derivedDataType.description:
TMFI string.
Expressed as mtddarfcn-cellparam-tstd-sctd, where:
mtddarfcn ARFCN for the UTRAN TDD cell Numeral 0 - 16383
cellparam Cell parameter Represents code group, scrambling code, long basic midamble code and short basic midamble code of the UTRAN TDD cell Numeral 0 - 127
tstd TSTD indicator, with following values: DIV TSTD is applied in the UTRAN TDD cell. NODIV TSTD is not applied in the UTRAN TDD cell.
sctd SCTD indicator, with following values: DIV SCTD is applied in the UTRAN TDD cell. NODIV SCTD is not applied in the UTRAN TDD cell.
Example: 123-52-NODIV-DIV

derivedDataType.name: Cscc8Type
derivedDataType.description: SCC type for aFrCscc, aWbCscc, efrCscc.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

class.name: G12Tg
class.description:
Represents a TG MO in the BTS logical model G12.
A BTS is, by GSM definition, the base station equipment required to support a cell. The G12 model implementation of the BTS functionality is termed a TG. However, it should be noted that a TG can support a part of a cell, a single cell, or any number of cells up to a maximum of 16.
A TG in the logical model of the BTS consists of a set of MOs and is in itself a managed object. BTS logical model G12 is realized by RBSs in the RBS 2000 family and RBSs in the 6000 family equipped with DUG.
In order to delete TG, connected channel group state, set by attribute ChannelGroup.state must be Halted.

attribute.name: rSite
attribute.description:
Identity of the radio site where the TG is located.
Depends on RXMOI: RSITE RXMOC: RSITE RXMSC: RSITE
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: comb
attribute.description:
Combiner type used in the TG.
Depends on RXMOI: COMB RXMOC: COMB
attribute.dependencies: Can be set to value FLT only if antenna hopping state, set by the attribute G12Tg.aHop, is OFF.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: fHop
attribute.description:
Frequency hopping to be performed in the TG MO.
If attribute comb is set to FLT, default value of this attribute is equal BB. If attribute comb is set to HYB, default value of this attribute is equal SY.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: FHOP
attribute.dependencies: Can be set to value SY only if attribute G12Tg.comb is set to HYB.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: g12TgId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of TG MO and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set to value assigned to the attribute G31Tg.g31TgId

attribute.name: usesSuperChannelGroup
attribute.description:
Group of SCs that terminate in the same TG.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI: SCGR RXMOC: SCGR
attribute.dependencies: Attribute must be set during the creation of a TG in the transmission mode SCM, or when changing the transmission mode from TDM to SCM. Can be set to no value only if TG transmission mode is TDM. The attribute must be set to no value before assigning a new value in the transmission mode TDM. The transmission mode is set by the attribute tMode.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE. MO SuperChannelGroup must have at least one child SuperChannel MO defined to set this attribute.

attribute.name: connectedChannelGroup
attribute.description:
Connection between channel group and the TG MO.
Depends on RXTCI: CELL CHGR RXTCE: CELL CHGR
attribute.dependencies: The channel groups from one cell can be connected to TGs from one BTS logical model at a time. Channel group 0 of a cell for which the functionality Extended DRX, set by the attribute IoT.eDrxStatus, is active, can only be connected to a TG with the active functionality BTS Soft Synchronization, set by the attribute G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState. Possibility to connect TG in BTS logical model G12 to channel group with value other than DEFAULT for attribute hopType depends on commercial agreements. A channel group, for which EC-BCCH, set by attribute ChannelGroup.ecbcch, is required, cannot be connected to a TG when attribute G12Tg.tMode is equal to TDM. The channel group cannot be disconnected due to radio interference recording for the associated cell. The channel group can be disconnected only if the attribute ChannelGroup.state is set to state HALTED. The channel group of a cell for which the functionality Reduced BCCH Spectrum, set by the attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.sBcchSp, is active, can only be connected to a TG with the active functionality BTS Soft Synchronization, set by the attribute G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState.
attribute.precondition: Channel group state, set by the attribute ChannelGroup.state must be HALTED.

attribute.name: confMd
attribute.description:
Configuration method used during the radio network configuration process.
These methods impact the use of recovered MOs in baseband hopping, synthesizer hopping, and mixed mode hopping channel groups.
Default value is NODEL, when Market Adaptation M-068 is not activated. Default value is FACTREC, when Market Adaptation M-068 is activated.
The availability of attribute values FASTREC and MINDIST depend on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: CONFMD RXMSC: CONFMD

attribute.name: swVer
attribute.description:
Defines the name of the disk file with the BTS software version.
This is the default software version to be loaded into the TRXCs and CF belonging to a TG.
DEFAULT Default software version
Depends on RXMOI: SWVER RXMOC: SWVER RXMSC: SWVER
attribute.takesEffect: The replacement software version specified by the attribute is not loaded into the MO until a function change or program load command is given, or the MO is brought out of service and back into service.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE. Software version change indicator, set by the attribute swVerChg, must be UNLOCKED.

attribute.name: swVerAct
attribute.description:
Actual operational software version.
Depends on RXMOP: SWVERACT

attribute.name: conFact
attribute.description:
Maximum number of TRXCs that must be LAPD concentrated on the same transmission device.
If attribute G12Tg.tMode is set to SCM, default value of this attribute is equal 1. If attribute G12Tg.tMode is set to TDM, default value of this attribute is equal 4.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: CONFACT RXMSC: CONFACT
attribute.dependencies: If TG transmission mode, set by the attribute g12Tg.tMode, is SCM then only value 1 can be assigned to this attribute.

attribute.name: traCo
attribute.description:
Transcoder connection type.
Depends on RXMOI: TRACO RXMOC: TRACO

attribute.name: sigDel
attribute.description:
Signaling delay for LAPD data links established on physical connection between the BSC and the BTS.
Depends on RXMOI: SIGDEL RXMOC: SIGDEL
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: swVerDld
attribute.description:
BTS downloaded software version. Defines software version downloaded into BTS flash memory and used for all future non command ordered loading attempts of the specified MO if the last software download has been successful. If the last command ordered download of replacement software version has not been completed or failed the software version ordered by the operator is still indicated by replacement software version. If the swVerDld and swVerAct are not the same, this indicates that the object contains downloaded software which has not yet been upgraded. In this case, either a command or non command ordered start results in the downloaded software version being started and the actual software version is updated to the downloaded software version value.
Depends on RXMOP: SWVERDLD

attribute.name: aHop
attribute.description:
State of the functionality antenna hopping for the TG MO.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC: AHOP
attribute.dependencies: If attribute comb equals FLT, this attribute should be set to OFF.

attribute.name: abisAlloc
attribute.description:
The allocation method for the Abis paths for a TG.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI: ABISALLOC RXMOC: ABISALLOC RXMSC: ABISALLOC
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set to FLEXIBLE if G12Tg.tMode equals SCM or G12Tg.traCo equals SEMI.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: clusterId
attribute.description:
TG cluster identity for TG.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI: CLUSTERID RXMOC: CLUSTERID
attribute.dependencies: The attribute can be set only if the attribute G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState is set to OFF. A TG in a logical TG cluster must have this attribute defined, a TG in a notional TG cluster must have this attribute set to no value. When connecting a TG to a logical TG cluster by using this attribute, it is possible to set manually the unique identity for this TG within the logical TG cluster by using the attribute clTgInst . If the attribute clTgInst is not set, the unique identity is set automatically. The TG cannot be connected to the TG cluster if the corresponding TF synchronization mode, set by attribute G12Tf.tfMode, is STANDALONE. The TG cannot be connected to the logical TG cluster which has 16 TGs already connected.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: abis64kThr
attribute.description:
Packing threshold for pool of 64 kbps Abis paths reserved for use by suitably configured TSs.
Changes a packing threshold for pool of reserved 64 kbps Abis paths. The threshold value is expressed as a percentage of the total number of paths in pool of reserved 64 kbps Abis paths. The packing starts when the number of idle paths in pool of reserved 64 kbps Abis paths falls below the threshold value and ends when the number of idle paths in pool of reserved 64 kbps Abis paths exceeds the value determined by this attribute. The packing is stopped when the threshold value is set to 0.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode TDM is 0.
Depends on RXATC: ABIS64KTHR

attribute.name: dAmrCr
attribute.description:
State of functionality AMR FR with reduced codec allocation control.
Defines if the functionality AMR FR is activated per TG.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: DAMRCR RXMOC: DAMRCR RXMSC: DAMRCR
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if Abis path allocation method, set by attribute G12Tg.abisAlloc, is FLEXIBLE.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: dFrMaAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic FR to HR mode adaptation threshold for 16 kbps pool of Abis paths.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping packing of FR and AMR FR channels and for starting and stopping of move from FR to HR channels, including AMR, using 16 kbps Abis devices in the 16 kbps pool. The threshold value is expressed as percentage of idle 16 kbps devices out of nominal number of devices in the pool. Default value for TG in the transmission mode TDM is 0.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: DFRMAABISTHR

attribute.name: dHrMaAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR to FR mode adaptation threshold for 16 kbps pool of Abis paths.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping of move from HR to FR channels, including AMR, using 16 kbps Abis devices in the 16 kbps pool. The threshold value is expressed as percentage of idle 16 kbps devices out of nominal number of devices in the pool.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. Default value for TG in the transmission mode TDM is 100.
Depends on RXATC: DHRMAABISTHR

attribute.name: dAmrRedAbisThr
attribute.description:
AMR FR with reduced codec allocation threshold for 16 kbps pool of Abis paths.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR FR channels with reduced codec set using Abis devices from the 16 kbps pool. The threshold value is expressed as percentage of idle 16 kbps devices, out of nominal number of devices in the pool. The allocation of these channels due to shortage of Abis resources starts when the number of idle 16 kbps devices falls below the threshold value and ends when the number of idle 16 kbps Abis devices exceeds the value determined by this attribute.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode TDM is 20.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: DAMRREDABISTHR

attribute.name: dHraAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR allocation threshold for 16 kbps pool of Abis paths.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR HR and HR channels using Abis devices from the 16 kbps pool. The threshold value is expressed as percentage of idle 16 kbps Abis devices, out of nominal number of devices in the pool. The allocation of HR channels due to shortage of Abis resources starts when the number of idle 16 kbps Abis devices falls below the threshold value and ends when the number of idle 16 kbps Abis devices exceeds the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 0. Default value for TG in the transmission mode TDM is 0.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: DHRAABISTHR

attribute.name: dHraAbisThrWb
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR allocation threshold for 16 kbps pool of Abis paths for AMR-WB MSs.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR HR and HR channels using Abis devices from the 16 kbps pool. This threshold is used in AMR-WB capable cells for MSs that support AMR-WB. The threshold value is expressed as percentage of idle 16 kbps Abis devices, out of nominal number of devices in the pool. The allocation of HR channels due to shortage of Abis resources starts when the number of idle 16 kbps Abis devices falls below the threshold value and ends when the number of idle 16 kbps Abis devices exceeds the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 0. Default value for TG in the transmission mode TDM is 0.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: DHRAABISTHRWB

attribute.name: sdFrMaAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic FR to HR mode adaptation threshold for packet Abis.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping packing of FR and AMR FR channels and for starting and stopping the move from FR to HR channels, including AMR, in case of high transmission load on packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The packing and moving of channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The packing and moving is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode SCM is 100.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: SDFRMAABISTHR
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sdHrMaAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR to FR mode adaptation threshold for packet Abis.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the move from HR to FR channels, including AMR, in case of low transmission load on packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The moving of channels due to low usage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the value determined by this attribute.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode SCM is 0.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: SDHRMAABISTHR
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sdAmrRedAbisThr
attribute.description:
AMR FR with reduced codec allocation threshold for packet Abis.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR FR channels with reduced codec set, in case of high transmission load on a packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packed Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The allocation of these channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode SCM is 100.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: SDAMRREDABISTHR
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sdHraAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR allocation threshold for packet Abis.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR HR and HR channels, in case of high transmission load on packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The allocation of HR channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode SCM is 100.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: SDHRAABISTHR
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sdHraAbisThrWb
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR allocation threshold for packet Abis for AMR WB capable MSs.
Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR HR and HR channels, in case of high transmission load on packet Abis. This threshold is used in AMR-WB capable cells for MSs that support AMR-WB. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The allocation of HR channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100.
Default value for TG in the transmission mode SCM is 100.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXATC: SDHRAABISTHRWB
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: tMode
attribute.description:
TG transmission mode on Abis interface.
Depends on RXMOC: TMODE RXMOI: TMODE
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: packAlg
attribute.description:
Packing algorithm.
Defines if transmission data in the SCGR is packed and what packing algorithm is used for a TG in the transmission mode SCM.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: PACKALG RXMOC: PACKALG RXMSC: PACKALG
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM. If functionality A over IP is activated in the BSC, this attribute must be set to ALGORITHM1.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: pta
attribute.description:
P-GSL timing advance.
Defines a number of TDMA frames for counting the timing advance for P-GSL when P-GSL timing advance regulation is not activated with attribute G12Tg.pal.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: PTA RXMOC: PTA
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: jbsDl
attribute.description:
Size of downlink jitter buffer.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: JBSDL RXMOC: JBSDL
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: psuPs
attribute.description:
State of functionality PSU power savings for the TG MO.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC: PSUPS

attribute.name: pal
attribute.description:
Defines if P-GSL timing advance regulation is used and then which regulation algorithm is used.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: PAL RXMOC: PAL
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: jbPta
attribute.description:
BTS jitter buffer depth for P-GSL timing advance.
Defines the delay time in the BTS buffer of the data packets when P-GSL timing advance regulation with algorithm 1 is activated with attribute G12Tg.pal. The value means the maximum jitter delay the BTS can manage in downlink.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: JBPTA RXMOC: JBPTA
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: clTgInst
attribute.description:
Unique TG identifier within a TG cluster.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: CLTGINST RXMOC: CLTGINST
attribute.dependencies: Attribute must not be used for the TG not connected to the logical TG cluster, which is defined by the attributr G12Tg.clusterId. clTgInst values for all TGs which belong to the same logical TG cluster, set by the attribute G12Tg.clusterId, must be unique. If this attribute is not set, the unique identity is set automatically during connection of TG to a logical cluster.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TG MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tg.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: tsPs
attribute.description:
State of the functionality time slot power savings.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC: TSPS

attribute.name: ccchCmd
attribute.description:
CCCH configuration method.
Defines the CCCH configuration method used during the radio network configuration process when state of equipment is changed.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: CCCHCMD RXMSC: CCCHCMD

attribute.name: csTma
attribute.description:
State of the functionality current supervised TMA for the TG MO.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC CSTMA

attribute.name: aisgTma
attribute.description:
State of the functionality antenna interface standards group TMA for the TG MO.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC: AISGTMA

attribute.name: aisgRet
attribute.description:
State of the functionality antenna interface standards group RET for the TG MO.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC: AISGRET

attribute.name: rCasc
attribute.description:
State of functionality RRUS cascading for the TG MO.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXBFC: RCASC

attribute.name: tgCoord
attribute.description:
Alarm coordination level.
Allows coordination of alarms at different levels so that only the highest severity alarm is issued at that level.
Depends on RXALC: TGCOORD

attribute.name: alCoTim
attribute.description:
Alarm coordination timer.
Defines filter time that allows the BTS related fault situation to settle before the alarm coordination analysis begins.
Depends on RXALC: ALCOTIM

attribute.name: exalTim
attribute.description:
External alarm coordination timer.
Defines a time in which the reported BTS external alarm situation is allowed to settle before the actual alarm is raised.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXALC: EXALTIM

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TG MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the TG MO.
The actual TG MO state is stored in G12Tg.moOperState.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.disturbances: Changing of the attribute from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED: The blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TG MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: changeSubordState
attribute.description:
Indicates if state of subordinate MOs to the TG MO is changed when moAdmState is changed.
Depends on RXESI: SUBORD RXESE: SUBORD RXBLI: SUBORD RXBLE: SUBORD

attribute.name: g12TgIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: cascap
attribute.description: CAS capability indicator.

attribute.name: omlF1Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported optional OML functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bits listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 TRXC function change 0 - TRXC function change not supported by the BTS 1 - TRXC function change supported by the BTS
f2 Automatic ciphering 0 - Automatic ciphering not supported by the BTS 1 - Automatic ciphering supported by the BTS
f3 IRC 0 - IRC not supported by the BTS 1 - IRC supported by the BTS
f4 Antenna Hopping 0 - Antenna Hopping not supported by the BTS 1 - Antenna Hopping supported by the BTS
f5 Frame synchronization using GPS 0 - Frame synchronization using GPS not supported by the BTS 1 - Frame synchronization using GPS supported by the BTS
f6 4WRD 0 - 4WRD not supported by the BTS 1 - 4WRD supported by the BTS
f7 Automatic parameter setting in TG synchronization on TG level 0 - Automatic parameter setting in TG synchronization on TG level not supported by the BTS 1 - Automatic parameter setting in TG synchronization on TG level supported by the BTS
f8 Feature Packet Abis over TDM 0 - Feature Packet Abis over TDM not supported by the BTS 1 - Feature Packet Abis over TDM supported by the BTS
f9 Feature Packet Abis over IP 0 - Feature Packet Abis over IP not supported by the BTS 1 - Feature Packet Abis over IP supported by the BTS
f11 PSU Power Savings 0 - PSU Power Savings not supported by the BTS 1 - PSU Power Savings supported by the BTS
f12 SC Quality Report II 0 - SC Quality Report II not supported by the BTS 1 - SC Quality Report II supported by the BTS
f13 Time Slot Power Savings 0 - Time Slot Power Savings not supported by the BTS 1 - Time Slot Power Savings supported by the BTS
f14 Multiple CCCH 0 - Multiple CCCH not supported by the BTS 1 - Multiple CCCH supported by the BTS
f15 MCTR 0 - MCTR not supported by the BTS 1 - MCTR supported by the BTS
f16 Current supervised TMA 0 - Current supervised TMA not supported by the BTS 1 - Current supervised TMA supported by the BTS
f17 Antenna interface standards group TMA 0 - Antenna interface standards group TMA not supported by the BTS 1 - Antenna interface standards group TMA supported by the BTS
f18 Antenna interface standards group RET 0 - Antenna interface standards group RET not supported by BTS 1 - Antenna interface standards group RET supported by the BTS
f19 VAMOS 0 - VAMOS not supported by the BTS 1 - VAMOS supported by the BTS
f20 TS configuration split 0 - TS configuration split not supported by the BTS 1 - TS configuration split supported by the BTS
f21 AQPSK with non-zero Subchannel Power Imbalance Ratio (SCPIR) 0 - AQPSK with non-zero SCPIR not supported by the BTS 1 - AQPSK with non-zero SCPIR supported by the BTS
f22 MCTR maximum allowed power extension 0 - MCTR maximum allowed power extension not supported by the BTS 1 - MCTR maximum allowed power extension supported by the BTS
f23 BCCH Power Savings 0 - BCCH Power Savings not supported by the BTS 1 - BCCH Power Savings supported by the BTS
f24 BTS Soft Synchronization 0 - BTS Soft Synchronization not supported by the BTS 1 - BTS Soft Synchronization supported by the BTS
f25 Native IP Configuration 0 - Native IP Configuration not supported by the BTS 1 - Native IP Configuration supported by the BTS
f26 RRUS Cascading 0 - RRUS Cascading not supported by the BTS 1 - RUS Cascading supported by the BTS
f27 Reporting of Access Burst Info 0 - Reporting of Access Burst Info not supported by the BTS 1 - Reporting of Access Burst Info supported by the BTS
f28 Support for decimal resolution of configured power 0 - Decimal resolution of configured power not supported by the BTS 1 - Decimal resolution of configured power supported by the BTS
f29 Node Group Synchronization 0 - Node Group Synchronization not supported by the BTS 1 - Node Group Synchronization supported by the BTS
f30 Extended Coverage 0 - Extended Coverage not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended Coverage supported by the BTS
f31 Synchronization Observability 0 - Synchronization Observability not supported by the BTS 1 - Synchronization Observability supported by the BTS
f32 Frequency Measurements 0 - Frequency Measurements not supported by the BTS 1 - Frequency Measurements supported by the BTS
f33 Combined cell 0 - Combined cell not supported by the BTS 1 - Combined cell supported by the BTS
f34 Energy Consumption Counters 0 - Energy Consumption Counters not supported by the BTS 1 - Energy Consumption Counters supported by the BTS
f35 TRX Soft Synchronization 0 - TRX Soft Synchronization not supported by the BTS 1 - TRX Soft Synchronization supported by the BTS

attribute.name: omlF2Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported mandatory OML functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bit listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 Frequency measurements support 0 - Frequency measurements not supported by the BTS 1 - Frequency measurements supported by the BTS

attribute.name: rslF1Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported optional RSL functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bits listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 Paging command 0 - Channel Needed not supported 1 - Channel Needed supported
f2 BTS phase handling 0 - BCCH information phase 2 not supported, Layer 3 information must be included in SACCH filling, and immediate assign phase 2 not supported 1 - BCCH Information phases 1 and 2 supported, Layer 3 information may be excluded from SACCH filling, and immediate assign phases 1 and 2 supported
f3 Extended range 0 - Extended range not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended range supported by the BTS
f4 A5/2 algorithm 0 - A5/2 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/2 algorithm supported by the BTS
f5 Base station power control 0 - BS power control not supported 1 - BS power control supported
f6 Multiband operation 0 - Multiband operation not supported 1 - Multiband operation supported
f7 Power information support 0 - Power information not supported by the BTS 1 - Power information supported by the BTS
f8 A5/1 algorithm 0 - A5/1 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/1 algorithm supported by the BTS
f9 GPRS support 0 - GPRS not supported by the BTS 1 - GPRS supported by the BTS
f10 Enhanced Multi-Level Precedence and Preemption Service priority 0 - Enhanced Multi-Level Precedence and Preemption Service priority not supported 1 - Enhanced Multi-Level Precedence and Preemption Service priority supported
f11 CBCH 0 - Extended CBCH not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended CBCH supported by the BTS
f12 Main channel reference 0 - Main channel reference not supported 1 - Main channel reference supported
f13 A5/3 algorithm 0 - A5/3 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/3 algorithm supported by the BTS
f14 BTS Counters 0 - Reporting of BTS Counters not supported by the BTS 1 - Reporting of BTS Counters supported by the BTS
f15 Dynamic IS configuration 0 - ICP List in channel activation not supported 1 - ICP List in channel activation supported
f16 EMR 0 - EMR functionality not supported by the BTS 1 - EMR functionality supported by the BTS
f17 TFO 0 - TFO not supported 1 - TFO supported
f18 VGCS 0 - VGCS not supported by the BTS 1 - VGCS supported by the BTS
f19 VGCS Enhancements 0 - VGCS Enhancements not supported by the BTS 1 - VGCS Enhancements supported by the BTS
f21 Enhanced Handover Success Rate 0 - Enhanced Handover Success Rate not supported by the BTS 1 - Enhanced Handover Success Rate supported by the BTS
f22 Repeated SACCH support 0 - Repeated SACCH not supported by the BTS 1 - Repeated SACCH supported by the BTS
f23 RTTI support 0 - RTTI not supported by the BTS 1 - RTTI supported by the BTS
f24 PTA regulation mode PAL 1 0 - PTA regulation algorithm 1 not supported by the BTS 1 - PTA regulation algorithm 1 supported by the BTS
f25 PAN Support 0 - PAN not supported by the BTS 1 - PAN supported by the BTS
f26 Random fill bits 0 - Random fill bits not supported by the BTS 1 - Random fill bits supported by the BTS
f27 BS Power 2 support 0 - BS Power 2 not supported by the BTS 1 - BS Power 2 supported by the BTS
f28 SMSCB DRX mode support 0 - DRX mode not supported by the BTS 1 - DRX mode supported by the BTS
f29 VAMOS Advanced support 0 - VAMOS Advanced not supported by the BTS 1 - VAMOS Advanced supported by the BTS
f30 PDCH options support 0 - PDCH options not supported by the BTS 1 - PDCH options supported by the BTS
f31 Random fill bits in System Information Type 6 0 - Random SI6 fill bits not supported by the BTS 1 - Random SI6 fill bits supported by the BTS
f32 Channel Specific Measurement Information support 0 - Channel Specific Measurement Information not supported 1 - Channel Specific Measurement Information supported
f33 UL Data Compression support 0 - UL Data Compression not supported 1 - UL Data Compression supported
f34 A5/4 algorithm 0 - A5/4 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/4 algorithm supported by the BTS
f35 Extended Coverage 0 - Extended Coverage not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended Coverage supported by the BTS
f36 Extended DRX 0 - Extended DRX not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended DRX supported by the BTS
f37 IoT Load Control 0 - IoT Load Control not supported by the BTS 1 - IoT Load Control supported by the BTS
f38 Paging Command 3 0 - Paging Command 3 not supported by the BTS 1 - Paging Command 3 supported by the BTS

attribute.name: rslF2Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported mandatory RSL functions.
This bitmap is currently unused.

attribute.name: fTxAddrCap
attribute.description: Fixed TX address support indicator.

attribute.name: swVerChg
attribute.description:
Software version change indicator.
Depends on RXMOC: SWVERCHG RXMSC: SWVERCHG

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description:
Holds additional information related to the G12Tg.
Depends on RXMSC: USRLBL1 USRLBL2 USRLBL3

class.name: G31Tg
class.description:
Represents a TG in BTS logical model G31.
A BTS provides GSM radio coverage in one or more sectors. A sector is geographical direction determined by the physical antenna position. A sector can be used by a part of a cell or an entire cell. Attributes of a sector are, among others, antenna direction and lobe width. A sector is served by only one BTS. Each GSM sector is modeled as an independent TG in the BTS logical model G31.

attribute.name: g31TgId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of TG MO and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set to value assigned to the attribute G12Tg.g12TgId.

attribute.name: connectedChannelGroup
attribute.description:
Channel group connected to the TG MO. Defines connection between channel group and the TG MO. A TG from the BTS logical model G31 can have connected CHGRs only from one cell. TG MO cannot be connected to channel group from external cells, that is cells belonging to another BSC.
Depends on RXTCI: CELL CHGR RXTCE: CELL CHGR
attribute.dependencies: The channel groups from one cell can be connected to TGs from one BTS logical model at a time. It is not allowed to connect a G31Tg to a channel group when the attribute ChannelGroup.numReqBpc is set to the system defined limit. Channel group 0 of a cell for which the functionality Extended DRX, set by the attribute IoT.eDrxStatus, is active can only be connected to a TG with the active functionality BTS Soft Synchronization, set by the attribute G31Tf.btsSoftSyncState. The channel group cannot be disconnected due to radio interference recording for the associated cell. The channel group of a cell for which the functionality Reduced BCCH Spectrum, set by attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.sBcchSp, is active, can only be connected to a TG with the active functionality BTS Soft Synchronization, set by the attribute G31Tf.btsSoftSyncState.
attribute.precondition: Channel group state, set by the attribute ChannelGroup.state must be HALTED.

attribute.name: alCoTim
attribute.description:
Time in seconds before the alarm coordination analysis begins for BTS related fault situations. Defines a filter time in seconds that allows the BTS related fault situation to settle before the alarm coordination analysis begins.
Depends on RXALC: ALCOTIM

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TG MO. If more than one blocking is active, then the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: bssWanted
attribute.description:
Wanted BSS release version for the TG MO.
It is used to control possible IWD versions in the negotiation between the BSC and the BTS.
The following values represent possible settings of the attribute that are supported by BSC G22.Q4 release: 0 - IWD versions for the highest possible BSS release shall be achieved. 1610 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G16B) 1611 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G17A) 1615 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G17.Q1) 1625 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G17.Q2) 1730 - BSS G17.Q3 (GSM RAN G17.Q3 with BTS G17.Q3) 1740 - BSS G17.Q4 (GSM RAN G17.Q4 with BTS G17.Q4) 1810 - BSS G18.Q1 (GSM RAN G18.Q1 with BTS G18.Q1) 1820 - BSS G18.Q2 (GSM RAN G18.Q2 with BTS G18.Q2) 1830 - BSS G18.Q3 (GSM RAN G18.Q3 with BTS G18.Q3) 1840 - BSS G18.Q4 (GSM RAN G18.Q4 with BTS G18.Q4) 1910 - BSS G19.Q1 (GSM RAN G19.Q1 with BTS G19.Q1) 1920 - BSS G19.Q2 (GSM RAN G19.Q2 with BTS G19.Q2) 1930 - BSS G19.Q3 (GSM RAN G19.Q3 with BTS G19.Q3) 1940 - BSS G19.Q4 (GSM RAN G19.Q4 with BTS G19.Q4) 2010 - BSS G20.Q1 (GSM RAN G20.Q1 with BTS GBTS01.A01) 2020 - BSS G20.Q2 (GSM RAN G20.Q2 with BTS GBTS01.A03) 2030 - BSS G20.Q3 (GSM RAN G20.Q3 with BTS G20.Q3) 2040 - BSS G20.Q4 (GSM RAN G20.Q4 with BTS G20.Q4) 2110 - BSS G21.Q1 (GSM RAN G21.Q1 with BTS G21.Q1) 2120 - BSS G21.Q2 (GSM RAN G21.Q2 with BTS G21.Q2) 2130 - BSS G21.Q3 (GSM RAN G21.Q3 with BTS G21.Q3) 2140 - BSS G21.Q4 (GSM RAN G21.Q4 with BTS G21.Q4) 2210 - BSS G22.Q1 (GSM RAN G22.Q1 with BTS G22.Q1) 2220 - BSS G22.Q2 (GSM RAN G22.Q2 with BTS G22.Q2) 2230 - BSS G22.Q3 (GSM RAN G22.Q3 with BTS G22.Q3) 2240 - BSS G22.Q4 (GSM RAN G22.Q4 with BTS G22.Q4)
Depends on RXMOC: BSSWANTED
attribute.precondition: The attribute moAdmState must be set to OUT_OF_SERVICE

attribute.name: ccchCmd
attribute.description:
CCCH configuration method used during the radio network configuration process. Defines the CCCH configuration method used during the radio network configuration process when state of equipment is changed. Setting of the attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: CCCHCMD RXMSC: CCCHCMD

attribute.name: confMd
attribute.description:
Configuration method used during the radio network configuration process. Defines the configuration method used during the radio network configuration process. These methods impact the use of recovered MOs in baseband hopping, synthesizer hopping, and mixed mode hopping channel groups.
Depends on RXMOC: CONFMD RXMSC: CONFMD

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Defines the wanted global state of the TG MO.
The actual TG MO state is represented by the attribute moOperState.
Changing of global state for the TG MO provokes the same changing of global state for subordinate MOs. It must be possible to change a global state for each MO in a coherent way, otherwise the command has no effect on any MO. For example, when this attribute is changed to OUT_OF_SERVICE and any of TG subordinates cannot be taken out of service, such TG MO is not taken out of service. When this attribute is changed to DEBLOCKED, then if TG cannot be unblocked, none of the subordinate MO is unblocked.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.disturbances: If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES, during change of this attribute from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED no handover occurs and traffic handled by G31Tg is lost.

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TG MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: rSite
attribute.description:
Defines the identity of the radio site where the TG is located.
Depends on RXMOC: RSITE RXMOI: RSITE RXMSC: RSITE
attribute.precondition: the moAdmState must be OUT_OF_SERVICE

attribute.name: sector
attribute.description:
The name of the GSM sector which corresponds to the TG.
Depends on RXMOI: SECTOR

attribute.name: tgCoord
attribute.description:
Alarm coordination level. Allows coordination of alarms at different levels so that only the highest severity alarm is issued at that level.
Depends on RXALC: TGCOORD

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced blocking indicator.
If this attribute is set to YES during change of G31Tg.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then no handover will occur and traffic handled by G31Tg will be lost.
If the attribute is set to NO during change of G31Tg.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, the blocking order fails if it does not succeed for the subordinate MO.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: imbVamos
attribute.description:
VAMOS allocation usage when RX path imbalance exists or feeders are swapped. Defines if VAMOS allocation is allowed when RX path imbalance exists or feeders are swapped. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: IMBVAMOS RXMSC: IMBVAMOS

attribute.name: g31TgIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description:
Holds additional information related to the G31Tg.
Depends on RXMSC: USRLBL1 USRLBL2 USRLBL3

class.name: Bts
class.description: Contains the data the BSC needs to configure its BTSes. The class itself contains configuration data common for the BTSes. This class also contains instances of the following classes: - G12Tg represents the BTS logical model G12 Transceiver Groups (RBS 2000 and DU radio nodes) - G31Tg represents the BTS logical model G31 Transceiver Groups (Baseband radio nodes) - LapdBundlingGroup represents common configuration of how Abis LAPD Packages are mapped to IP packages; used by G12 model. - PacketSwitchTerminationUnit represents individual IP identities in the BTS; used by G12 model. - SuperChannelGroup represents individual Packet Abis configuration on the Abis interface; used by G12 model.

attribute.name: btsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: bscFSOffset
attribute.description:
BSC Frame Start Offset.
BSC Frame Start Offset is set to delay the start of frame transmission by a specified period of time. Each integer unit for this attribute represents the duration of four quarters of a symbol on the Air interface. This offset is common to all TGs in a BSC. This allows different BSCs within a network to be frame synchronized.
The availability of the attribute values other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=BSCFSOFFSETMSW=BSCFSOFFSETLSW
attribute.disturbances: Change of the BSC Frame Start Offset causes a reconfiguration of all active TGs served by the BSC.

attribute.name: bssRelease
attribute.description:
BSS release version.
It is used to control possible IWD versions in the negotiation between the BSC and the BTS.
The following values represent possible settings of the attribute that are supported by the BSC G22.Q4 release: 121 - BSS 06A 130 - BSS 06B 700 - BSS 07A 710 - BSS 07B 800 - BSS 08A 810 - BSS 08B 900 - BSS 09A 1000 - BSS G10A 1010 - BSS G10B 1110 - BSS G11B 1200 - BSS G12A 1210 - BSS G12B 1300 - BSS G13A (BSS G13B with BTS G13A) 1310 - BSS G13B 1400 - BSS G14A (GSM RAN G14B with BTS G14A) 1410 - BSS G14B (GSM RAN G14B with BTS G14B) 1420 - BSS G14B (GSM RAN G14B with BTS G14B1) 1430 - BSS G14B (GSM RAN G14B with BTS G14B2) 1510 - BSS G15B (GSM RAN G15B with BTS G15B) 1520 - BSS G15B (GSM RAN G15B with BTS G16A) 1610 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G16B) 1611 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G17A) 1615 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G17A.7) 1625 - BSS G16B (GSM RAN G16B with BTS G17.Q2) 1730 - BSS G17.Q3 (GSM RAN G17.Q3 with BTS G17.Q3) 1740 - BSS G17.Q4 (GSM RAN G17.Q4 with BTS G17.Q4) 1810 - BSS G18.Q1 (GSM RAN G18.Q1 with BTS G18.Q1) 1820 - BSS G18.Q2 (GSM RAN G18.Q2 with BTS G18.Q2) 1830 - BSS G18.Q3 (GSM RAN G18.Q3 with BTS G18.Q3) 1840 - BSS G18.Q4 (GSM RAN G18.Q4 with BTS G18.Q4) 1910 - BSS G19.Q1 (GSM RAN G19.Q1 with BTS G19.Q1) 1920 - BSS G19.Q2 (GSM RAN G19.Q2 with BTS G19.Q2) 1930 - BSS G19.Q3 (GSM RAN G19.Q3 with BTS G19.Q3) 1940 - BSS G19.Q4 (GSM RAN G19.Q4 with BTS G19.Q4) 2010 - BSS G20.Q1 (GSM RAN G20.Q1 with BTS GBTS01.A01) 2020 - BSS G20.Q2 (GSM RAN G20.Q2 with BTS GBTS01.A03) 2030 - BSS G20.Q3 (GSM RAN G20.Q3 with BTS G1 SW released along with GRAN G20.Q3) 2040 - BSS G20.Q4 (GSM RAN G20.Q4 with BTS G1 SW released along with GRAN G20.Q4) 2110 - BSS G21.Q1 (GSM RAN G21.Q1 with BTS G1 SW released along with GRAN G21.Q1) 2120 - BSS G21.Q2 (GSM RAN G21.Q2 with BTS G1 SW released along with GRAN G21.Q2) 2130 - BSS G21.Q3 (GSM RAN G21.Q3 with BTS G21.Q3) 2140 - BSS G21.Q4 (GSM RAN G21.Q4 with BTS G21.Q4) 2210 - BSS G22.Q1 (GSM RAN G22.Q1 with BTS G22.Q1) 2220 - BSS G22.Q2 (GSM RAN G22.Q2 with BTS G22.Q2) 2230 - BSS G22.Q3 (GSM RAN G22.Q3 with BTS G22.Q3) 2240 - BSS G22.Q4 (GSM RAN G22.Q4 with BTS G22.Q4)
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=BSSRELEASE

attribute.name: defaultSyncSrc
attribute.description:
Default TF synchronization source for the BTS. If attribute is set to no value, then synchronization source is not controlled by the BSC.
The availability of the attribute values other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=DEFAULTSYNCSRC

attribute.name: exMasterRes
attribute.description:
Automatic Master Reselection activation state.
Indicates whether the support for automatic reselection of Master TG in TG Cluster is activated.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=EXMASTERRES

attribute.name: fCMaxNoPTGLG12
attribute.description:
Maximum number of parallel TG loads at Function Change in BTS logical model G12.
If attribute is set to 0, then no limit is set.
The default value represents the recommended value for the BSC using Serial RP Bus or a mix of Serial RP Bus and Ethernet RP Bus. The recommended value for the BSC using only Ethernet RP Bus is 255.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=FCMAXNOPTGLG12

attribute.name: fCMaxNoPTGUG12
attribute.description:
Maximum number of parallel TG upgrades at Function Change in BTS logical model G12.
If attribute is set to 0, then no limit is set.
Depends on RAEPC PROP=FCMAXNOPTGUG12

attribute.name: mLogDefLev
attribute.description:
Default detail level for the functionality Maintenance Logging.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=MLOGDEFLEV

attribute.name: recCap
attribute.description:
Recovery capacity.
Guaranteed processor capacity that radio network recovery can use after restarts.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=RECCAP

attribute.name: recTime
attribute.description:
Recovery time.
Duration after restart when the increased recovery capacity is allowed.
If attribute is set to 0, then no change in recovery priority takes place.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=RECTIME

attribute.name: regPointProCLd
attribute.description:
Regulation point for Function Change and Program Load.
Specifies the load figure used to determine if a new loading of BTS software can be started.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=REGPOINTPROCLD

attribute.name: rOmtBIpAddr
attribute.description:
BSC IP address for the Remote Operation and Maintenance Terminal over IP connection.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=ROMTBIPADDRMSW=ROMTBIPADDRLSW

attribute.name: rpBusMaxNoSeg
attribute.description:
Maximum number of file segments at loading.
Specifies the maximum number of 230-byte file segments that can be sent to a RP in a 0.5 s period at loading. The value depends on the capacity of the RP Bus on the physical link.
The default value corresponds to Serial RP Bus capacity of 2100 kbps, therefore it represents the recommended value for the BSC using Serial RP Bus, or a mix of Serial RP Bus and Ethernet RP Bus. In the BSC using only Ethernet RP Bus the attribute can be set to the maximum of the range.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=RPBUSMAXNOSEG

attribute.name: findFaultyAntennaData
attribute.description:
Activates the FFAD in the BSC.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFADI RFADE
attribute.statusInformation: Since G21.Q1 release, this attribute is deprecated due to OSS-RC phase out.

attribute.name: findFaultyTransmitAntennaData
attribute.description:
Activates the FFTAD in the BSC.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFTDI RFTDE
attribute.statusInformation: Since G21.Q1 release, this attribute is deprecated due to OSS-RC phase out.

attribute.name: tchCap1
attribute.description:
TCH capability 1.
Specifies the TCH capability with the highest weight during TG configuration. TCH capabilities that are not selected by any of attributes tchCap1, tchCap2, or tchCap3 are given with their own default weights.
If attribute is set to no value, then no TCH capability is selected.
0-63 FR TCH capability is selected.
64-95 HR TCH capability is selected.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TCHCAP1

attribute.name: tchCap2
attribute.description:
TCH capability 2.
Specifies the TCH capability with the second highest weight during TG configuration. TCH capabilities that are not selected by any of attributes tchCap1, tchCap2, or tchCap3 are given with their own default weights. If attribute is set to no value, then no TCH capability is selected.
0-63 FR TCH capability is selected.
64-95 HR TCH capability is selected.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TCHCAP2

attribute.name: tchCap3
attribute.description:
TCH capability 3.
Specifies the TCH capability with the third highest weight during TG configuration. TCH capabilities which are not selected by any of attributes tchCap1, tchCap2, or tchCap3 are given with their own default weights. If attribute is set to no value, then no TCH capability is selected.
0-63 FR TCH capability is selected.
64-95 HR TCH capability is selected.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TCHCAP3

attribute.name: tchCapAA
attribute.description:
TCH capability when additional assignment.
Indicates if special weight is assigned to the presence of additional assignment when determining the TCH capability of equipment during TG configuration. If attribute set to NO, then default weight is assigned which is the same as that given to TCH capabilities not selected by any of attributes tchCap1, tchCap2, or tchCap3.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TCHCAPAA

attribute.name: tchCapSel
attribute.description:
TCH capability selection state.
Indicates whether TCH capability selection is activated. TCH capability selection attempts to select equipment with greater TCH capability in preference to equipment with lower TCH capability when configuring a TG.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TCHCAPSEL

attribute.name: abisDropLevel
attribute.description:
Threshold for high rate for dropped calls on Abis interface.
Sets a threshold for high rate of dropped calls. If the rate is higher than or equal to the specified threshold value, an alarm is raised. If the alarm is issued, the RBLT devices can either still be used for traffic or automatically removed from traffic, depending on value of attribute abisDropNoTraf. The check is performed every three minutes. If attribute is set to no value, then alarm is not raised, independently of the percentage of the dropped calls rate.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=ABISDROPLEVEL
attribute.sideEffects: Change of this attribute can cease the alarm CALL DROP RATE SUPERVISION OF TRANSMISSION DEVICES.

attribute.name: abisDropNoTraf
attribute.description:
RBLT devices ability to traffic seizure.
Defines if RBLT devices, having a high call drop rate, are kept out of traffic seizure.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=ABISDROPNOTRAF
attribute.dependencies: Attribute has effect only if the value of attribute abisDropLevel is in range 10-60.

attribute.name: linkCheckTime
attribute.description:
Timer for stability check of links.
Specifies the time period until the OML is considered as stable. During this stability check time, the information frames are discarded.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=LINKCHECKTIME

attribute.name: tsLoopTest
attribute.description:
Indicates if an automatic loop test is performed.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TSLOOPTEST

attribute.name: ttaLong
attribute.description:
Specifies the Time Alignment Timer when it is long Abis signalling delay.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TTALONG

attribute.name: ttaNormal
attribute.description:
Specifies the Time Alignment Time when it is normal Abis signalling delay.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TTANORMAL

class.name: SuperChannelGroup
class.description:
Contains Super Channel group data for the Abis interface.
