In IPM mode attributes usesPstu, mbwDl, mbwUl must be set, when defining a Super Channel group. In SCM mode attributes usesPstu, mbwDl, mbwUl, ipOv, lDel, jbsUl cannot be set, when defining a Super Channel group.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='modeValueScm' test="((@mode = 1) or (((@mode = 0) and ((not(exists(@usesPstu))) and (not(exists(@mbwDl))) and (not(exists(@mbwUl))) and (not(exists(@ipOv))) and (not(exists(@lDel))) and (not(exists(@jbsUl)))))))">Attributes usesPstu, mbwDl, mbwUl, ipOv, lDel, jbsUl cannot be set when the attribute mode is set to SCM in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='modeValueIpm' test="(((@mode = 1) and (exists(@usesPstu)) and (exists(@mbwDl)) and (exists(@mbwUl))) or (@mode = 0))">Attributes usesPstu, mbwDl, mbwUl are mandatory when the attribute mode is set to IPM in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='modeValueScm' test="((@mode = 1) or (((@mode = 0) and ((not(exists(@usesPstu))) and (not(exists(@mbwDl))) and (not(exists(@mbwUl))) and (not(exists(@ipOv))) and (not(exists(@lDel))) and (not(exists(@jbsUl)))))))">Attributes usesPstu, mbwDl, mbwUl, ipOv, lDel, jbsUl cannot be set when the attribute mode is set to SCM in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='modeValueIpm' test="(((@mode = 1) and (exists(@usesPstu)) and (exists(@mbwDl)) and (exists(@mbwUl))) or (@mode = 0))">Attributes usesPstu, mbwDl, mbwUl are mandatory when the attribute mode is set to IPM in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: superChannelGroupId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of Super Channel group and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RRSGI: SCGR RRSGE: SCGR

attribute.name: usedByG12Tg
attribute.description:
Name of TG connected to SCGR.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: usesPstu
attribute.description:
The PSTU within an STN connected to the SCGR.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RRSGI: PSTU
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute mode, is IPM.
attribute.precondition: The PSTU must be previously defined and must not be connected to another SCGR.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description:
SCGR mode.
Specifies filtering of SCGRs of given mode only among all the defined SCGRs.
Attribute can be set only during SCGR definition.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSGI: MODE

attribute.name: mbwDl
attribute.description:
Maximum downlink bandwidth.
Defines downlink bandwidth that is considered as 100% when calculating thresholds for triggering overload prevention mechanisms.
This attribute, together with the attribute mbwUl and percentage thresholds set for the TG, decide when overload prevention mechanisms are to be activated. There are three mechanisms available: allocating HR calls rather than FR calls, moving from FR to HR for ongoing connections, and reducing the codec set for AMR FR calls. Each of them has separate threshold set per TG. The absolute threshold value is calculated separately for each direction as a percentage threshold multiplied by value of the attribute mbwUl or mbwDl respectively and divided by 100. When current link utilization exceeds in any direction the calculated absolute threshold value for this direction, the relevant mechanism is triggered. If link utilization falls below the threshold, the mechanism is stopped.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSGC: MBWDL RRSGI: MBWDL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute mode, is IPM.

attribute.name: mbwUl
attribute.description:
Maximum uplink bandwidth.
Defines uplink bandwidth that is considered as 100% when calculating thresholds for triggering overload prevention mechanisms.
This attribute, together with the attribute mbwDl and percentage thresholds set for the TG, decide when overload prevention mechanisms are to be activated. There are three mechanisms available: allocating HR calls rather than FR calls, moving from FR to HR for ongoing connections, and reducing the codec set for AMR FR calls. Each of them has separate threshold set per TG. The absolute threshold value is calculated separately for each direction as a percentage threshold multiplied by value of the attribute mbwUl or mbwDl respectively and divided by 100. When current link utilization exceeds in any direction the calculated absolute threshold value for this direction, the relevant mechanism is triggered. If link utilization falls below the threshold, the mechanism is stopped.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSGC: MBWUL RRSGI: MBWUL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute mode, is IPM.

attribute.name: jbsUl
attribute.description:
The size of uplink jitter buffer.
Default value for SCGR mode IPM: 20.
The jitter buffers are used to cater for delay variations while using IP network. The size of the uplink jitter buffer depends on used IP network. The higher possible delay variations, the higher value of this attribute must be set.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSGI: JBSUL RRSGC: JBSUL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute mode, is IPM.

attribute.name: lDel
attribute.description:
LAPD signalling delay.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSGI: LDEL RRSGC: LDEL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute mode, is IPM. Has effect on the system only if the attribute G12Tg.sigDel is set to NORMAL.

attribute.name: ipOv
attribute.description:
Status of the functionality IP overload handling.
Default value for SCGR mode IPM: OFF. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSGC: IPOV RRSGI: IPOV
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute mode, is IPM.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description:
Connection status of the SCGR.
Depends on RRGSP

attribute.name: superChannelGroupIndividual
attribute.description:
Internal individual id.
Depends on RRGSP: ATC

class.name: SuperChannel
class.description:
Contains SC data in the SCGR for Abis interface.
A maximum number of SCs in the BSC depends on the available hardware resources and is determined by the number of PGW and ET RPs, number of contiguous RBLT and RTPGD device pairs, allowed number of HDLC links per PGW RP, number of SCs allowed per PGW RP, and number of SCs allowed per STM-1/OC-3 port of ET RP.
If the SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode is IPM, attributes firstDev and dety cannot be set, when defining an SC. If the SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode is SCM, attributes firstDev and dety must be set, when defining an SC.
The SC cannot be defined or changed if any of the specified RBLT devices are preseized, used by another function, not manually blocked or faulty. The SC cannot be defined or changed if any of the specified ET devices are preseized, used by another function or faulty.

attribute.name: superChannelId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of the SC and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RRSCI: SC RRSCE: SC

attribute.name: usedByG12Trxc
attribute.description:
List of TRXCs connected to this SC.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: numDev
attribute.description:
Number of ET devices or contiguous pairs of RBLT and RTPGD devices.
Values valid for SCGR in SCM mode: For E1 interface: Numeral 1-31 For T1 interface: Numeral 1-24
Values valid for SCGR in IPM mode: 24 - T1 interface for SIU STN 31 - E1 interface for SIU STN
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSCI: NUMDEV RRSCC: NUMDEV

attribute.name: btsPort
attribute.description:
BTS port.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSCI: DCP RRSCC: DCP
attribute.dependencies: The SCs in the same SCGR must be connected to different BTS ports. Attribute can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode, is SCM.

attribute.name: firstDev
attribute.description:
First ET or RBLT device number.
This attribute sets the first RBLT or ET device for SC. Several subsequent devices are used depending on a value of the attribute SuperChannel.numDev.
Attribute can be set to no value only be the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSCI: DEV1 RRSCC: DEV1
attribute.dependencies: This attribute must be set when the SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode, is SCM. Must be set together with the attribute dety. Cannot be set when the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode is set to IPM. Can be changed only if the SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode, is SCM.

attribute.name: dety
attribute.description:
Device type.
This attribute sets the type of RBLT or ET device for SC.
Attribute can be set to no value only be the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRSCI: DEV1 RRSCC: DEV1
attribute.dependencies: This attribute must be set when the SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode, is SCM. Must be set together with the attribute firstDev. Cannot be set when the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode is set to IPM. Can be changed only if SCGR mode, set by the attribute SuperChannelGroup.mode, is SCM. SCs in one SCGR cannot be formed of different types of devices.

attribute.name: superChannelIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description:
Super Channel status.
Depends on RRSCP

class.name: Bsc
class.description: Entry point for the GERAN BSC level configuration. All children MOCs contain the BSC level configuration attributes.

attribute.name: bscId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: bandOperationMode
attribute.description:
Defines if the BSC is in single or in multi BSC Band Operation Mode.
Depends on RLOMC: MODE
attribute.dependencies: BSC Band Operation Mode can be set to MULTI only when gSysType is set to MIXED.
attribute.precondition: Global System Type must be defined.

attribute.name: gSysType
attribute.description:
The global system type of the BSC.
Depends on RLTYI: GSYSTYPE RLTYC: GSYSTYPE RLTYE
attribute.dependencies: Global system type can be set to type other then MIXED only if bandOperationalMode is set to SINGLE.
attribute.precondition: If the global system type is changed to a specific system, the cell system type for the defined cells must match. All cells must be removed before global system type can be deleted.

attribute.name: support8Char
attribute.description:
Number of characters for names, supported by the BSC for the cell, MSC, BSC, and transcoder pool.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=SUPPORT8CHAR

attribute.name: intGeranCellSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the internal GERAN cell file.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=298 NI

attribute.name: extGeranCellSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the external GERAN cell file.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=299 NI
attribute.dependencies: When Market Adaptation M-229 is activated, the value of the attribute can be greater than 4096.

attribute.name: extUtranCellSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the external UTRAN cell file.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=1133 NI
attribute.dependencies: When Market Adaptation M-380 is activated, the value of the attribute can be greater than 4096.

attribute.name: intHoSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the internal handover counter file. It is used for relations where the neighbor cell is internal.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=522 NI

attribute.name: extHoSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the external handover counter file. It is used for relations where the neighbor cell is external.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=523 NI

attribute.name: chgrSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the channel group file.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=1152 NI

attribute.name: utranRelSae
attribute.description:
Controls the size of the UTRAN FDD cell relation file.
Depends on SAAEP: SAE=502 NI
attribute.dependencies: When Market Adaptation M-318 is activated, the value of the attribute can be greater than 32768.

class.name: GeranCell
class.description:
Contains the data needed to configure the internal GERAN cell. The class itself contains the cell identity and state, and the data that has to be configured individually. If an attribute in this class is modified that is also applicable for overlaid cells then the change will also be applied for the overlaid cells in the cell structure.
- ChannelGroup represents a number of channels with the same configuration. - ExternalGeranCellRelation represents a neighbor relation to a cell handled by another BSC. - GeranCellRelation represents a neighbor relation to a cell handled by this BSC. - If the Overlaid subcell object exists then the cell has a subcell structure. Overlaid contains configuration data that may differ from the underlaid subcell. - UtranCellRelation represents a neighbor relation to a cell handled by an RNC.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='bccAndNccSetTogether' test="( (exists(@bcc) and exists(@ncc)) or (not(exists(@bcc)) and not(exists(@ncc))) )">Attributes bcc and ncc must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='bcchNoVerification' test="((@bcchNo ge 128) and (@bcchNo le 251) and (@cSysType = 4)) or (((@bcchNo ge 0) and (@bcchNo le 124) or ((@bcchNo ge 975) and (@bcchNo le 1023))) and (@cSysType = 0)) or ((@bcchNo ge 512) and (@bcchNo le 810) and ((@cSysType = 1) or (@cSysType = 2))) or ((@bcchNo ge 811) and (@bcchNo le 885) and (@cSysType = 1)) or (exists(@cSysType) and not(exists(@bcchNo)))">The value of the attribute bcchNo must be set according to cell system type, set by the attribute cSysType in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='bccAndNccSetTogether' test="( (exists(@bcc) and exists(@ncc)) or (not(exists(@bcc)) and not(exists(@ncc))) )">Attributes bcc and ncc must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='bcchNoVerification' test="((@bcchNo ge 128) and (@bcchNo le 251) and (@cSysType = 4)) or (((@bcchNo ge 0) and (@bcchNo le 124) or ((@bcchNo ge 975) and (@bcchNo le 1023))) and (@cSysType = 0)) or ((@bcchNo ge 512) and (@bcchNo le 810) and ((@cSysType = 1) or (@cSysType = 2))) or ((@bcchNo ge 811) and (@bcchNo le 885) and (@cSysType = 1)) or (exists(@cSysType) and not(exists(@bcchNo)))">The value of the attribute bcchNo must be set according to cell system type, set by the attribute cSysType in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: geranCellId
attribute.description:
Holds the symbolic name of an internal GERAN cell and is also used when identifying the MO.
Value ALL is not allowed. Symbolic name 1 - 7 characters Symbolic name 1 - 8 characters, when Market Adaptation M-110 is activated.
Defining more than 1024 internal cells depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDEI: CELL RLDEE: CELL
attribute.dependencies: Bsc.gSysType attribute must have a value assigned to define internal GERAN cell. 8 character name is allowed when Bsc.support8Char is set to 8.
attribute.precondition: The MO identified by this attribute cannot be deleted if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: dedicatedG12Trxc
attribute.description:
TRXC MO, to which the GeranCell is dedicated.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: dedicatedG12Tx
attribute.description:
TX MO, to which the GeranCell is dedicated.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: baListActive
attribute.description:
ARFCNs for the BCCH to be measured on by active MSs in the cell.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
The maximum number of measurement frequencies can be restricted to 16, 18, 22, or 31 depending on the band, in which the BCCH is defined and the combination of measurement frequency bands.
If Market Adaptation M-085 is activated, the maximum number of measurement frequencies from G1-GSM 900 band in the attributes baListActive and baListIdle must not exceed 22.
Depends on RLMFC: MBCCHNO LISTTYPE RLMFE: MBCCHNO LISTTYPE
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute mrnic is set to YES or the attribute state is set to HALTED, then an update of the measurement frequencies is performed immediately. In this case, the measurement results are not interpreted correctly for a period of time. If the attribute mrnic is set to NO, an update of the measurement frequencies is performed over a period of time and the measurement results are interpreted correctly. It is not possible to remove ARFCN of BCCH of cell from the list when Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.ahoState, is active in the cell. If the attribute Bsc.gSysType is set to MIXED, it is possible to add frequencies in the combination of GSM 800 band, GSM 900 band, and GSM 1800 or GSM 1900 band, but the restrictions apply according to the band in which the BCCH is defined and the combination of measurement frequency bands. If the value of the attribute SonBsc.anrMode is set to UPDATE and the value of the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr is set to ACTIVE, then measurement frequencies can be added and removed by the functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations every day at a predefined time.
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: baListIdle
attribute.description:
ARFCNs for the BCCH to be measured on by idle MSs in the cell.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
The maximum number of measurement frequencies can be restricted to 16, 18, 22, or 31 depending on the band in which the BCCH is defined and the combination of measurement frequency bands.
If Market Adaptation M-085 is activated, the maximum number of measurement frequencies from G1-GSM 900 band in the attributes baListActive and baListIdle must not exceed 22.
Depends on RLMFC: MBCCHNO LISTTYPE RLMFE: MBCCHNO LISTTYPE
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute mrnic is set to YES or the attribute state is set to HALTED then the updating of the measurement frequencies is performed immediately. In this case, the measurement results are not interpreted correctly for a period of time. If the attribute mrnic is set to NO the updating of the measurement frequencies is performed over a period of time and the measurement results are interpreted correctly. It is not possible to remove ARFCN of BCCH of cell from the list when Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.ahoState, is active in the cell. If the attribute Bsc.gSysType is set to MIXED, it is possible to add frequencies in the combination of GSM 800 band, GSM 900 band, and GSM 1800 or GSM 1900 band, but the restrictions apply according to the band in which the BCCH is defined and the combination of measurement frequency bands. If the value of the attribute SonBsc.anrMode is set to UPDATE, the value of the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr is set to ACTIVE, and the value of the attribute SonBsc.anrIdleBaListOptimization is set to ON, then measurement frequencies can be added and removed by the functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations every day at a predefined time.
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: bcc
attribute.description:
Base station color code part of the BSIC.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC: BSIC
attribute.dependencies: Must be set together with the attribute ncc.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute state must be set to HALTED. It is not allowed to change this attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the BSC.

attribute.name: bcchNo
attribute.description:
ARFCN for BCCH.
An ARFCN already defined for a dedicated channel cannot be given. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
When Market Adaptation M-091 is activated and the BCCH is defined in the primary band, frequencies in channel group 0 are allowed from both P and G1 bands.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
Depends on RLDEC: BCCHNO
attribute.dependencies: A channel group can be made up of frequencies from different GSM 900 bands. The possibility to change this attribute depends on other frequencies in channel group 0. If the BCCH is defined in the primary band, other frequencies in channel group 0 are allowed only in the primary band.
attribute.precondition: Attribute baListIdle must be set to no value before setting this attribute for the first time or changing it from primary band to G1-band or from G1-band to primary band. It is not allowed to change this attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the BSC.

attribute.name: ncc
attribute.description:
PLMN color code part of the BSIC.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC: BSIC
attribute.dependencies: Must be set together with the attribute bcc.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute state must be set to HALTED. It is not allowed to change the attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the BSC.

attribute.name: cSysType
attribute.description:
Cell system type, that defines the frequency band, supported by the cell.
Depends on RLDEI: CSYSTYPE
attribute.dependencies: The attribute must be set to the same value as Bsc.gSysType, if Bsc.gSystype is other than MIXED. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1800, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1900, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1800 exists in the BSC. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1800, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1900, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1800 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1800, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1900, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1800 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1800, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1900, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1800 exists in the BSC.

attribute.name: xRange
attribute.description:
Extended range cell.
Sets the support of the traffic at a distance of more than 35 km between the MS and the BTS.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDEC: XRANGE
attribute.dependencies: This attribute cannot be set to YES when the value of the attribute Dtm.dtmState is set to YES, or when CHGR 0 is located in the OL subcell, or when the value of the attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.mc is set to ON, or when the value of the attribute ChannelGroup.ecbcch is set to YES. This attribute cannot be set to NO, if one of the following attributes: IdleModeAndPaging.abMaxTa, Mobility.maxTa, or LocatingUrgency.taLim is greater than 63. When Market Adaptation M-056 is activated, this attribute cannot be set to NO, if one of the following attributes: IdleModeAndPaging.abMaxTa, Mobility.maxTa, or LocatingUrgency.taLim is greater than 64. When GeranCell.xRange is changed to YES, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to NCOMB, ChannelGroup.ccch is increased, ChannelGroup.sdcch is decreased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions. Also when GeranCell.xRange is changed to NO, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to COMB or COMBC, ChannelGroup.ccch is decreased, ChannelGroup.sdcch is increased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions.
attribute.sideEffects: Change of the attribute xRange automatically triggers recalculation of ChannelGroup.numReqEgprsBpc or ChannelGroup.numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if any of the attributes ChannelGroup.numReqEgprsBpc or ChannelGroup.numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, the attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: bcchType
attribute.description:
Combinations of wanted logical channels on the frequency and time slot defined for the cells BCCH.
Depends on RLDEC: BCCHTYPE
attribute.dependencies: It is not allowed to set the attribute to COMBC, if the frequency hopping status, set by attribute ChannelGroup.hop, is ON and the ARFCNs in Channel Group 0 are not included in the IE Cell Channel Description. It is also not allowed to set the attribute to the value other than NCOMB when the value of the attribute ChannelGroup.ccch for this cell is greater than 1. The value of the attribute bcchType must be set to COMB or COMBC when the value of the attribute IdleModeAndPaging.agBlk is in range from 0 to 2. When GeranCell.bcchType is changed to NCOMB, GeranCell.xRange is changed to YES, ChannelGroup.ccch is increased, ChannelGroup.sdcch is decreased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions. Also when GeranCell.bcchType is changed to COMB or COMBC, GeranCell.xRange is changed to NO, ChannelGroup.ccch is decreased, ChannelGroup.sdcch is increased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: fnOffset
attribute.description:
Frame number offset.
Defines the time shift from the FN generator in the BTS expressed as a number of TDMA frames.
Depends on RLDEC: FNOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: It is not possible to change this attribute, when the attribute Son.aFlp or Son.aIrcT is set to ACTIVE.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: cgi
attribute.description:
Cell global identity.
The CGI must be unique, that is, cannot be the same for another cell in the BSC. The maximum number ofLAs in the BSC is 512. An LA is defined by values of the information units mcc, mnc and lac specified in this attribute.
Expressed as "mcc-mnc-lac-ci" where:
mcc Mobile country code, digit string 000 - 999
mnc Mobile network code, digit string 00 - 99, 000 - 999
lac Location area code, numeral 1 - 65535
ci Cell identity, numeral 0 - 65535
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC: CGI
attribute.dependencies: The size of the mnc part of this attribute depends on the value of the attribute CoreNetwork.mncDigitHand.
attribute.sideEffects: The change of the LA for a cell influences CS and PS cell paging arrays.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: geranCellIndividual
attribute.description: internal individual id.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description:
The current state of the cell which indicates if the cell carries traffic or not.
Some operations on the cell are possible to do only when the cell state is set to HALTED.
Depends on RLSTC
attribute.dependencies:
To set this attribute to ACTIVE, attributes bcc, ncc, cgi, bcchNo, PowerControlDownlink.bsPwrBDec, PowerControlDownlink.bsPwrTDec, IdleModeAndPaging.nccPerm must be set, all CHGRs must be connected to TGs and have ChannelGroup.dchNo set. To set this attribute to ACTIVE when a subcell structure is defined, attributes MobilityOverlaid.lol, MobilityOverlaid.taOl, PowerControlOverlaidDownlink.bsPwrTDec must be set. To activate the cell when the functionality GSM MOCN is used, the following conditions must be fulfilled: - All active cells in one LA must have the same shared status. - The MSC NRI length must be the same for all defined MSCs. - NSEI NRI length must be the same for all defined NSEs. - NRI value must be assigned to all MSCs that are in state different from inactive. - NRI value must be assigned to all NSEs that are in state active. - NRI value must be unique for each MSC. - NRI value must be unique for each NSE. - No more than 5 PLMNs can be defined in the BSC. - No more than 4 PLMNs can be defined in the BSC while activating a shared cell that has mobile country code and mobile network code of CGI that differs from any of existing PLMN mobile country code and mobile network code. - PLMN relations must be defined for all MSCs that are in state different from inactive. - PLMN relations must be defined for all NSEs that are in state active. - If any PLMN relation to NSE is defined in the BSC, all PLMNs defined in existing active cells without the functionality GSM MOCN with GPRS support activated must have a PLMN relation to NSE. PLMN is defined by means of a cell when its mobile country code and mobile network code corresponds to mobile country code and mobile network code of CGI of the cell.
If any PLMN relation to NSE is defined in the BSC, the following conditions must be fulfilled to activate the non-shared cell with GPRS support activated: - The PLMN with PLMN operator identity corresponding to mobile country code and mobile network code of CGI of the cell must have a PLMN relation to NSE. - PLMN relations are defined for all NSEs that are in state active. - All PLMNs defined in existing active cells without the functionality GSM MOCN with GPRS support activated must have a PLMN relation to NSE. PLMN is defined by means of a cell when its mobile country code and mobile network code corresponds to mobile country code and mobile network code of CGI of the cell.
Attribute change may prolong up to several hours, for example, when a BTS software program load is ongoing.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute to HALTED affects ongoing traffic.

attribute.name: mrnic
attribute.description:
Measurement results not interpreted correctly.
If attribute is set to YES or the cell state is halted, then the updating of the measurement frequencies is performed immediately. If attribute is set to NO, the updating of the measurement frequencies is performed over a period of time and the measurement results are interpreted correctly.
Depends on RLMFC: MRNIC RLMFE: MRNIC

attribute.name: irc
attribute.description:
State of the functionality Interference Rejection Combining in the cell.
When Interference Rejection Combining is activated in the cell, receiver performance is improved when interference is high. Without the BTS configured for receiver diversity, Interference Rejection Combining does not have any effect.
Depends on RLDEC: IRC
attribute.dependencies: It is not allowed to set the attribute to value OFF if the attribute Vamos.vamosState is set to ON.

attribute.name: eDrxStatus
attribute.description:
Activation status of Extended DRX in the cell.
Depends on RLEDI: EDRXSTATUS RLEDE: EDRXSTATUS
attribute.statusInformation: Since G18.Q3 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute IoT.eDrxStatus.
attribute.dependencies: To set this attribute to ACTIVE, the BTS Soft Synchronization must be active in TG, that is connected to channel group 0 of the current cell.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description:
Holds additional information related to the cell.
Depends on RLDPC: USRLBL1 USRLBL2 USRLBL3

attribute.name: connectedBaRecording
attribute.description:
Describes the BaRecording MO, to which GeranCell is connected.
Depends on RABDP: CELL

attribute.name: connectedRiRecording
attribute.description:
Describes the RiRecording MO, to which GeranCell is connected.
Depends on RARDP: CELL

attribute.name: connectedMrRecording
attribute.description:
Describes the MrRecording MO, to which GeranCell is connected.
Depends on RAMDP: CELL

attribute.name: rac
attribute.description:
Routing Area Code.
Depends on RLDEC: RAC
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute can be changed only when Market Adaptation M-334 is activated.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, the attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

class.name: ChannelGroup
class.description:
The ChannelGroup represents a number of channels which share the same configuration. If the cell has a subcell structure, the Channel Group belongs to either the Overlaid or Underlaid subcell.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='ccchOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@ccch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@ccch)) or exists(@ccch)) and @channelGroupId = '0' ) )">Attribute ccch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='eacPrefOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@eacPref)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@eacPref)) or exists(@eacPref)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute eacPref can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='tnBcchOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@tnBcch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@tnBcch)) or exists(@tnBcch)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute tnBcch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='tn7BcchOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@tn7Bcch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@tn7Bcch)) or exists(@tn7Bcch)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute tn7Bcch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='tscNotForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@tsc)) and @channelGroupId = '0') or ( (not(exists(@tsc)) or exists(@tsc)) and @channelGroupId != '0') )">Attribute tsc cannot be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='bandNotForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@band)) and @channelGroupId = '0') or ( (not(exists(@band)) or exists(@band)) and @channelGroupId != '0') )">Attribute band cannot be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='ecbcch' test="( (not(exists(@ecbcch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@ecbcch)) or exists(@ecbcch)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute ecbcch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='ccchOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@ccch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@ccch)) or exists(@ccch)) and @channelGroupId = '0' ) )">Attribute ccch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='eacPrefOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@eacPref)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@eacPref)) or exists(@eacPref)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute eacPref can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='tnBcchOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@tnBcch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@tnBcch)) or exists(@tnBcch)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute tnBcch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='tn7BcchOnlyForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@tn7Bcch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@tn7Bcch)) or exists(@tn7Bcch)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute tn7Bcch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='tscNotForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@tsc)) and @channelGroupId = '0') or ( (not(exists(@tsc)) or exists(@tsc)) and @channelGroupId != '0') )">Attribute tsc cannot be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='bandNotForChGr0' test="( (not(exists(@band)) and @channelGroupId = '0') or ( (not(exists(@band)) or exists(@band)) and @channelGroupId != '0') )">Attribute band cannot be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='ecbcch' test="( (not(exists(@ecbcch)) and @channelGroupId != '0') or ( (not(exists(@ecbcch)) or exists(@ecbcch)) and @channelGroupId = '0') )">Attribute ecbcch can only be set for Channel Group 0 in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: channelGroupId
attribute.description:
Holds the channel group identity and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RLDGI: CHGR RLDGE: CHGR
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute defaultSpid must be set to YES in the same transaction to change the value of the attribute defaultAction. It is not possible to delete the channel group 0 from the cell.
attribute.precondition: When Market Adaptation M-262 is active, the MO identified by this attribute cannot be created or deleted with the value of the attribute band equal to GSM1800 or GSM1900, if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell.

attribute.name: connectedG12Tg
attribute.description:
G12Tg MO connected to CHGR.
Depends on RXTCP

attribute.name: connectedG31Tg
attribute.description:
G31Tg MO connected to CHGR.
Depends on RXTCP

attribute.name: dedicatedG12Trxc
attribute.description:
TRXC MO, to which the ChannelGroup is dedicated.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: dedicatedG12Tx
attribute.description:
TX MO, to which the ChannelGroup is dedicated.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: bsPwrT
attribute.description:
BS output power for non-BCCH RF channel numbers for a CHGR.
Depends on RLCPC: BSPWRT
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q2 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute bsPwrTDec.
attribute.dependencies: When set to no value, the value of the attribute PowerControlDownlink.bsPwrT or PowerControlDownlinkOverlaid.bsPwrT is used, depending on the attribute scType. The current BTS version may have specific restrictions. See the documentation for the current BTS version.
attribute.sideEffects: If the attribute is set, attributes PowerControlDownlink.bsPwrT and PowerControlOverlaidDownlink.bsPwrT are not used.

attribute.name: band
attribute.description:
Supported frequency band for the CHGR.
If the attribute is not set, then the BCCH frequency band is set for the CHGR during CHGR definition. For CHGR 0 band is automatically assigned to a value set in the attribute GeranCell.cSysType.
Attribute can be set only during channel group definition. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
The availability of the attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDGI: BAND
attribute.dependencies: The frequency band within the same cell or subcell must be the same or GSM800 together with GSM900. It is not allowed to use frequency bands GSM 1800 and GSM 1900 at the same time in the BSC.

attribute.name: bccd
attribute.description:
Broadcast cell channel description.
Indicates if the defined ARFCNs in the channel group are included in IE Cell Channel Description or not.
Maximum 64 ARFCNs are allowed in the IE Cell Channel Description. If the ARFCNs in the channel group are included in the IE Cell Channel Description, the total number or range of the defined ARFCNs in the IE Cell Channel Description must not exceed the following limitations:
- If a CBCH is part of the IE Cell Channel Description, maximum 32 ARFCNs are allowed.
- If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 112, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 22. However, if all ARFCNs are defined in the P-band, maximum 64 ARFCNs are allowed.
- If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 256, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 18.
- If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 512, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 16.
- If ARFCN 0 is included in the IE Channel Description, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 17.
- If Market Adaptation M-085 is activated and frequencies from G1-GSM 900 band are included in the IE Cell Channel Description, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 22.
Depends on RLCHC: BCCD
attribute.dependencies: Attribute is only used by the BSC if the attribute ChannelGroup.hop is set to ON for the channel group.

attribute.name: cbch
attribute.description:
Indicates if the CBCH is included in the SDCCH.
YES CBCH is included in one of the SDCCH/8s for a cell or a channel group
NO No SDCCH/8 for a cell or a channel group includes CBCH
Depends on RLCCC: CBCH
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set to YES if the attribute ChannelGroup.sdcch is set to 0, the attribute ChannelGroup.hop is set to ON, the attribute ChannelGroup.bccd is set to NO, the attribute GeranCell.bcchType is set to COMBC. Can be set to YES if the defined ChannelGroup.tn contains 0, 1, 2, or 3 and IdleModeAndPaging.agBlk is set to 1 or greater. The maximum number of SDCCHs and CBCH for the cell must not be exceeded.
attribute.sideEffects: Change of the attribute cbch automatically triggers recalculation of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if any of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.

attribute.name: eacPref
attribute.description:
EGPRS access on CCCH.
Indicates whether a TRX capable of an EGPRS Packet Channel Request is chosen for BCCH and CCCH in the cell.
NO BCCH and CCCH are configured on a TRX not capable of EGPRS Packet Channel Request if this is available. EPCR on CCCH is not allowed. YES BCCH and CCCH are configured on a TRX capable of EGPRS Packet Channel Request if this is available. EPCR on CCCH is allowed.
Default value for channel group 0 is YES. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLBDC: EACPREF
attribute.dependencies: Only valid for channel group 0. When functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation is activated in the cell, the priority of the time slot is dependent on quality basis and this attribute has no impact on BSC configuration.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: dchNo
attribute.description:
Absolute radio frequency channel number. A maximum of 32 ARFCNs per CHGR are allowed. A maximum of 31 ARFCNs for CHGR 0 are allowed.
The same ARFCN can be defined in more than one CHGR. The BCCH frequency must be unique in the cell. A maximum of 127 ARFCNs are allowed per one cell. A CHGR can consist of frequencies from different GSM 900 bands. Adding ARFCNs to CHGR 0 depends on the band, where the BCCH is located, in the cell. If the BCCH frequency is defined in the P-band, other ARFCNs in CHGR 0 are only allowed in the P-band. When Market Adaptation M-091 is activated, frequencies in CHGR 0 are allowed from both P-band and G1-band, if BCCH is defined in the P-band.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
Depends on RLCFI: DCHNO RLCFE: DCHNO
attribute.dependencies:
If the last ARFCN is removed, the CHGR must be halted. It is not possible to delete an ARFCN, if the number of SDCCH/8s, set by the attribute sdcch, or the number of required BPCs, set by the attribute numReqBpc, cannot be configured. If the ARFCNs in the CHGR are included in the IE Cell Channel Description, the total number or range of the defined ARFCNs in the IE Cell Channel Description must not exceed the following limitations: A maximum of 64 ARFCNs are allowed in the IE Cell Channel Description. If a CBCH is the part of the IE Cell Channel Description, a maximum of 32 ARFCNs are allowed. If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 112, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 22. However, if all ARFCNs are defined in the P-band, a maximum of 64 ARFCNs are allowed. If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 256, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 18. If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 512, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 16. If ARFCN 0 is included in the IE Cell Channel Description, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 17.
If the ARFCNs in the CHGR are not included in the IE Cell Channel Description, the total number or range of defined ARFCNs in the CHGR must not exceed the following limitations: If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 112, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 22. However, if all ARFCNs are defined in the P-band, a maximum of 32 ARFCNs are allowed. If the range of the ARFCNs exceeds 256, the number of ARFCNs is restricted to 18.
The current BTS version can have specific restrictions. See the documentation for current BTS version. It is possible to delete BCCH frequency by modification of the attribute dchNo in CHGR0 only if modification of the attribute GeranCell.bcchNo is done in the same transaction. When ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, GeranCell.xRange is changed to YES, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to NCOMB, ChannelGroup.ccch is increased, ChannelGroup.sdcch is decreased, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions. Also when ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, GeranCell.xRange is changed to NO, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to COMB or COMBC, ChannelGroup.ccch is decreased and ChannelGroup.sdcch is increased, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions.
It is not possible to set dchNo of Channel Group 0 to the previous value of GeranCell.bcchNo when modification of the both attributes is done in the one transaction.

attribute.name: hop
attribute.description:
Hopping indicator for TCH and SDCCH for the CHGR.
Depends on RLCHC: HOP
attribute.dependencies: The attribute cannot be set to ON, if the attribute bccd is set to NO and the attribute cbch is set to YES.
attribute.disturbances: If the value of the attribute state is ACTIVE, when this attribute is changed, then the TX will restart and calls might be dropped.

attribute.name: hsn
attribute.description:
Hopping sequence number.
Changes a pseudo random generator used by the MS and the network to select the next frequency, within the CHGR, to hop to. A pseudo randomly generated system default value is assigned to this attribute at CHGR definition.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLCHC: HSN
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only used by the BSC, if the attribute hop is set to ON for the CHGR. It is not possible to change this attribute, when the attribute Son.aFlp is set to ACTIVE.

attribute.name: maio
attribute.description:
Mobile allocation index offset.
The MAIOs form a list that describes the order in which they are to be allocated for all hopping groups in the channel group.
When attribute is set to no value, default MAIO list is used. The default MAIO list consists of all even MAIOs lower than the number of frequencies in the channel group followed by all odd MAIOs lower than the number of frequencies in the channel group. The MAIOs in each part are sorted in ascending order. For example, the default MAIO list for a channel group containing four frequencies is 0, 2, 1, 3, that is, even numbers in ascending order followed by odd numbers in ascending order.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLCHC: MAIO
attribute.dependencies: Attribute is used only if attribute ChannelGroup.hop is set to ON. It is not possible to change this attribute, when the attribute Son.aFlp is set to ACTIVE.

attribute.name: numReqBpc
attribute.description:
Number of required BPCs in a channel group.
0 - System defined limit, number of BPCs depends on the number of frequencies in the channel group.
255 - 0 BPCs, no BPC is required in the channel group. This parameter value is only allowed for temporary use. This value must be changed before BSC upgrade or cell moving procedure.
Depends on RLBDC: NUMREQBPC
attribute.dependencies: Value 0 is not allowed for a channel group connected to a TG MO in BTS logical model G31. Connected TG MO in BTS logical model G31 is represented by the attribute ChannelGroup.connectedG31Tg. The number of ARFCNs set by the attribute dchNo is sufficient for configuration of required number of carriers. When ChannelGroup.numReqBpc is changed, GeranCell.xRange is changed to YES, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to NCOMB, ChannelGroup.ccch is increased and ChannelGroup.sdcch is decreased, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions. Also when ChannelGroup.numReqBpc is changed, GeranCell.xRange is changed to NO, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to COMB or COMBC, ChannelGroup.ccch is decreased and ChannelGroup.sdcch is increased, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions.
attribute.sideEffects: Change of the attribute numReqBpc automatically triggers recalculation of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if any of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.

attribute.name: numReqCs3Cs4Bpc
attribute.description:
Number of required BPCs in the channel group that can support GPRS CS-3 or CS-4.
255 - All remaining traffic BPCs in a channel group, after requirement on number of EGPRS capable BPCs is fulfilled, are required as CS3/CS4 capable.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLBDC: NUMREQCS3CS4BPC
attribute.dependencies: The attribute numReqCs3Cs4Bpc cannot be set to the value 255 when the attribute numReqBpc is set to 0.

attribute.name: numReqEgprsBpc
attribute.description:
The total number of required BPCs in the channel group that can support EGPRS2-A and EGPRS.
255 - All traffic BPCs in a channel group are required as EGPRS capable.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLBDC: NUMREQEGPRSBPC
attribute.dependencies: The attribute numReqEgprsBpc cannot be set to the value 255 when the attribute numReqBpc is set to 0.
attribute.sideEffects: When the attribute numReqEgprsBpc is set to 255, then the value the attribute numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is calculated as there are no required GPRS CS-3 or CS-4 BPCs. When the attribute numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255, change of the attribute numReqEgprsBpc to value other than 255 triggers recalculation of the attribute numReqCs3Cs4Bpc.

attribute.name: odpdchLimit
attribute.description:
On-demand PDCH limit. Sets a percentage value of number of unblocked TCH BPCs in the channel group that can be allocated as on-demand PDCHs.
Depends on RLGAC: ODPDCHLIMIT

attribute.name: sas
attribute.description:
The allocation strategy for TCH single slot allocation.
Depends on RLGAC: SAS
attribute.dependencies: When the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.qtaStatus, is ACTIVE in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: scType
attribute.description:
Subcell type identifier.
It is not allowed to move a CHGR from one subcell to the other, if the frequency bands in the subcells are different, with the exception of the frequency bands GSM800 and GSM900 which are allowed to coexist. The possibility to move set attribute to OL for CHGR 0 depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDGI: SCTYPE RLDGC: SCTYPE
attribute.dependencies: A channel group cannot be moved between subcells if the cell is an extended range cell. It is not possible to change this attribute, when the attribute GeranCell.xRange is set to YES for extended range cell.
attribute.disturbances: If the attribute state is set to ACTIVE and hopping is in progress, then a temporary loss of channels may occur, while reconfiguration takes place.
attribute.precondition: Can be set only if the MO OverlaidSubcell exists below the parent GeranCell.

attribute.name: sdcch
attribute.description:
Sets the required number of SDCCH/8s.
By default, one SDCCH/8 without CBCH is provided in the cell if the attribute GeranCell.bcchNo is defined and the attribute GeranCell.bcchType is set to NCOMB.
The possibility to have up to two or up to four SDCCH/8s per TRX depends on commercial agreements. The number of TRXs is calculated as the number of required BPCs divided by eight.
Depends on RLCCC: SDCCH
attribute.dependencies: This attribute cannot be changed for CHGR 0 if a TN, that is required by an SDCCH/8 is also required by a CCCH and there is no available frequency to configure an SDCCH/8s on. Cannot set the value so that the attributes numReqCs3Cs4Bpc and numReqEgprsBpc cannot be configured. The maximum number of SDCCHs is reduced by one, if the attribute GeranCell.bcchType is set to COMB or COMBC. It is possible to have a maximum of 32 SDCCH/8s per cell. This number is reduced by one, if an SDCCH/4 is defined for the cell. This attribute does not influence the CHGR configuration when the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by the attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.qtaStatus, is active in the cell. When ChannelGroup.sdcch is decreased, GeranCell.xRange is changed to YES, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to NCOMB, ChannelGroup.ccch is increased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions. Also when ChannelGroup.sdcch is increased, GeranCell.xRange is changed to NO, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to COMB or COMBC, ChannelGroup.ccch is decreased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions.
attribute.sideEffects: Change of the attribute sdcch automatically triggers recalculation of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if any of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.

attribute.name: tn
attribute.description:
TN required for SDCCH.
SDCCH/8s are configured from lowest TN up to highest allowed TN for each carrier in the CHGR. For CHGR 0, the BCCH and CCCH are always placed on TN0, TN2, TN4 and TN6, starting from TN0. For CHGR 0, CCCHs on TN2, TN4, TN6 have higher priority than SDCCH/8.
To minimize the consequences of hardware error in BTS equipment, it is recommended to use TNs other than zero.
Depends on RLCCC: TN
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute scType is set to UL and attribute the GeranCell.xRange is set to YES, then the TNs can contain only even values. When the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.qtaStatus, is active in a cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: tn7Bcch
attribute.description:
EGPRS support on TN7 on BCCH frequency.
Defines if TN 7 on the BCCH frequency can be configured with TCHs supporting GPRS only or EGPRS2-A, EGPRS, and GPRS. Default value for channel group 0 is EGPRS. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLBDC: TN7BCCH
attribute.dependencies: Only valid for channel group 0.

attribute.name: tsc
attribute.description:
Training sequence code.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDTC: TSC
attribute.dependencies: It is not allowed to change the attribute for the CHGR 0. It is not possible to change the attribute when the attribute Son.aFlp is set to ACTIVE or the attribute Son.aIrct is set to ACTIVE.
attribute.takesEffect: CHGR state is set to ACTIVE.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, the attribute state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: hopType
attribute.description:
Frequency hopping type.
The availability of attribute values, other than DEFAULT, if the TG in the BTS logical model G12 is connected to the CHGR, depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLCHC: HOPTYPE

attribute.name: eTchTn
attribute.description:
Preferred TNs for EGPRS and EGPRS2-A TCHs in the channel group.
If the number of EGPRS BPCs is higher than the channel group capacity, that is the number of dedicated E-TCH TNs, represented by this attribute, multiplied by the number of ARFCNs, then the EGPRS2-A BPCs and EGPRS BPCs are configured on other TNs following the basic TN priority order 6, 5, 7, 4, 3, 2, 1.
Depends on RLBDC: ETCHTN
attribute.dependencies: When functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.qtaStatus is active in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior. The value of the attribute is 0, 2, 4, or 6 when XRANGE = YES.

attribute.name: ccch
attribute.description:
Required number of CCCHs.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLCCC: CCCH
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only for CHGR 0. Cannot be changed, if a TN, that is required by an SDCCH/8, is also required by a CCCH and there is no available frequency to configure an SDCCH/8s on. Cannot set the values of the attributes ccch and sdcch so that the number of required BPCs that support Enhanced GPRS, EGPRS phase 2 level A or GPRS Coding Scheme 3, or GPRS Coding Scheme 4 cannot be configured. When the attribute GeranCell.bcchNo is defined, the value of this attribute for CHGR 0 is set to 1 by the system. Values, greater than 1, can only be set if the value of the attribute GeranCell.bcchType is NCOMB. When ChannelGroup.ccch is increased, GeranCell.xRange is changed to YES, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to NCOMB, ChannelGroup.sdcch is decreased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions. Also when ChannelGroup.ccch is decreased, GeranCell.xRange is changed to NO, GeranCell.bcchType is changed to COMB or COMBC, ChannelGroup.sdcch is increased and ChannelGroup.numReqBpc or ChannelGroup.dchNo is changed, there is no possibility to form the proper order of commands therefore such change has to be split into at least two transactions.
attribute.sideEffects: Change of the attribute ccch automatically triggers recalculation of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if any of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, the attribute GeranCell.bcchNo must be defined for the cell.

attribute.name: tnBcch
attribute.description:
EGPRS support on TN1, TN3 and TN5 on the BCCH frequency.
Defines if the TNs TN1, or TN1 and TN3, or TN1, TN3, and TN5 on the BCCH frequency can be configured with TCHs supporting EGPRS2-A, EGPRS, and GPRS, or GPRS only. The possible TNs are TN1, TN3, and TN5 depending on the number of required CCCHs in the cell. Default value for channel group 0 is EGPRS.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLBDC: TNBCCH
attribute.dependencies: Only valid for channel group 0.

attribute.name: numReqE2aBpc
attribute.description:
The number of required BPCs in the channel group that can support EGPRS2-A.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLBDC: NUMREQE2ABPC
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q4 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.
attribute.dependencies: numReqE2aBpc cannot exceed the value of the attribute ChannelGroup.numReqEgprsBpc.

attribute.name: exChgr
attribute.description:
Indicates if adaptive SDCCH/8s are allowed in the CHGR.
Depends on RLACC: INCL EXCL

attribute.name: channelGroupIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description:
CHGR state.
Depends on RLSTC
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute to HALTED affects ongoing traffic.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, the value of the attribute connectedG12Tg or connectedG31Tg must be set.

attribute.name: ecbcch
attribute.description:
Indicates if Extended Coverage Broadcast Control Channel is required in channel group.
Default value for channel group 0 is NO. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLCCC: ECBCCH
attribute.dependencies: Only valid for CHGR 0. EC-BCCH combination is required on TN1 if the attribute is set to YES. It is not possible to set EC-BCCH required for an extended range cell or for a cell which has its channel group connected to a TG in transmission mode TDM.
attribute.sideEffects: Change of the attribute ecbcch automatically triggers recalculation of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if any of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc or numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.

attribute.name: bcchPwrDif
attribute.description:
Defines the BTS output power difference between BCCH and TCHs.
Depends on RLCPC: BCCHPWRDIF
attribute.dependencies: This attribute has effect on the system only if the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.ahoState, is active in the cell.

attribute.name: rhfs
attribute.description:
ARFCNs removed from original HFS by the functionality GSM Automatic Shared Carrier.
Depends on RLASP

attribute.name: bsPwrTDec
attribute.description:
BS output power for non-BCCH RF channel numbers for a CHGR with a decimal part of the value.
This attribute is interpreted as a fixed-point number, which means that 436 corresponds to 43.6 dBm and 430 to 43 dBm.
Depends on RLCPC: BSPWRT
attribute.dependencies: When set to no value, the value of the attribute PowerControlDownlink.bsPwrTDec or PowerControlDownlinkOverlaid.bsPwrTDec is used, depending on the attribute scType.
attribute.sideEffects: If the attribute is set, attributes PowerControlDownlink.bsPwrTDec and PowerControlOverlaidDownlink.bsPwrTDec are not used.

class.name: OverlaidSubcell
class.description:
Represents an overlaid subcell formed by dividing two channel groups.
The separation is achieved by using different frequency reuse patterns. If this object exists, a subcell structure is defined in the cell. When subcell structure is defined this MO holds configuration attributes for the overlaid subcell and parent GeranCell MO holds configuration for underlaid subcell. If a subcell structure is defined for an extended range cell then the underlaid subcell will have extended range and the overlaid subcell will have normal range.

attribute.name: overlaidSubcellId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
The availability of attribute values for extended range cells depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDSI RLDSE

attribute.name: overlaidSubcellIndividual
attribute.description: internal id.

class.name: ExternalGeranCell
class.description: Contains configuration data for the external GERAN cell.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='bccAndNccSetTogether' test="( (exists(@bcc) and exists(@ncc)) or (not(exists(@bcc)) and not(exists(@ncc))) )"> Attributes bcc and ncc must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='bcchNoVerification' test="((@bcchNo ge 128) and (@bcchNo le 251) and (@cSysType = 4)) or (((@bcchNo ge 0) and (@bcchNo le 124) or ((@bcchNo ge 975) and (@bcchNo le 1023))) and (@cSysType = 0)) or ((@bcchNo ge 512) and (@bcchNo le 810) and ((@cSysType = 1) or (@cSysType = 2))) or ((@bcchNo ge 811) and (@bcchNo le 885) and (@cSysType = 1)) or (exists(@cSysType) and not(exists(@bcchNo)))">The value of the attribute bcchNo must be set according to cell system type, set by the attribute cSysType in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='bccAndNccSetTogether' test="( (exists(@bcc) and exists(@ncc)) or (not(exists(@bcc)) and not(exists(@ncc))) )"> Attributes bcc and ncc must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id='bcchNoVerification' test="((@bcchNo ge 128) and (@bcchNo le 251) and (@cSysType = 4)) or (((@bcchNo ge 0) and (@bcchNo le 124) or ((@bcchNo ge 975) and (@bcchNo le 1023))) and (@cSysType = 0)) or ((@bcchNo ge 512) and (@bcchNo le 810) and ((@cSysType = 1) or (@cSysType = 2))) or ((@bcchNo ge 811) and (@bcchNo le 885) and (@cSysType = 1)) or (exists(@cSysType) and not(exists(@bcchNo)))">The value of the attribute bcchNo must be set according to cell system type, set by the attribute cSysType in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: externalGeranCellId
attribute.description:
Holds the symbolic name of an external GERAN cell and is also used when identifying the MO.
Value ALL is not allowed. Symbolic name 1 - 7 characters Symbolic name 1 - 8 characters, when Market Adaptation M-110 is activated.
Defining more than 2048 external cells depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDEI: CELL EXT RLDEE: CELL
attribute.dependencies: 8 character name is allowed when Bsc.support8Char is set to 8.

attribute.name: aw
attribute.description:
Assignment to worse cell switch.
Depends on RLLOC: AW

attribute.name: bcc
attribute.description:
Base station color code part of the BSIC.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC BSIC
attribute.dependencies: Should be set together with attribute ExternalGeranCell.ncc.
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the BSC.

attribute.name: bcchNo
attribute.description:
ARFCN for BCCH.
ARFCN, already defined for a dedicated channel, cannot be given.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
Depends on RLDEC BCCHNO
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the BSC.

attribute.name: bsPwr
attribute.description:
Base station effective radiated power.
Specifies the base station ERP for the absolute RF channel in the cell defined for BCCH.
Depends on RLLOC: BSPWR
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: bsRxMin
attribute.description:
Lower limit of signal strength. Specifies the minimum required signal strength, received at the reference point, to consider the cell as a possible candidate for a handover.
Depends on RLLOC: BSRXMIN
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: bsRxSuff
attribute.description:
Specifies the sufficient signal strength for path loss criteria in base station.
Depends on RLLOC: BSRXSUFF
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: bsTxPwr
attribute.description:
Base station effective radiated power.
Specifies the base station ERP for the absolute RF channels in the cell or subcell not defined for BCCH.
Depends on RLLOC: BSTXPWR
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: cSysType
attribute.description:
Cell system type.
The frequency band supported by the ExternalGeranCell.
Depends on RLDEI: CSYSTYPE
attribute.dependencies: The attribute must be set to the same value as gSysType if gSystype is other than MIXED. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1800, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1900, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1800 exists in the BSC. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1800, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. The attribute must not be set to value GSM1900, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1800 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1800, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1900, if a cell with cell system type GSM 1800 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1800, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1900 exists in the BSC. When Market Adaptation M-262 is activated, the attribute can be set to value GSM1900, if a channel group with frequency band GSM 1800 exists in the BSC.

attribute.name: extPen
attribute.description:
MSC and target BSC support penalty handling state.
Depends on RLLOC: EXTPEN
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: fastMsReg
attribute.description:
Fast moving MS regulation state.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLLHC: FASTMSREG

attribute.name: layer
attribute.description:
HCS cell layer.
Each cell belongs to a layer. Layer 1 has the highest priority. It is recommended that the layers are defined in increasing order connected to the size of the area the cells cover.
For HCS with 3 layers and no HCS band: Numeral 1-3 For HCS with 8 layers and 8 HCS bands: Numeral 1-8
The availability of this attribute value depends on commercial agreements relating to optional feature Multi-Layer Hierarchical Cell Structures.
Depends on RLLHC: LAYER

attribute.name: layerHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when changing cell layers.
Indicates when the signal strength hysteresis is used for cell ranking within each HCS band.
Depends on RLLHC: LAYERHYST

attribute.name: layerThr
attribute.description:
Signal strength threshold when changing cell layers.
Indicates when the signal strength threshold is used for ranking within each HCS band.
Depends on RLLHC: LAYERTHR

attribute.name: missnM
attribute.description:
Maximum number of consecutive missing measurements.
Specifies the maximum number of consecutive missing measurements, for serving or a neighboring cell, permitted before all old measurements are considered invalid.
The attribute is given as a number of SACCH periods (480ms).
Depends on RLLOC: MISSNM
attribute.statusInformation: Since G18.Q4 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute missNM.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: msTxPwr
attribute.description:
Maximum transmit power for MS on connection.
Default values: For GSM 800: 39 For GSM 900: 39 For GSM 1800: 30 For GSM 1900: 30
The attribute value ranges: For GSM 800: Numeral 13 - 43 in steps of 2 For GSM 900: Numeral 13 - 43 in steps of 2 For GSM 1800: Numeral 4 - 30 in steps of 2 For GSM 1900: Numeral 4 - 30 in steps of 2
The attribute value ranges, when Market Adaptation M-254 is activated: For GSM 800: Numeral 5 - 39 in steps of 2 For GSM 900: Numeral 5 - 39 in steps of 2 For GSM 1800: Numeral 0 - 30 in steps of 2 For GSM 1900: Numeral 0 - 30 in steps of 2
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLCPC: MSTXPWR

attribute.name: msRxMin
attribute.description:
Lower limit of signal strength in MS.
Specifies the minimum required signal strength, received at the MS in a given cell, to consider the cell as a possible candidate for a handover.
Depends on RLLOC: MSRXMIN
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: msRxSuff
attribute.description:
Specifies the sufficient signal strength for path loss criteria in MS.
Depends on RLLOC: MSRXSUFF
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

attribute.name: ncc
attribute.description:
PLMN color code part of the BSIC.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC: BSIC
attribute.dependencies: Should be set together with ExternalGeranCell.bcc attribute.
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the BSC.

attribute.name: pHcsThr
attribute.description:
Packet HCS threshold.
Defines the HCS signal strength threshold and is used to calculate HCS_THR for the cell. When the cell is a serving cell the formula pHcrThr(s) - layerHyst(s) is used, and when the cell is a neighboring cell the formula pHcrThr (n) + layerHyst(n) is used. (s) and (n) indicate whether the values for the serving or neighboring cell are applied.
When attribute is set to no value it means that broadcast value from procedure Locating Emulation is used.
Depends on RLPSC: PHCSTHR
attribute.dependencies: A PBCCH has to be allocated in the cell in order to apply the functionality of this attribute. The value of the attribute pHcsThr must be even.
attribute.precondition: Optional features Packet Specific Cell Plan and Multi-Layer Hierarchical Cell Structures must be available in the system.

attribute.name: pLayer
attribute.description:
Packet cell layer.
Used to calculate the PRIORITY_CLASS for the cell using the formula 8 - pLayer.
When attribute is set to no value it means that broadcast value from procedure Locating Emulation is used.
Depends on RLPSC: PLAYER
attribute.dependencies: A PBCCH has to be allocated in the cell in order to apply the functionality of this attribute.
attribute.precondition: Optional features Packet Specific Cell Plan and Multi-Layer Hierarchical Cell Structures must be available in the system.

attribute.name: pSsTemp
attribute.description:
Signal strength penalty when cell layer change.
Depends on RLLHC: PSSTEMP

attribute.name: pTimTemp
attribute.description:
Penalty time when handover to different cell layer.
Depends on RLLHC: PTIMTEMP

attribute.name: scho
attribute.description:
SDCCH handover switch.
Indicates if handover on SDCCH is allowed.
Depends on RLLOC: SCHO

attribute.name: rac
attribute.description:
Routing area code.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDEC RAC

attribute.name: rimNaCc
attribute.description:
Inter BSC NACC support state.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDEC RIMNACC

attribute.name: dfi
attribute.description:
Distinctive feature information.
Changes restriction for sending information regarding distinctive functionalities in the message 48.008 HANDOVER REQUIRED to a neighboring BSC.
Non-Ericsson BSC nodes can misinterpret these elements.
Depends on RLDEC: DFI

attribute.name: cgi
attribute.description:
Cell global identity.
The CGI must be unique, that is, cannot be the same for another external cell in the BSC.
Expressed as "mcc-mnc-lac-ci" where:
mcc Mobile country code, digit string 000 - 999
mnc Mobile network code, digit string 00 - 99, 000 - 999
lac Location area code, numeral 1 - 65535
ci Cell identity, numeral 0 - 65535
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC: CGI

attribute.name: externalGeranCellIndividual
attribute.description: Internal Id.

attribute.name: missNM
attribute.description:
Maximum number of consecutive missing measurements.
Specifies the maximum number of consecutive missing measurements, for serving or a neighboring cell, permitted before all old measurements are considered invalid.
The attribute is given as a number of SACCH periods (480 ms).
Depends on RLLOC: MISSNM
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not used to evaluate external cell by locating algorithm, if the evaluation is done in an internal cell, which supports the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.

class.name: ExternalUtranCell
class.description: Contains configuration data for the external UTRAN cell.

attribute.name: externalUtranCellId
attribute.description:
Holds the symbolic name of an external UTRAN cell and is also used when identifying the MO.
Value ALL is not allowed. Symbolic name 1 - 7 characters Symbolic name 1 - 8 characters, when Market Adaptation M-110 is activated.
Defining more than 2048 external cells depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDEI: CELL EXT UTRAN RLDEE: CELL
attribute.dependencies: It is not allowed to define external UTRAN cell when optional functionality GSM to TD-SCDMA Cell Reselection is available. 8 character name is allowed when Bsc.support8Char is set to 8.

attribute.name: fddArfcn
attribute.description:
Defines the ARFCN for an UTRAN FDD cell.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC FDDARFCN

attribute.name: mrsl
attribute.description:
Minimum Reported Signal Level for CPICH Ec/No.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
0 MRSL < -24 dB
1 -24 dB <= MRSL < -23.5 dB
.
.
.
48 -0.5 dB <= MRSL < 0 dB
49 MRSL >= 0 dB
Depends on RLDEC MRSL

attribute.name: scrCode
attribute.description:
Scrambling code for an UTRAN FDD cell.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLDEC SCRCODE

attribute.name: externalUtranCellIndividual
attribute.description: Internal Id.

attribute.name: utranId
attribute.description:
UTRAN FDD cell identity.
Sets the identity of a UTRAN FDD cell.
