Expressed as "mcc-mnc-lac-ci-rncid" where:
mcc Mobile country code, digit string 000 - 999
mnc Mobile network code, digit string 00 - 99, 000 - 999
lac Location area code, numeral 1 - 65535
ci Cell identity, numeral 0 - 65535
rncid Radio network controller identity, numeral 0 - 4095
Depends on RLDEC: UTRANID
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute utranId must be unique in the set of UTRAN external cells within the BSC.

class.name: G31Scf
class.description:
SCF MO in the BTS logical model G31. SCF MO provides services within one sector TG that are not allocated to individual TRXC, for example sector-level capabilities. It provides signaling links to TF and AT MOs. It also handles the maintenance of the SCF itself. The SCF is addressed by TEI in Layer 2 signaling.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

attribute.name: g31ScfId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the SCF MO. If more than one blocking is active, then the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the SCF MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: sectorIdentity
attribute.description:
GSM sector identity reported by BTS.
Depends on RXBSP: SECTORIDTXT

attribute.name: radioNodeIdentity
attribute.description:
Radio node identity reported by BTS.
Depends on RXBSP: IDENTITYTXT

attribute.name: sectorName
attribute.description:
GSM sector name reported by BTS.
Depends on RXBSP: SECTOR

attribute.name: g31ScfIndividual
attribute.description: internal individual id.

class.name: G31Tf
class.description:
TF in the BTS logical model G31. The TF MO provides the complete functionality necessary to configure, monitor, and maintain synchronization in the TG.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

attribute.name: g31TfId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TF MO. If more than one blocking is active, then the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: fsOffset
attribute.description:
Frame start offset from the nominal start position of a TDMA frame.
Defines a delay of frame transmission from the nominal start position of a Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA) frame. Each integer unit represents the duration of one quarter of a symbol on the air interface. When attribute is set to no value it means that frame synchronization is turned off.
The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: FSOFFSET RXMSC: FSOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute fsOffset cannot be set to no value when the value of the attribute btsSoftSyncState is set to ON. The value of the attribute btsSoftSyncState can be set to ON only when the attribute fsOffset is set.
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TF MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: sectorClusterIdentity
attribute.description:
Sector cluster identity reported by BTS.
Depends on RXMOP: SCLUSTERID

attribute.name: btsSoftSyncState
attribute.description:
BTS Soft Synchronization functionality administrative state. The reconfiguration of the TF is triggered if the TF is enabled during each change of the attribute value. The availability of the attribute value ON depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXTSI: RXTSE
attribute.dependencies: Can be set to ON only if the attribute fsOffset is set and the attribute Bsc.SonBsc.hoMtd is set to YES. Cannot be set to OFF if superior TGs are connected to CHGR0 of a cell, where the functionality Extended DRX, set by the attribute IoT.eDrxStatus, is active. Cannot be set to OFF if a superior TG is connected to channel group of a cell, where the functionality Reduced BCCH Spectrum, set by the attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.rBcchSp, is activated.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute to OFF may affect traffic.

attribute.name: alignType
attribute.description:
Type of synchronization alignment used during the synchronization process. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXTSI: ALIGNTYPE RXTSC: ALIGNTYPE
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if attribute btsSoftSyncState is equal to ON.

attribute.name: g31TfIndividual
attribute.description: internal individual id.

class.name: G31At
class.description:
AT in the BTS logical model G31. An AT MO it provides the complete functionality to configure transport data and receive TRXC addressing information. AT MO instance has O&M communication with a BSC on Layer 3, through a SCF MO.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

attribute.name: g31AtId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the AT MO. If more than one blocking is active, then the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the AT MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: crc32
attribute.description:
CRC 32 bit checksum usage. Defines if CRC 32 checksum is calculated according to ISO 3309 and included in IP packets. This setting applies to both uplink and downlink.
Depends on RXMOC: CRC32
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: ipOv
attribute.description:
IP overload handling activation status. The IP overload handling is used to minimize disturbances on the link between the BSC and BTS for BTS logical model G31, when an IP link is used.
Depends on RXMOC: IPOV RXMSC: IPOV

attribute.name: mbwDl
attribute.description:
Maximum bandwidth, downlink. Defines downlink bandwidth in kbps that is considered as 100% when calculating thresholds for triggering overload prevention mechanisms.
Depends on RXMOC: MBWDL RXMSC: MBWDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: mbwUl
attribute.description:
Maximum bandwidth, uplink. Defines uplink bandwidth in kbps that is considered as 100% when calculating thresholds for triggering overload prevention mechanisms.
Depends on RXMOC: MBWUL RXMSC: MBWUL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: jbPta
attribute.description:
BTS jitter buffer depth for P-GSL timing advance. Specifies the delay time in the BTS buffer of the data packets. The value means the maximum jitter delay the BTS can manage in downlink and is expressed in milliseconds. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: JBPTA
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: mcltDl
attribute.description:
Maximum LAPD bundling time for bundling group, downlink. Specifies the maximum bundling time in milliseconds for the uplink buffer. During this period data are collected and sent in one IP packet.
Depends on RXMOC: MCLTDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: mcltUl
attribute.description:
Maximum LAPD bundling time for bundling group, uplink. Defines the maximum bundling time in milliseconds for the uplink buffer. During this period data are collected and sent in one IP packet.
Depends on RXMOC: MCLTUL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: mplsDl
attribute.description:
Maximum LAPD bundling time for bundling group, downlink. Specifies the maximum size of the downlink bundling buffer in bytes.
Depends on RXMOC: MPLSDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: mplsUl
attribute.description:
Maximum LAPD bundling time for bundling group, uplink. Specifies the maximum size of the uplink bundling buffer in bytes.
Depends on RXMOC: MPLSUL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: ovlTh
attribute.description:
Overload threshold for transmission links. Defines the overload threshold, expressed in tenth parts of a percent, for transmission links. This threshold is a fraction of the lost packets out of the total sent packets.
Depends on RXMOC: OVLTH RXMSC: OVLTH
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: sigDel
attribute.description:
Signaling delay for LAPD data links established on physical connection between the BSC and the BTS.
Depends on RXMOC: SIGDEL
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpDlCs
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP downlink packets with speech type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with speech type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize downlink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpDlCsd
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP downlink packets with CS data type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with CS data type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize downlink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpDlOml
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP downlink packets with OML type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with OML type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize downlink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpDlPs
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP downlink packets with PS type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with PS type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize downlink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpDlRsl
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP downlink packets with RSL type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with RSL type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize downlink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpUlCs
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP uplink packets with speech type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with speech type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize uplink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpUlOml
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP uplink packets with OML type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with OML type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize uplink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpUlCsd
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP uplink packets with CS data type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with CS data type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize uplink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpUlPs
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP uplink packets with PS type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with PS type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize uplink packets in the IP network.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dscpUlRsl
attribute.description:
DSCP value used by PGW for IP uplink packets with RSL type of service. Defines DSCP value used by PGW when sending IP packets with RSL type of service, to the remote peer. Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize uplink packets in the IP network. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: SAPI DSCPDL
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.
attribute.precondition: TG administrative state, set by the attribute G31Tg.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sdHraAbisThrWb
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR allocation threshold for packet Abis for AMR-WB capable MSs. Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR HR and HR channels, in case of high transmission load on packet Abis. This threshold is used in AMR-WB capable cells forMSs that support AMR-WB. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The allocation of HR channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXATC: SDHRAABISTHRWB
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: sdFrMaAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic FR/HR mode adaptation threshold for packet Abis. Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping packing of FR and AMR FR channels and for starting and stopping of move from FR to HR channels, including AMR, in case of high transmission load on packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The packing and moving of channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The packing and moving is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXATC: SDFRMAABISTHR
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: sdHrMaAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR to FR mode adaptation threshold for packet Abis. Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping of move from HR to FR channels, including AMR, in case of low transmission load on packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The moving of channels due to low usage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the value determined by this attribute. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXATC: SDHRMAABISTHR
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: sdAmrRedAbisThr
attribute.description:
AMR FR with reduced codec allocation threshold for packed Abis. Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR FR channels with reduced codec set, in case of high transmission load on a packed Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packed Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The allocation of these channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXATC: SDAMRREDABISTHR
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: sdHraAbisThr
attribute.description:
Dynamic HR allocation threshold for packet Abis. Defines a threshold value for starting and stopping the allocation of AMR HR and HR channels, in case of high transmission load on packet Abis. The threshold value is expressed as percentage counted as the number of HDLC packets transmitted through the packet Abis divided by the maximum number of HDLC packets that can be transmitted within the timeframe. The allocation of HR channels due to shortage of packet Abis resources starts when the number of transmitted HDLC packets exceeds the threshold value and ends when the number of transmitted HDLC packets falls below the value determined by this attribute. The allocation is stopped when the threshold value is set to 100. The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXATC: SDHRAABISTHR
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG and traffic loss.

attribute.name: g31AtIndividual
attribute.description: internal individual id.

class.name: LapdBundlingGroup
class.description:
Contains LAPD bundling group data.
LAPD bundling group with lapdBundlingGroupId equal to 0 is defined automatically by the system. Modification or deletion of LAPD bundling group with lapdBundlingGroupId equal to 0 is prohibited.

attribute.name: lapdBundlingGroupId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of the group of LAPD frames and is also used when identifying the MO.
LAPD bundling group with lapdBundlingGroupId equal to 0 is defined automatically by the system. Modification or deletion of LAPD bundling group 0 is prohibited.
Values between 1 and 255 could be used for LapdBundlingGroup Id.
Depends on RRBGI: LBG RRBGE: LBG

attribute.name: usedByPstuWithRslSapi
attribute.description:
List of PSTUs with RSL SAPI connected to LAPD bundling group.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: dscpDl
attribute.description:
DSCP used by PSTU within the STN for downlink packets with certain SAPI.
Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize downlink packets in the IP network.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: DSCPDL RRBGC: DSCPDL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: dscpUl
attribute.description:
DSCP used by PSTU within the STN for uplink packets with certain SAPI.
Each DSCP value defines a separate QoS class and is used to prioritize uplink packets in the IP network.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: DSCPUL RRBGC: DSCPUL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: crc32
attribute.description:
Cyclic Redundancy Check 32 bit.
Specifies if the Cyclic Redundancy Check 32 checksum is calculated according to ISO 3309 and included in IP packets. This setting applies to both uplink and downlink.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: CRC32 RRBGC: CRC32
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: mcltDl
attribute.description:
The maximum LAPD bundling time for the downlink buffer.
During this period data are collected and sent in one IP packet.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: MCLTDL RRBGC: MCLTDL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: mcltUl
attribute.description:
The maximum LAPD bundling time for the uplink buffer.
During this period data are collected and sent in one IP packet.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: MCLTUL RRBGC: MCLTUL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: mplsDl
attribute.description:
The maximum LAPD bundling size for the downlink buffer.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: MPLSDL RRBGC: MPLSDL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: mplsUl
attribute.description:
The maximum LAPD bundling size for the uplink buffer.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: MPLSUL RRBGC: MPLSUL
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: ovlTh
attribute.description:
The overload threshold for transmission links.
This threshold is a fraction of the lost packets out of the total sent packets.
If the lost packets percentage in uplink or downlink exceeds the threshold set by this attribute, actions are taken to decrease traffic level in the affected CHGRs. When the percentage of lost packets falls below the threshold, traffic level in the affected CHGRs is starting to increase. The thresholds trigger overload actions only if the traffic sessions contain speech data, CS data or GPRS data.
Default values: For LAPD bundling group 0: 1000 For LAPD bundling groups 1-255: 25
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRBGI: OVLTH RRBGC: OVLTH
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed only if no PSTU is assigned to the current LAPD bundling group. Cannot be changed for LAPD bundling group 0.

attribute.name: usedByPstuWithSpchSapi
attribute.description:
List of PSTU with speech SAPI connected to LAPD bundling group.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: usedByPstuWithCsSapi
attribute.description:
List of PSTUs with CS SAPI connected to LAPD bundling group.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: usedByPstuWithGprsSapi
attribute.description:
List of PSTUs with GPRS/EGPRS SAPI connected to LAPD bundling group.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: usedByPstuWithOmlSapi
attribute.description:
List of PSTUs with OML SAPI connected to LAPD bundling group.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: lapdBundlingGroupIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

class.name: PacketSwitchTerminationUnit
class.description:
This MOC represents the PSTU within the STN.
The PSTU is an object within BSC that represents a part of STN responsible for handling of one TG. During definition of the PSTU, one of the attributes rslLbg, spchLbg, csLbg, gprsLbg, omlLbg must be set.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='PstuCreation' test="(exists(@rslLbg) or exists(@spchLbg) or exists(@csLbg) or exists(@gprsLbg) or exists(@omlLbg))">One of the attributes rslLbg, spchLbg, csLbg, gprsLbg, or omlLbg must be set during PSTU definition in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='PstuCreation' test="(exists(@rslLbg) or exists(@spchLbg) or exists(@csLbg) or exists(@gprsLbg) or exists(@omlLbg))">One of the attributes rslLbg, spchLbg, csLbg, gprsLbg, or omlLbg must be set during PSTU definition in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: packetSwitchTerminationUnitId
attribute.description:
Holds the name of the PSTU within the STN and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RRPTI: PSTU RRPTE: PSTU

attribute.name: rslLbg
attribute.description:
LAPD bundling group for RSL SAPI.
By default, LAPD bundling group 0 is connected.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RRPTI: LBG SAPI=0 RRPTC: LBG SAPI=0

attribute.name: usedBySuperChannelGroup
attribute.description:
SCGR, connected to the PSTU.
Depends on RRGSP

attribute.name: spchLbg
attribute.description:
LAPD bundling group for speech SAPI.
By default, LAPD bundling group 0 is connected.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RRPTI: LBG SAPI=10 RRPTC: LBG SAPI=10

attribute.name: csLbg
attribute.description:
LAPD bundling group for CS SAPI.
By default, LAPD bundling group 0 is connected.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RRPTI: LBG SAPI=11 RRPTC: LBG SAPI=11

attribute.name: gprsLbg
attribute.description:
LAPD bundling group for GPRS/EGPRS SAPI.
By default, LAPD bundling group 0 is connected.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RRPTI: LBG SAPI=12 RRPTC: LBG SAPI=12

attribute.name: omlLbg
attribute.description:
LAPD bundling group for OML SAPI.
By default, LAPD bundling group 0 is connected.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RRPTI: LBG SAPI=62 RRPTC: LBG SAPI=62

attribute.name: rslLbgStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the LAPD bundling group for RSL SAPI.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: spchLbgStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the LAPD bundling group for speech SAPI.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: csLbgStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the LAPD bundling group for CS SAPI.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: omlLbgStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the LAPD bundling group for OML SAPI.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: gprsLbgStatus
attribute.description:
Status of the LAPD bundling group for GPRS/EGPRS SAPI.
Depends on RRPTP

attribute.name: pstuIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

class.name: G12Is
class.description:
Represents an IS MO in the BTS logical model G12.
Provides switching capability within the TG by setting up connections between DCPs. The IS MO is capable of switching on a combination of 16 kbps, 32 kbps, and 64 kbps at any given time.

attribute.name: g12IsId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the IS MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the IS MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the IS MO.
The actual IS MO state is stored in moOperState.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: For changing of moAdmState from OUT_OF_SERVICE the parent G12Cf moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced IS MO blocking indication.
If the attribute G12Is.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Is.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12IsIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: dcpGroupCap
attribute.description: DCP group capacity array.

class.name: G12Con
class.description: Represents a CON MO in the BTS logical model G12. Provides the functionality for the distribution of signaling information from concentrated links sharing Abis paths on to un-concentrated links, each terminated by a TRXC.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='dcpEndLesserThatDcpBegin' test='@dcpBegin lt @dcpEnd'>The value of the attribute dcpBegin must be less than the value of the attribute dcpEnd in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='dcpEndLesserThatDcpBegin' test='@dcpBegin lt @dcpEnd'>The value of the attribute dcpBegin must be less than the value of the attribute dcpEnd in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: g12ConId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the CON MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the CON MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the CON MO.
The actual CON MO state is stored in G12Con.moOperState.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Con.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change the attribute from OUT_OF_SERVICE the parent G12Cf.moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced CON MO blocking indication.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: dcpEnd
attribute.description:
End of DCP range used for connection to the LAPD concentrator.
Attribute cannot be changed once owning MO is created. Note: In case when attribute value needs to be changed, owning MO should be removed and created with new attribute value. This must be performed in two different transactions: first, CON MO should be removed, then new CON MO with required attribute value must be created.
Attribute cannot be set to value which is used by G12Trxc.dcpSignalling on any TRXC MO within parent TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd of any TRXC MO within parent TG MO.
The availability of this attribute value range depends on commercial agreement.
Depends on RXMOI: DCP
attribute.dependencies: If a superior TG is in the transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is TDM then a total number of 24 consecutive DCPs must be given by means of G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd attributes, value range of dcpEnd is 23..255. If a superior TG is in the transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM then a total number of 232 consecutive DCPs must be given by means of G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd attributes, value range of dcpEnd is 487..1023.

attribute.name: dcpBegin
attribute.description:
Start of DCP range used for connection to the LAPD concentrator.
Attribute cannot be changed once owning MO is created. Note: In case when attribute value needs to be changed, owning MO should be removed and created with new attribute value. This must be performed in two different transactions: first, CON MO should be removed, then new CON MO with required attribute value must be created.
Attribute cannot be set to value which is used by G12Trxc.dcpSignalling on any TRXC MO within parent TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd of any TRXC MO within parent TG MO.
The availability of this attribute value range depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI: DCP
attribute.dependencies: If a superior TG is in the transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is TDM then a total number of 24 consecutive DCPs must be given by means of G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd attributes, value range of dcpBegin is 0..232. If a superior TG is in the transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM then a total number of 232 consecutive DCPs must be given by means of G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd attributes, value range of dcpBegin is 256..792.

attribute.name: g12ConIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: dcpCap1
attribute.description: Supported DCP numbers possible to use for connection to the LAPD concentrator part 1.

attribute.name: dcpCap2
attribute.description: Supported DCP numbers possible to use for connection to the LAPD concentrator part 2.

attribute.name: dcpCap3
attribute.description: Supported DCP numbers possible to use for connection to the LAPD concentrator part 3.

class.name: G12Dp
class.description:
Represents a DP MO in the BTS logical model G12.
An associated supervision object in each of the PCM systems terminating in TG. Reports on transmission faults and supervision of transmission quality are carried over the Abis O&M interface. That signaling is described using MO DP. Deletion of the DP MO will lead to blocking and deletion of DIP device connected to the DP MO.

attribute.name: g12DpId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of DP MO and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: dev
attribute.description:
Logical device used to connect the MO DP to digital path supervision functions.
Only devices of the following type can be used: RXODPI.
Attribute cannot be changed once owning MO is created. Note: In case when attribute value needs to be changed, owning MO should be removed and created with new attribute value. This must be performed in two different transactions: first, DP MO should be removed, then new DP MO with required attribute value must be created.
1-13 characters expressed as dety-n. Where: dety Device type, identifier 1 - 7 characters n Device number, numeral 0 - MAX
The value MAX is determined by the SAE in the device owning block. Usually SAE 500. For details, see Application Information for appropriate block.
Example: RXODPI-2.
Depends on RXMOI: DEV
attribute.dependencies: The same device cannot be connected to a different G12Dp MO.
attribute.precondition: DIP MO must be created, see Operational Instruction Radio X-ceiver Administration, Digital Path, Connect.

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the DP MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the DP MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the DP MO.
Defines the wanted global state of the DP MO. The actual DP MO state is stored in moOperState.
If the attribute G12Dp.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change the attribute from OUT_OF_SERVICE the parent G12Cf.moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced DP MO blocking indication.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Dp.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12DpIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: crcCap
attribute.description: Status of the BTS PCM Supervision with CRC-4.

attribute.name: abisDcp
attribute.description: DCP numbers possible to be used as the termination point in the BTS for the Abis path.

attribute.name: dlCasCap
attribute.description: Downlink cascading for the DP.

class.name: G12Tf
class.description:
Represents a TF MO in the BTS logical model G12.
Provides functionality to configure, monitor, and maintain synchronization in the TG.
To delete this MO, if the attribute tfMode is set to MASTER, SLAVE, or UNCONDITIONAL_SLAVE, the attribute btsSoftSyncState must be set to OFF.

attribute.name: g12TfId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: tfMode
attribute.description:
TF synchronization mode.
Changes the mode of the TF in the TG. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI RXMOC RXMSC
attribute.dependencies: The attribute can be set only if the attribute btsSoftSyncState is set to OFF. The attribute cannot be set to STANDALONE, if the TF superior TG is connected to the TG cluster, which is set by the attribute G12Tg.clusterId. It is not allowed to set this attribute to MASTER for more than one TF within the same logical TG cluster. If the functionality BTS Soft Synchronization, set by the attribute btsSoftSyncState, is used in the TG, this attribute can be set to MASTER or STANDALONE only if the attribute fsOffset is set.

attribute.name: syncSrc
attribute.description:
Timing function synchronization source in the BSC.
If attribute value DEFAULT is set, then the synchronization source that is supported by the BTS becomes the synchronization source for the TF. If attribute value INTE is set, then the RBS selects the best suitable timing unit as source for the TF synchronization.
The availability of attribute values INTE, INTI, PCM depend on commercial agreements.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: SYNCSRC RXMOC: SYNCSRC RXMSC: SYNCSRC
attribute.dependencies: If attribute G12Mctr.mixedMode is ON and G12Tf.fsOffSet is OFF then the attribute G12Tf.syncSrc cannot be set to INTE. Attribute cannot be set to INTI if the attribute G12Tf.fsOffset is set.

attribute.name: tfComp
attribute.description:
TF compensation value.
The distribution delay between the master TG and slave TG, plus own TG TX chain delay, minus the master TG TX chain delay.
Value 32767 means that TF compensation value is configured from OMT within the function TG Synchronization. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI RXMOC RXMSC
attribute.dependencies: If a TF, configured with attribute G12Tf.tfMode set to SLAVE, belongs to a logical TG cluster, which is defined by the attribute G12Tg.ClusterId of superior TG, then the attribute G12Tf.tfComp can only be set to value 32767. If a TF, configured with attribute G12Tf.tfMode set to UNCONDITIONAL_SLAVE, belongs to a logical TG cluster, the attribute G12Tf.tfComp must be set. If a TF belongs to a notional TG cluster, the attribute G12Tf.tfComp must be set. The value of the attribute tfComp must be set to no value when the attribute tfMode is set to MASTER or STANDALONE. The value of the attribute tfComp must be set when the attribute tfMode is set to SLAVE or UNCONDITIONAL_SLAVE.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute value may affect traffic.

attribute.name: fsOffset
attribute.description:
Frame start offset from the nominal start position of a TDMA frame.
Defines a delay of frame transmission from the nominal start position of a TDMA frame. Each integer unit represents the duration of one quarter of a symbol on the air interface. When attribute is set to no value it means that frame synchronization is turned off.
The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI RXMOC RXMSC
attribute.dependencies: Can be set to no value only if G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState is equal to OFF. Combination of attribute G12Tf.fsOffset with attribute G12Tf.syncSrc equal INTI is not allowed. If attribute G12Mctr.mixedMode is ON and and G12Tf.syncSrc is INTE then the attribute G12Tf.fsOffset cannot be set to no value. Attribute cannot be set, if superior G12Tg MO belongs to the TG cluster, set by the attribute G12Tg.clusterId. In such case, TF is frame synchronized to the cluster. Attribute must be set, if G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState is set to OFF and G12Tf.tfMode is set to MASTER or STANDALONE.
attribute.disturbances: Could trigger reconfiguration in the BTS that can result in restart of the TG, which may cause loss of traffic.

attribute.name: btsSoftSyncState
attribute.description:
State of functionality BTS Soft Synchronization for a TG MO in the BTS logical model G12.
The availability of attribute value ON depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXTSI RXTSE
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if the attribute tfMode is set to STANDALONE or MASTER. Can be set to ON only if the attribute G12Tf.fsOffset is set and the attribute Bsc.SonBsc.hoMtd is set to YES. Cannot be set to OFF if a superior TG is connected to CHGR0 of a cell, where the functionality Extended DRX, set by the attribute IoT.eDrxStatus, is activated. Cannot be set to ON for the TG in the notional TG clusters. Cannot be set to OFF if a superior TG is connected to channel group of a cell, where the functionality Reduced BCCH Spectrum, set by the attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.rBcchSp, is activated.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute to OFF may affect traffic.
attribute.sideEffects: The reconfiguration of the TF is triggered if the TF is enabled during each change of the attribute value. When this attribute is changed and the attribute tfMode is set to MASTER, state of the functionality BTS Soft Synchronization is automatically set to the same value for all TGs in the logical TG cluster.

attribute.name: btsSoftSyncTimeAlignment
attribute.description:
Type of synchronization alignment for BTS Soft Synchronization.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXTSI: ALIGNTYPE RXTSE: ALIGNTYPE RXTSC: ALIGNTYPE
attribute.dependencies: Can be changed only if the attribute G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState is set to ON and the attribute tfMode is set to STANDALONE or MASTER.
attribute.sideEffects: When this attribute is changed and the attribute tfMode is set to MASTER, type of synchronization alignment is automatically set to the same value for all TGs in the logical TG cluster.

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TF MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TF MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the TF MO.
Defines the wanted global state of the TF MO. The actual TF MO state is stored in moOperState.
If the attribute G12Tf.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: Changing the attribute from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED: If the attribute G12Tf.forcedBlocking is set to NO then blocking fails if the TF MO is enabled.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced TF MO blocking indication.
If the attribute is set to NO during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, the blocking order fails if the MO is enabled. If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, the blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12TfIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: tfModeCap
attribute.description:
Describes the TF synchronization mode capability.
This bitmap is expressed as a string of bits, where:
Bit 0 MASTER From the synchronization source and distributed to other TFs.
Bit 1 STANDALONE From synchronization source.
Bit 2 SLAVE From another TF.
Each bit, if set, indicates the capability of the corresponding synchronization mode.

attribute.name: syncSrcCap
attribute.description:
Describes the TF synchronization source capability.
This bitmap is expressed as a string of bits, where:
Bit 0 PCM From the PCM transport network.
Bit 1 INTE From an internal oscillator using external calibration. Bit 2 INTI From an internal oscillator using internal calibration.
Each bit, if set, indicates the capability of the corresponding synchronization source.

attribute.name: txChDCap
attribute.description: TX chain delay capability.

attribute.name: srnt
attribute.description: Simulated radio network time indicator.

class.name: G12Mctr
class.description:
Represents a MCTR MO in the BTS logical model G12.
Provides the power amplifying functionality necessary to transmit bursts from one, or more TX instances, and the RF reception functionality necessary to receive bursts by one, or more, RX instances.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='minFreqAndMaxFreqSetTogether' test="( (exists(@minFreq) and exists(@maxFreq)) or (not(exists(@minFreq)) and not(exists(@maxFreq))) )">Attributes minFreq and maxFreq must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='minFreqAndMaxFreqSetTogether' test="( (exists(@minFreq) and exists(@maxFreq)) or (not(exists(@minFreq)) and not(exists(@maxFreq))) )">Attributes minFreq and maxFreq must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: g12MctrId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of MCTR MO and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: usedByG12Trxc
attribute.description:
Shows the TRXC to which the MCTR is connected.
Depends on RXMOP

attribute.name: maxPwr
attribute.description:
Maximum mean power of MCTR.
This attribute is interpreted as a fixed-point number, which means that 436 corresponds to 43.6 dBm and 430 to 43 dBm.
Depends on RXMOC: MAXPWR
attribute.dependencies: When attribute value is decreased, all TRXCs connected to the MCTR must have moAdmState equal to OUT_OF_SERVICE. When attribute G12Mctr.pao or G12Mctr.mixedMode is set to OFF attribute G12Mctr.maxPwr can only be set to values multiples of ten.
attribute.sideEffects: If attribute G12Mctr.maxPwr is changed and attribute G12Mctr.txmPwr is set to AUTO, then attribute G12Tx.mPwr is recalculated for each G12Tx with superior G12Trxc connected to the G12Mctr.

attribute.name: maxTrx
attribute.description:
Maximum number of TRXCs possible to connect to MCTR.
The availability of attribute values other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: MAXTRX RXMSC: MAXTRX
attribute.dependencies: The attribute G12Mctr.maxTrx cannot be lower than 2 if attribute G12Mctr.pao is ON. The attribute value cannot be lesser than number of G12Trxc MOs connected to the G12Mctr. When attribute value is decreased, all TRXCs connected to the MCTR must have attribute G12Mctr.moAdmState equal to OUT_OF_SERVICE.
attribute.sideEffects: If attribute G12Mctr.maxTrx is changed and attribute G12Mctr.txmPwr is set to AUTO then attribute G12Tx.mPwr is recalculated for each G12Tx with superior G12Trxc connected to the G12Mctr.

attribute.name: txmPwr
attribute.description:
TX maximum power mode.
Changes the way maximum TX power is set.
Depends on RXMOC: TXMPWR
attribute.dependencies: The attribute txmPwr cannot be set to AUTO if attribute pao is ON. The sum of maximum TX power values, which are set by the attribute G12Tx.mPwr for each TX respectively, of all TXs using MCTR must not exceed the maximum mean output power of MCTR configured with the attributes G12Mctr.txmPwr=MANUAL and G12Mctr.pao=OFF.
attribute.precondition: MCTR MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Mctr.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: pao
attribute.description:
Power amplifier overbooking state.
Describes if the sum of maximum TX power values, of all TXs using given MCTR exceeds the maximum mean power of MCTR, which is set by the attribute G12Mctr.maxPwr. Maximum TX power is set by the attribute G12Tx.mPwr.
If attribute is set to OFF, then sum of maximum TX power values cannot exceed the maximum mean output power of MCTR. If attribute is set to ON, then sum of maximum TX power values can exceed the maximum mean output power of MCTR.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: PAO
attribute.dependencies: Attribute cannot be set to ON if attribute G12Mctr.maxTrx is lower than 2. Attribute cannot be set to ON if attribute G12Mctr.txmPwr is equal to AUTO. Attribute cannot be set to OFF if attribute G12Mctr.tpo is ON. Attribute cannot be set to OFF if attribute G12Mctr.maxPwr is set to value non multiple of ten.
attribute.precondition: MCTR MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Mctr.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: mixedMode
attribute.description:
Mixed mode state.
MCTR is possible to be shared with other RAN if mixed mode state is ON.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: MIXEDMODE
attribute.dependencies: Attribute cannot be set to OFF if G12Mctr.maxPwr is set to value non multiple of ten. If attribute is ON, then it is not allowed to use Temporary Power Override functionality, set by attribute G12Mctr.tpo. If attribute is ON, then the attribute combination G12Tf.syncSrc=INTE and G12Tf.fsOffset set to no value is not allowed.
attribute.precondition: MCTR MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Mctr.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: minFreq
attribute.description:
Minimum frequency for MCTR.
This attribute is expressed as ARFCN corresponding to the frequency.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
Depends on RXMOC: MINFREQ
attribute.dependencies: Attribute cannot be set if attribute G12Mctr.maxFreq is not set. It is not allowed to set G12Mctr.minFreq value greater than G12Mctr.maxFreq value. Values of G12Mctr.maxFreq and G12Mctr.minFreq should belong to the same frequency band.
attribute.precondition: MCTR MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Mctr.moAdmState, must be OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: maxFreq
attribute.description:
Maximum frequency for MCTR.
This attribute is expressed as ARFCN corresponding to the frequency.
For GSM 800: Numeral 128 - 251
For GSM 900, P-band: Numeral 1 - 124
For GSM 900, G1-band: Numeral 0, 975 - 1023
For GSM 1800: Numeral 512 - 885
For GSM 1900: Numeral 512 - 810
Depends on RXMOC: MAXFREQ
attribute.dependencies: Attribute G12Mctr.maxFreq cannot be set if attribute G12Mctr.minFreq is not set. It is not allowed to set G12Mctr.maxFreq value lower than G12Mctr.minFreq value. Values of G12Mctr.maxFreq and G12Mctr.minFreq must belong to the same frequency band.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if MCTR MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Mctr.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: tpo
attribute.description:
Temporary power override state.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: TPO RXMSC: TPO
attribute.dependencies: The attribute tpo cannot be set to ON if attribute mixedMode is ON. The attribute tpo cannot be set to ON if attribute pao is OFF.

attribute.name: ccMd
attribute.description:
MCTR mode for combined cell.
The availability of attribute values other than default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: CCMD RXMSC: CCMD

attribute.name: ccId
attribute.description:
Combined cell identifier.
Depends on RXMOI: CCID RXMOC: CCID RXMSC: CCID
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be changed if MCTR mode for combined cell, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccMd, is equal to NONE.

attribute.name: ccTp
attribute.description:
Type of the combined cell the MCTR serves.
Depends on RXMOC: CCTP RXMSC: CCTP
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be changed if MCTR mode for combined cell, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccMd, is equal to NONE. Cannot be set to CCTXDD when MCTR mode for combined cell, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccMd, is equal to EXT2 or EXT3. Cannot be set to CCTYPE2 when extension MCTR distance, set by the attribute G12Mctr.emDi, or extension MCTR radius, set by the attribute G12Mctr.emRa, is not set. Cannot be set to CCTYPE3 or CCTYPE4 when extension MCTR distance is set by the attribute G12Mctr.emDi, or extension MCTR radius is set by the attribute G12Mctr.emRa.

attribute.name: emtp
attribute.description:
Extension MCTR TX power for combined cell.
Sets nominal power of TX for all TRXCs connected to the MCTR.
Depends on RXMOC: EMTP RXMSC: EMTP
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set if MCTR mode for combined cell, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccMd, is equal to NONE or MAIN, or if type of the combined cell the MCTR serves, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTXDD.

attribute.name: emDi
attribute.description:
Extension MCTR distance.
Changes the radio propagation distance between the main MCTR location and an extension MCTR location.
Depends on RXMOC: EMDI RXMSC: EMDI
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set if extension MCTR radius, set by the attribute G12Mctr.emRa, is not set or if combined cell type, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTYPE3 or CCTYPE4. Cannot be removed if combined cell type, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTYPE2. Cannot be set or removed if MCTR mode for combined cell, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccMd, is equal to NONE or MAIN, or if type of the combined cell the MCTR serves, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTXDD.

attribute.name: emRa
attribute.description:
Wanted size of the radio coverage area related to an extension MCTR.
Depends on RXMOC: EMRA RXMSC: EMRA
attribute.dependencies: Cannot be set if extension MCTR distance, set by the attribute G12Mctr.emDi, is not set or if combined cell type, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTYPE3 or CCTYPE4. Cannot be removed if combined cell type, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTYPE2. Cannot be set or removed if MCTR mode for combined cell, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccMd, is equal to NONE or MAIN, or if type of the combined cell the MCTR serves, set by the attribute G12Mctr.ccTp, is equal to CCTXDD.

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the MCTR MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the MCTR MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the MCTR MO.
The actual MCTR MO state is stored in G12Mctr.moOperState.
If the attribute G12Mctr.forcedBlocking is set to NO when change of G12Mctr.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking fails if any related TX or TS is enabled. If the attribute G12Mctr.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change moAdmState from OUT_OF_SERVICE the parent G12Cf moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced MCTR MO blocking indication.
If the attribute G12Mctr.forcedBlocking is set to NO when change of G12Mctr.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking fails if any related TX or TS is enabled. If the attribute G12Mctr.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Mctr.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: air
attribute.description:
Specifies AIR grouping object to which MCTR MO is connected.
To disconnect MCTR MO from AIR grouping object the attribute should be set to no value.
Depends on RXGCI: GO RXGCE: GO
attribute.precondition: The AIR grouping object shall be defined, see RXGOI Command Description.

attribute.name: g12MctrIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: mctrFCap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported optional MCTR functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bits listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 Temporary power override 0 Temporary power override not supported by the MCTR 1 Temporary power override supported by the MCTR
f2 MCPA overbooking 0 MCPA overbooking not supported by the BTS 1 MCPA overbooking supported by the BTS
f3 Mixed Mode Radio 0 Mixed Mode Radio not supported by the BTS 1 Mixed Mode Radio supported by the BTS
f4 Combined cell 0 Combined cell not supported by the MCTR 1 Combined cell supported by the MCTR
f5 Extended combined cell 0 Extended combined cell not supported by the MCTR 1 Extended combined cell supported by the MCTR
f6 Multi-Sector per Radio GSM RAN 0 Multi-Sector per Radio GSM RAN not supported by the MCTR 1 Multi-Sector per Radio GSM RAN supported by the MCTR
f7 TX Delay Diversity 0 TX Delay Diversity not supported by the MCTR 1 TX Delay Diversity supported by the MCTR
The least significant bits are stored on first index and the most significant bits are stored on last index.

attribute.name: maxPwrCap
attribute.description: Maximum MCTR power.

attribute.name: maxTrxCap
attribute.description: Maximum number of TRXCs possible to connect to MCTR.

attribute.name: bwidthCap
attribute.description: Maximum distance between two frequencies transmitted by given MCTR.

attribute.name: bandCap
attribute.description:
Describes the band capability.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bits where:
Bit 0 - GSM 1900 Bit 1 - GSM 1800 Bit 2 - GSM 900 Bit 3 - GSM 800

attribute.name: arfcnMinCap
attribute.description: Minimum ARFCN capability.

attribute.name: arfcnMaxCap
attribute.description: Maximum ARFCN capability.

attribute.name: mcpaIdxCap
attribute.description: MCPA index number within RUS.

attribute.name: trxcPool
attribute.description: TRX Pool to which the MCTR belongs.

attribute.name: trxcPoolSize
attribute.description: Indicates maximum number of TRXCs in the MCTR TRX pool.

attribute.name: relatedMctrList
attribute.description: List of MCTRs related to the same AIR.

attribute.name: mctrHwIdCap
attribute.description: RUS hardware serial number.

class.name: G12Cf
class.description:
Represents a CF MO in the BTS logical model G12.
Provides communication for the IS, CON, DP, TF, and MCTR MOs. Models all equipment in a base station infrastructure that is not part of other objects.

attribute.name: g12CfId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: tei
attribute.description:
Terminal endpoint identifier.
LAPD element used for Layer 2 addressing to a CF.
Depends on RXMOC: TEI RXMOI: TEI
attribute.dependencies: The same tei cannot be assigned to different MOs which belong to the same G12Tg.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if CF MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Cf.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sig
attribute.description:
Signaling type.
Default value if the parent G12Tg object attribute tMode = SCM: SCCONC Default value if the parent G12Tg object attribute tMode = TDM: UNCONC
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOC: SIG RXMOI: SIG
attribute.dependencies: If TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, of superior TG is set to SCM then only allowed value for the G12Cf.sig is SCCONC. When changing this attribute to MPLEX16 or MPLEX32 it is required that the GS supports subrate switching.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if CF MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Cf.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the CF MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the CF MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the CF MO.
The actual CF MO state is stored in moOperState.
Attribute G12Cf.changeSubordState indicates if subordinate MOs (all MOs below superior G12Tg MO) state is changed during change of G12Cf.moAdmState.
If attribute G12Cf.forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of G12Cf.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order fails if it does not succeed for the subordinate MO.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change G12Cf.moAdmState from OUT_OF_SERVICE, the parent G12Tg.moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: changeSubordState
attribute.description:
If set subordinate MOs (all MOs below superior G12Tg) state is changed during change of moAdmState.
Depends on RXESI: SUBORD RXESE: SUBORD RXBLI: SUBORD RXBLE: SUBORD

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced CF MO blocking indication.
If attribute forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order fails if it does not succeed for the subordinate MO.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12CfIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: extAlCap
attribute.description:
Describes the external alarm capability array.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits 0 to 15 String 2 - Contains bits 16 to 31 String 3 - Contains bits 32 to 47 String 4 - Contains bits 48 to 63
Each bit position, if set, corresponds to the identity of an inlet port.
Example: Bit 0 corresponds to inlet port 0.

attribute.name: truCap
attribute.description:
Describes the TRU capability.
Each bit position, if set, indicates an installed TRU. The bit position corresponds to the TRXC instance.

class.name: G12Trxc
class.description:
Represents a TRXC MO in the BTS logical model G12.
TRXC provides communication for other MOs instances. It handles the communication to the dedicated RX, TX, and TS handlers. It also handles the maintenance of the TRXC itself. All traffic related communication on the Abis interface is addressed to a TRXC and is terminated in the TRXC.

validationRules.rule:
<schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='dcpSpeechDataBeginHasValueAndDcpSpeechDataEndDoenst' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin) and not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd)))'>Attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd can be set to no value only if the attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin is set to no value in <name path="."/></assert>
<assert id='dcpSpeechDataBeginHasValueAndDcpSpeechDataEndDoenst' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd) and not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin)))'>Attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin can be set to no value only if the attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd is set to no value in <name path="."/></assert>
<assert id='dcpSpeechDataBeginLesserThanDcpSpeechDataEnd' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin)) or not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd)) or (@dcpSpeechDataBegin lt @dcpSpeechDataEnd)'>The value of the attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin must be less than value of the attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd in <name path="."/></assert>
<assert id='numberOfDcpsInRange' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin)) or not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd)) or (@dcpSpeechDataBegin ge @dcpSpeechDataEnd) or (@dcpSpeechDataEnd - @dcpSpeechDataBegin = 1) or (@dcpSpeechDataEnd - @dcpSpeechDataBegin = 7)'>Number of DCPs in DCP range, defined by the attributes dcpSpeechDataBegin and dcpSpeechDataEnd must be equal to 2 or 8 in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript:
<schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='dcpSpeechDataBeginHasValueAndDcpSpeechDataEndDoenst' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin) and not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd)))'>Attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd can be set to no value only if the attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin is set to no value in <name path="."/></assert>
<assert id='dcpSpeechDataBeginHasValueAndDcpSpeechDataEndDoenst' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd) and not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin)))'>Attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin can be set to no value only if the attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd is set to no value in <name path="."/></assert>
<assert id='dcpSpeechDataBeginLesserThanDcpSpeechDataEnd' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin)) or not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd)) or (@dcpSpeechDataBegin lt @dcpSpeechDataEnd)'>The value of the attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin must be less than value of the attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd in <name path="."/></assert>
<assert id='numberOfDcpsInRange' test='not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataBegin)) or not(exists(@dcpSpeechDataEnd)) or (@dcpSpeechDataBegin ge @dcpSpeechDataEnd) or (@dcpSpeechDataEnd - @dcpSpeechDataBegin = 1) or (@dcpSpeechDataEnd - @dcpSpeechDataBegin = 7)'>Number of DCPs in DCP range, defined by the attributes dcpSpeechDataBegin and dcpSpeechDataEnd must be equal to 2 or 8 in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: g12TrxcId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of TRXC MO and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: dedicateToChannelGroup
attribute.description:
Channel group number to which the TRXC MO is dedicated in the cell.
Depends on RXMOC: CHGR
attribute.dependencies: To set the value of the attribute dedicatedToChannelGroup, the attribute dedicatedToGeranCell needs to be set. Can be set only if moAdmState is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED. The value of the attribute dedicatedToChannelGroup can only specify the channel group which belongs to the cell specified with the attribute dedicatedToGeranCell.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: dedicateToGeranCell
attribute.description:
Cell to which the TRXC MO is dedicated.
Depends on RXMOC: CELL RXMSC: CELL
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if moAdmState is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.
attribute.sideEffects: Setting of this attribute clears value of attribute dedicateToChannelGroup unless dedicateToChannelGroup is set in the same commit.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: usesG12Mctr
attribute.description:
MCTR which is connected to the TRXC.
Depends on RXMOI: MCTRI RXMOC: MCTRI
attribute.dependencies: The total number of TRXCs connected to MCTR cannot exceed the value set by attribute G12Mctr.maxTrx for corresponding MCTR MO. When changing value subordinate TS MOs must not be configured for radio interference recording.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: tei
attribute.description:
Terminal endpoint identifier.
LAPD element used for L2 addressing to a TRXC.
Depends on RXMOI RXMOC
attribute.dependencies: The same tei cannot be assingned to different MOs which belong to the same G12Tg.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: dcpSignalling
attribute.description:
DCP number used for the signaling path to the TRXC.
Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd within current TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which is used by G12Trxc.dcpSignalling on any TRXC MO, including current one, within parent TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd of any TRXC MO, including current one, within parent TG MO. Note: In case when dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd needs to be changed to new range which includes values from the old one then the change must be performed in two different transactions: first, G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd must be set to no value, then new G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd values must be assigned.
Depends on RXMOI: DCP1 RXMOC: DCP1
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: sig
attribute.description:
Signaling type.
Default value if the parent G12Tg object attribute tMode = SCM: SCCONC Default value if the parent G12Tg object attribute tMode = TDM: UNCONC
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: SIG RXMOC: SIG
attribute.dependencies: If the superior TG MO attribute G12Tg.tMode equals SCM, the only allowed value for the attribute G12Trxc.sig is SCCONC. If the superior TG MO attribute G12Tg.tMode equals TDM the attribute G12Trxc.sig must be set to UNCONC. When changing G12Trxc.sig to MPLEX16 or MPLEX32 it is required that the GS supports subrate switching.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: traff
attribute.description:
Shows if the TRXC is used for signaling, speech, and data.
YES - TRXC is used for signaling, speech, and data.
NO - TRXC is only used for signaling.
Attribute is changed depending on the values of G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd attributes.
Depends on RXMOC: TRAFF RXMOI: TRAFF

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TRXC MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TRXC MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the TRXC MO.
The actual TRXC MO state is stored in G12Trxc.moOperState.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change moAdmState from OUT_OF_SERVICE corresponding G12Cf moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED. To change moAdmState to OUT_OF_SERVICE subordinate G12Tx, G12Rx, and G12Ts must be set to OUT_OF_SERVICE or changeSubordState should be set to YES.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: usesSuperChannel
attribute.description:
Super channel number to which TRXC is connected.
Specifies the super channel number of the SCGR to which a TRXC is connected, within a superior G12Tg MO. The SCGR is connected to the TG using the attribute G12Tg.usesSuperChannelGroup.
The attribute must be set to no value before assigning a new value. The availability of attribute value depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOI: SC
attribute.dependencies: Attribute can be set only if TG transmission mode, set by the attribute G12Tg.tMode, is SCM.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TRXC MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced blocking indicator.
If the attribute G12Trxc.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Trxc.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with TRXC and subordinate MOs. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with TRXC and subordinate MOs is immediately ended.
If the attribute G12Trxc.forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of G12Trxc.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order fails if it does not succeed for the subordinate MOs (TX, RX, TS).
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE
