attribute.name: changeSubordState
attribute.description:
Indicates if the state of subordinate MOs (TX,RX,TS) is changed during change of moAdmState.
Depends on RXESI: SUBORD RXESE: SUBORD RXBLI: SUBORD RXBLE: SUBORD

attribute.name: dcpSpeechDataBegin
attribute.description:
Begin of DCP range used for the speech and data connections to the TRXC.
Sets the first DCP in the range of DCPs for TRXCs using 16 kbps Abis paths or eight DCPs for TRXCs using 64 kbps Abis paths.
If both attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd are specified, then TRXC is used for signaling, speech, and data. If both attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd are set to no value, then TRXC is not used for traffic and only for signaling.
Either two or eight DCPs must be specified by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd.
If two DCPs are given, attribute G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin is associated with TSs from 0 to 3, and attribute G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd is associated with TSs from 4 to 7. If eight DCPs are given, attribute G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin is associated with TS0, attribute G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin is associated with TS7 and other DCPs are associated respectively.
Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd within current TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which is used by G12Trxc.dcpSignalling on any TRXC MO, including current one, within parent TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd of any TRXC MO, including current one, within parent TG MO. Note: In case when dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd needs to be changed to new range which includes values from the old one then the change must be performed in two different transactions: first, G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd must be set to no value, then new G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd values must be assigned.
Depends on RXMOI: DCP2 RXMOC: DCP2
attribute.dependencies: Can be set to no value only if G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin is set to no value. Can have value only if G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin has value.

attribute.name: dcpSpeechDataEnd
attribute.description:
End of DCP range used for the speech and data connections to the TRXC.
Sets the last DCP in the range of DCPs for TRXCs using 16 kbps Abis paths or eight DCPs for TRXCs using 64 kbps Abis paths.
If both attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd are specified, then TRXC is used for signaling, speech, and data. If both attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd are set to no value, then TRXC is not used for traffic and only for signaling.
Either two or eight DCPs must be specified by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd.
If two DCPs are given, attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin is associated with TSs from 0 to 3, and attribute dcpSpeechDataEnd is associated with TSs from 4 to 7. If eight DCPs are given, attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin is associated with TS0, attribute dcpSpeechDataBegin is associated with TS7 and other DCPs are associated respectively.
Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Con.dcpBegin and G12Con.dcpEnd within current TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which is used by G12Trxc.dcpSignalling on any TRXC MO, including current one, within parent TG MO. Attribute cannot be set to value which belongs to dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd of any TRXC MO, including current one, within parent TG MO. Note: In case when dcp range defined by attributes G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd needs to be changed to new range which includes values from the old one then the change must be performed in two different transactions: first, G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd must be set to no value, then new G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataBegin and G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd values must be assigned.
Depends on RXMOI: DCP2 RXMOC: DCP2
attribute.dependencies: Can be set to no value only if G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd is set to no value. Can have value only if G12Trxc.dcpSpeechDataEnd has value.

attribute.name: g12TrxcIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: teiCap
attribute.description: Terminal Endpoint Identifier capability.

attribute.name: dcp1Cap
attribute.description: Supported DCP number used for the signaling path to the TRXC.

attribute.name: dcp2Cap
attribute.description: Supported DCP number used for the speech and data connections to the TRXC array.

attribute.name: omlF1Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported optional OML functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bits listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 TRXC function change 0 - TRXC function change not supported by the BTS 1 - TRXC function change supported by the BTS
f2 Automatic ciphering 0 - Automatic ciphering not supported by the BTS 1 - Automatic ciphering supported by the BTS
f3 IRC 0 - IRC not supported by the BTS 1 - IRC supported by the BTS
f4 Antenna Hopping 0 - Antenna Hopping not supported by the BTS 1 - Antenna Hopping supported by the BTS
f5 Frame synchronization using GPS 0 - Frame synchronization using GPS not supported by the BTS 1 - Frame synchronization using GPS supported by the BTS
f6 4WRD 0 - 4WRD not supported by the BTS 1 - 4WRD supported by the BTS
f7 Automatic parameter setting in TG synchronization on TG level 0 - Automatic parameter setting in TG synchronization on TG level not supported by the BTS 1 - Automatic parameter setting in TG synchronization on TG level supported by the BTS
f8 Feature Packet Abis over TDM 0 - Feature Packet Abis over TDM not supported by the BTS 1 - Feature Packet Abis over TDM supported by the BTS
f9 Feature Packet Abis over IP 0 - Feature Packet Abis over IP not supported by the BTS 1 - Feature Packet Abis over IP supported by the BTS
f11 PSU Power Savings 0 - PSU Power Savings not supported by the BTS 1 - PSU Power Savings supported by the BTS
f12 SC Quality Report II 0 - SC Quality Report II not supported by the BTS 1 - SC Quality Report II supported by the BTS
f13 Time Slot Power Savings 0 - Time Slot Power Savings not supported by the BTS 1 - Time Slot Power Savings supported by the BTS
f14 Multiple CCCH 0 - Multiple CCCH not supported by the BTS 1 - Multiple CCCH supported by the BTS
f15 MCTR 0 - MCTR not supported by the BTS 1 - MCTR supported by the BTS
f16 Current supervised TMA 0 - Current supervised TMA not supported by the BTS 1 - Current supervised TMA supported by the BTS
f17 Antenna interface standards group TMA 0 - Antenna interface standards group TMA not supported by the BTS 1 - Antenna interface standards group TMA supported by the BTS
f18 Antenna interface standards group RET 0 - Antenna interface standards group RET not supported by BTS 1 - Antenna interface standards group RET supported by the BTS
f19 VAMOS 0 - VAMOS not supported by the BTS 1 - VAMOS supported by the BTS
f20 TS configuration split 0 - TS configuration split not supported by the BTS 1 - TS configuration split supported by the BTS
f21 AQPSK with SCPIR 0 - AQPSK with non-zero SCPIR not supported by the BTS 1 - AQPSK with non-zero SCPIR supported by the BTS
f22 MCTR maximum allowed power extension 0 - MCTR maximum allowed power extension not supported by the BTS 1 - MCTR maximum allowed power extension supported by the BTS
f23 BCCH Power Savings 0 - BCCH Power Savings not supported by the BTS 1 - BCCH Power Savings supported by the BTS
f24 BTS Soft Synchronization 0 - BTS Soft Synchronization not supported by the BTS 1 - BTS Soft Synchronization supported by the BTS
f25 Native IP Configuration 0 - Native IP Configuration not supported by the BTS 1 - Native IP Configuration supported by the BTS
f26 RRUS Cascading 0 - RRUS Cascading not supported by the BTS 1 - RUS Cascading supported by the BTS
f27 Reporting of Access Burst Info 0 - Reporting of Access Burst Info not supported by the BTS 1 - Reporting of Access Burst Info supported by the BTS
f28 Support for decimal resolution of configured power 0 - Decimal resolution of configured power not supported by the BTS 1 - Decimal resolution of configured power supported by the BTS
f29 Node Group Synchronization 0 - Node Group Synchronization not supported by the BTS 1 - Node Group Synchronization supported by the BTS
f30 Extended Coverage 0 - Extended Coverage not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended Coverage supported by the BTS
f31 Synchronization Observability 0 - Synchronization Observability not supported by the BTS 1 - Synchronization Observability supported by the BTS
f32 Frequency Measurements 0 - Frequency Measurements not supported by the BTS 1 - Frequency Measurements supported by the BTS
f33 Combined cell 0 - Combined cell not supported by the BTS 1 - Combined cell supported by the BTS
f34 Energy Consumption Counters 0 - Energy Consumption Counters not supported by the BTS 1 - Energy Consumption Counters supported by the BTS
f35 TRX Soft Synchronization 0 - TRX Soft Synchronization not supported by the BTS 1 - TRX Soft Synchronization supported by the BTS

attribute.name: omlF2Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported mandatory OML functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bit listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 Frequency measurements support 0 - Frequency measurements not supported by the BTS 1 - Frequency measurements supported by the BTS

attribute.name: rslF1Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported optional RSL functions.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bit strings, where:
String 1 - Contains bits from f1 to f16 String 2 - Contains bits from f17 to f32 String 3 - Contains bits from f33 to f48 String 4 - Contains bits from f49 to f64 String 5 - Contains bits from f65 to f80
All bits, except the bits listed below, in this bitmap are currently unused.
f1 Paging command 0 - Channel Needed not supported 1 - Channel Needed supported
f2 BTS phase handling 0 - BCCH information phase 2 not supported, Layer 3 information must be included in SACCH filling, and immediate assign phase 2 not supported 1 - BCCH Information phases 1 and 2 supported, Layer 3 information may be excluded from SACCH filling, and immediate assign phases 1 and 2 supported
f3 Extended range 0 - Extended range not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended range supported by the BTS
f4 A5/2 algorithm 0 - A5/2 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/2 algorithm supported by the BTS
f5 Base station power control 0 - BS power control not supported 1 - BS power control supported
f6 Multiband operation 0 - Multiband operation not supported 1 - Multiband operation supported
f7 Power information support 0 - Power information not supported by the BTS 1 - Power information supported by the BTS
f8 A5/1 algorithm 0 - A5/1 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/1 algorithm supported by the BTS
f9 GPRS support 0 - GPRS not supported by the BTS 1 - GPRS supported by the BTS
f10 Enhanced Multi-Level Precedence and Preemption Service priority 0 - Enhanced Multi-Level Precedence and Preemption Service priority not supported 1 - Enhanced Multi-Level Precedence and Preemption Service priority supported
f11 CBCH 0 - Extended CBCH not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended CBCH supported by the BTS
f12 Main channel reference 0 - Main channel reference not supported 1 - Main channel reference supported
f13 A5/3 algorithm 0 - A5/3 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/3 algorithm supported by the BTS
f14 BTS Counters 0 - Reporting of BTS Counters not supported by the BTS 1 - Reporting of BTS Counters supported by the BTS
f15 Dynamic IS configuration 0 - ICP List in channel activation not supported 1 - ICP List in channel activation supported
f16 EMR 0 - EMR functionality not supported by the BTS 1 - EMR functionality supported by the BTS
f17 TFO 0 - TFO not supported 1 - TFO supported
f18 VGCS 0 - VGCS not supported by the BTS 1 - VGCS supported by the BTS
f19 VGCS Enhancements 0 - VGCS Enhancements not supported by the BTS 1 - VGCS Enhancements supported by the BTS
f21 Enhanced Handover Success Rate 0 - Enhanced Handover Success Rate not supported by the BTS 1 - Enhanced Handover Success Rate supported by the BTS
f22 Repeated SACCH support 0 - Repeated SACCH not supported by the BTS 1 - Repeated SACCH supported by the BTS
f23 RTTI support 0 - RTTI not supported by the BTS 1 - RTTI supported by the BTS
f24 PTA regulation mode PAL 1 0 - PTA regulation algorithm 1 not supported by the BTS 1 - PTA regulation algorithm 1 supported by the BTS
f25 PAN Support 0 - PAN not supported by the BTS 1 - PAN supported by the BTS
f26 Random fill bits 0 - Random fill bits not supported by the BTS 1 - Random fill bits supported by the BTS
f27 BS Power 2 support 0 - BS Power 2 not supported by the BTS 1 - BS Power 2 supported by the BTS
f28 SMSCB DRX mode support 0 - DRX mode not supported by the BTS 1 - DRX mode supported by the BTS
f29 VAMOS Advanced support 0 - VAMOS Advanced not supported by the BTS 1 - VAMOS Advanced supported by the BTS
f30 PDCH options support 0 - PDCH options not supported by the BTS 1 - PDCH options supported by the BTS
f31 Random fill bits in System Information Type 6 0 - Random SI6 fill bits not supported by the BTS 1 - Random SI6 fill bits supported by the BTS
f32 Channel Specific Measurement Information support 0 - Channel Specific Measurement Information not supported 1 - Channel Specific Measurement Information supported
f33 UL Data Compression support 0 - UL Data Compression not supported 1 - UL Data Compression supported
f34 A5/4 algorithm 0 - A5/4 algorithm not supported by the BTS 1 - A5/4 algorithm supported by the BTS
f35 Extended Coverage 0 - Extended Coverage not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended Coverage supported by the BTS
f36 Extended DRX 0 - Extended DRX not supported by the BTS 1 - Extended DRX supported by the BTS
f37 IoT Load Control 0 - IoT Load Control not supported by the BTS 1 - IoT Load Control supported by the BTS
f38 Paging Command 3 0 - Paging Command 3 not supported by the BTS 1 - Paging Command 3 supported by the BTS

attribute.name: rslF2Cap
attribute.description:
Describes the supported mandatory RSL functions.
This bitmap is currently unused.

attribute.name: aaCap
attribute.description: Additional assignment capability.

attribute.name: tchModeCap
attribute.description:
Supported half rate speech versions.
Indicates which Half Rate Traffic Channel modes a TS instance is capable of handling. The least significant bits are stored on first index and the most significant bits are stored on last index.
String 1 - Bits from 0 to 15 String 2 - Bits from 16 to 31
0 - 2.4 kbps or less data TCH/H2.4(n) + FACCH/H(n) + SACCH/TH(n), where n = 0 or n = 1, according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination ii) using channel code for data rate 2.4 kbps or less as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 1 - 4.8 kbps data, transparent TCH/H4.8(n) + FACCH/H(n) + SACCH/TH(n), where n = 0 or n = 1, according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination ii) using channel code for data rate 4.8 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode. 2 - 4.8 kbps data, non-transparent TCH/H4.8(n) + FACCH/H(n) + SACCH/TH(n), where n = 0 or n = 1, according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination ii) using channel code for data rate 4.8 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode. 3 - Half rate speech version 1, Half Rate TCH/HS(n) + FACCH/H(n) + SACCH/TH(n), where n = 0 or n = 1, according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination ii) using channel code for TCH/HS according to 3GPP TS 45.003 and speech transcoding according to GSM 06.02. 4 - TCH/HS(n) + FACCH/H(n) + SACCH/TH(n), where n = 0 or 1, according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination ii) using channel code for TCH/HS according to 3GPP TS 45.003, and AMR speech transcoding.
Indicates capability for AMR speech transcoding, which uses speech coding algorithm version 3, using the following speech codec modes according to 3GPP TS 45.003: TCH/AHS7.4, TCH/AHS6.7, TCH/AHS5.9, TCH/AHS5.15, TCH/AHS4.75.

attribute.name: tcfModeCap
attribute.description:
Supported full rate speech versions.
Indicates which TCH/F modes a TS instance is capable of handling. The least significant bits are stored on first index and the most significant bits are stored on last index.
String 1 - Bits from 0 to 15 String 2 - Bits from 16 to 31 String 3 - Bits from 32 to 47 String 4 - Bits from 48 to 63
0 - 2.4 kbps or less data, transparent TCH/F2.4 + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for data rate 2.4 kbps or less as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode. 1 - 4.8 kbps data, transparent TCH/F4.8 + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for data rate 4.8 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode. 2 - 4.8 kbps data, non-transparent TCH/F4.8 + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for data rate 4.8 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode. 3 - 9.6 kbps data, transparent TCH/F9.6 + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for data rate 9.6 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode. 4 - 9.6 kbps data, non-transparent TCH/F9.6 + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for data rate 9.6 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode. 5 - Full rate speech version 1, full rate TCH/FS + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for TCH/FS according to 3GPP TS 45.003 and speech transcoding according to GSM 06.01. 6 - Full rate speech version 2, PCS enhanced full rate TCH/FS + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using PCS enhanced speech transcoding and either, channel code for TCH/FS according to 3GPP TS 45.003, or a PCS enhanced speech transcoding specific channel code. 7 - 2.4 kbps or less multislot data, transparent TCH/F2.4 + FACCH/F + SACCH/M or TCH/F2.4 + SACCH/M or TCH/F2.4 + SACCH/MD according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations viii) - x) and 6.4.2, using channel code for channel data rate 2.4 kbps and less as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 8 - 4.8 kbps multislot data, transparent TCH/F4.8 + FACCH/F + SACCH/M or TCH/F4.8 + SACCH/M or TCH/F4.8 + SACCH/MD according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations viii) - x) and 6.4.2, using channel code for channel data rate 4.8 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 9 - 4.8 kbps multislot data, non-transparent TCH/F4.8 + FACCH/F + SACCH/M or TCH/F4.8 + SACCH/M or TCH/F4.8 + SACCH/MD according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations viii) - x) and 6.4.2, using channel code for channel data rate 4.8 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 10 - 9.6 kbps multislot data, transparent TCH/F9.6 + FACCH/F + SACCH/M or TCH/F9.6 + SACCH/M or TCH/F9.6 + SACCH/MD according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations viii) - x) and 6.4.2, using channel code for channel data rate 9.6 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 11 - 9.6 kbps multislot data, non-transparent TCH/F9.6 + FACCH/F + SACCH/M or TCH/F9.6 + SACCH/M or TCH/F9.6 + SACCH/MD according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations viii) - x) and 6.4.2, using channel code for channel data rate 9.6 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 12 - 14.4 kbps data, transparent TCH/F14.4 + FACCH/F + SACCH/F according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4 combination i) using channel code for data rate 14.4 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode. 13 - 14.4 kbps data, non-transparent TCH/F14.4 + FACCH/F + SACCH/F according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4 combination i) using channel code for data rate 14.4 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode. 14 - 14.4 kbps multislot data, transparent TCH/F14.4 + FACCH/F + SACCH/F or TCH/F14.4 + SACCH/M or TCH/F14.4 - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations viii) -x) and 6.4.2 using channel code for channel data rate 14.4 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 15 - 14.4 kbps multislot data, non-transparent TCH/F14.4 + FACCH/F + SACCH/F or TCH/F14.4 + SACCH/M or TCH/F14.4 - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations viii) -x) and 6.4.2 using channel code for channel data rate 14.4 kbps as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003, providing non-transparent mode for symmetric or asymmetric multislot configurations. 16 - GPRS coding scheme 1 PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2 using channel code for packet data block type 1 (CS-1) as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 17 - GPRS coding scheme 2 PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2 using channel code for packet data block type 2 (CS-2) as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 18 - GPRS coding scheme 3 PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2 using channel code for packet data block type 3 (CS-3) as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 19 - GPRS coding scheme 4 PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2 using channel code for packet data block type 4 (CS-4) as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 20 - Extended packet access PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1, combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2 using extended packet access burst as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 21 - TCH/FS + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for TCH/FS according to 3GPP TS 45.003, and AMR speech transcoding. Indicates capability for AMR speech transcoding using the following speech codec modes: TCH/AFS12.2, TCH/AFS10.2, TCH/AFS7.95, TCH/AFS7.4, TCH/AFS6.7, TCH/AFS5.9, TCH/AFS5.15, TCH/AFS4.75. 22 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-1 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 23 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-2 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 24 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-3 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 25 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-4 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 26 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-5 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 27 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-6 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 28 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-7 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 29 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-8 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 30 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PCCCH + PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH or PDTCH + PACCH + PTCCH - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for MCS-9 as specified in 3GPP TS 45.003. 31 - FCCH + SCH + BCCH + CCCH or FCCH + SCH + BCCH + CCCH + SDCCH SDCCH/4(0..3) + SACCH/4(0..3) - see 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations iv) - v), using EGPRS packet channel request as specified in 3GPP TS 44.060. 32 - TCH/FS + FACCH/F + SACCH/TF according to 3GPP TS 45.002, section 6.4, combination i) using channel code for TCH/FS according to 3GPP TS 45.003, and wideband AMR speech transcoding Indicates capability for wideband AMR speech transcoding, which uses coding algorithm version 5, using the following speech codec modes according to 3GPP TS 45.003: TCH/WFS12.65, TCH/WFS8.85, TCH/WFS6.60. 33 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-5 as specified in GSM 45.003. 34 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-6 as specified in GSM 45.003. 35 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-7 as specified in GSM 45.003. 36 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-8 as specified in GSM 45.003. 37 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-9 as specified in GSM 45.003. 38 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-10 as specified in GSM 45.003. 39 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-11 as specified in GSM 45.003. 40 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for DAS-12 as specified in GSM 45.003. 41 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for UAS-7 as specified in GSM 45.003. 42 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for UAS-8 as specified in GSM 45.003. 43 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for UAS-9 as specified in GSM 45.003. 44 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for UAS-10 as specified in GSM 45.003. 45 - PBCCH + PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PCCCH + PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F or PDTCH/F + PACCH/F + PTCCH/F - see GSM 45.002, section 6.4.1 combinations xi) - xiii) and 6.4.2, using channel code for UAS-11 as specified in GSM 45.003.

attribute.name: dcpGroupNum
attribute.description: Number of supported DCP groups.

attribute.name: irCap

attribute.name: trTypeCap
attribute.description:
Bitmap of type of transmitter or receiver that is supported by the TRX.
Bit 0 = ISCTR Bit 1 = MCTR

attribute.name: mctrNotSupCap
attribute.description:
Indicates MCTRs that cannot be used by the TRX.
Each bit position from 0 to 15 if set, indicates the MCTR that cannot be connected to the TRXC and corresponds to the identity of MCTR.
Example: Bit 0 corresponds to G12Mctr=0.

class.name: G12Tx
class.description:
Represents a TX MO in the BTS logical model G12.
TX provides the radio frequency transmission functionality on a time slot basis for eight TSs using different time slot numbers.

attribute.name: g12TxId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: dedicateToChannelGroup
attribute.description:
Channel group number to which the TX MO is dedicated in the cell.
Depends on RXMOC: CHGR RXMSC: CHGR
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if G12Tx.dedicateToGeranCell is set. The value of the attribute dedicatedToChannelGroup can only specify the channel group which belongs to the cell specified with the attribute dedicatedToGeranCell.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TX MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tx.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: band
attribute.description:
Frequency band supported by TX.
Depends on RXMOI: BAND RXMOC: BAND
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TX MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tx.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: ant
attribute.description:
Designation of antenna connected to TX.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: ANT RXMOC: ANT RXMSC: ANT

attribute.name: mPwr
attribute.description:
Maximum TX power.
Attribute mPwr is mandatory when superior TRXC is not connected to MCTR. In case when superior TRXC is connected to the MCTR with attribute G12Mctr.txmPwr set to AUTO then value of attribute G12Tx.mPwr is calculated automatically and any manual configuration of G12Tx.mPwr is ignored. Automatic G12Tx.mPwr value calculation is performed according to the following algorithm: the value of atribute G12Mctr.maxPwr is divided by the value of attribute G12Mctr.maxTrx. If value of any of these two attributes is changed, then the G12Tx.mPwr value is recalculated.
Depends on RXMOI: MPWR RXMOC: MPWR
attribute.dependencies: If supperior TRXC is connected to MCTR attribute G12Tx.mPwr can be changed only when attribute G12Mctr.txmPwr of the MCTR is set to MANUAL. Otherwise any manual mPwr configuration will be ignored.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if TX MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tx.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TX MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TX MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the TX MO.
Defines the wanted global state of the TX MO. The actual TX MO state is stored in moOperState.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order fails if the MO is enabled.
If the attribute forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with TX MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with TX MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change moAdmState from OUT_OF_SERVICE the parent G12Trx moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: dedicateToGeranCell
attribute.description:
Cell to which the TX MO is dedicated.
Depends on RXMOC: CELL RXMSC: CHGR
attribute.sideEffects: Setting of this attribute clears value of the attribute dedicateToChannelGroup unless dedicateToChannelGroup is set in the same commit.
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or ifTX MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Tx.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE or BLOCKED.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced TX MO blocking indication.
If the attribute G12Tx.forcedBlocking is set to NO, the blocking order fails if the MO is enabled.
If the attribute G12Tx.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Tx.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED then the blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with TX MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with TX MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12TxIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: bandCap
attribute.description:
Describes the band capability.
This bitmap is expressed as a string of bits, where:
Bit 0 - GSM 1900 Bit 1 - GSM 1800 Bit 2 - GSM 900 Bit 3 - GSM 800

attribute.name: fHopCap
attribute.description:
Frequency hopping capability bitmap.
Bit 0 = BB Bit 1 = SY

attribute.name: pwrMinCap
attribute.description: Minimum transmitter power capability for GMSK.

attribute.name: pwrMaxCap
attribute.description: Maximum transmitter power capability for GMSK.

attribute.name: pwrIncCap
attribute.description: Increment transmitter power capability for GMSK.

attribute.name: arfcnMinCap
attribute.description: The minimum ARFCN.

attribute.name: arfcnMaxCap
attribute.description: The maximum ARFCN.

attribute.name: pwrMinCap8Psk
attribute.description: Minimum transmitter power capability for 8-PSK.

attribute.name: pwrMaxCap8Psk
attribute.description: Maximum transmitter power capability for 8-PSK.

attribute.name: pwrIncCap8Psk
attribute.description: Increment transmitter power capability for 8-PSK.

attribute.name: pwrMinCap16Psk
attribute.description: Minimum transmitter power capability for 16-QAM.

attribute.name: pwrMaxCap16Psk
attribute.description: Maximum transmitter power capability for 16-QAM.

attribute.name: pwrIncCap16Psk
attribute.description: Increment transmitter power capability for 16-QAM.

attribute.name: pwrMinCap32Psk
attribute.description: Minimum transmitter power capability for 32-QAM.

attribute.name: pwrMaxCap32Psk
attribute.description: Maximum transmitter power capability for 32-QAM.

attribute.name: pwrIncCap32Psk
attribute.description: Increment transmitter power capability for 32-QAM.

class.name: G12Rx
class.description:
Represents a RX MO in the BTS logical model G12.
RX provides the radio frequency reception functionality for a TRX. One RX is hardwired to a TRXC.

attribute.name: g12RxId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: band
attribute.description:
Frequency band supported by RX.
Depends on RXMOI: BAND RXMOC: BAND
attribute.precondition: Attribute can be set during MO creation or if RX MO administrative state, set by the attribute G12Rx.moAdmState, is OUT_OF_SERVICE.

attribute.name: antA
attribute.description:
Designation of Antenna A connected to RX.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: ANTA RXMOC: ANTA RXMSC: ANTA

attribute.name: antB
attribute.description:
Designation of Antenna B connected to RX.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RXMOI: ANTB RXMOC: ANTB RXMSC: ANTB

attribute.name: imbVamos
attribute.description:
VAMOS allocation usage when RX path imbalance exists or feeders are swapped.
Indicates if VAMOS allocation is allowed when RX path imbalance exists or feeders are swapped. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RXMOC: IMBVAMOS

attribute.name: rxd
attribute.description:
RX diversity, the combination of RX antennas to be used.
Depends on RXMOI: RXD RXMOC: RXD

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the RX MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the RX MO. If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the RX MO.
The actual RX MO state is stored in moOperState.
If the attribute G12Rx.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Rx.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with RX MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with RX MO is immediately ended.
If the attribute G12Rx.forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of G12Rx.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order fails if the MO carries a physical channel.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change the attribute from OUT_OF_SERVICE the attribute G12Trxc.moAdmState of superior TRXC MO must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced RX MO blocking indication.
If the attribute G12Rx.forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of G12Rx.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order fails if the MO carries a physical channel.
If the attribute G12Rx.forcedBlocking is set to YES during change of G12Rx.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then the blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with RX MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with RX MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12RxIndividual
attribute.description: Internal individual id.

attribute.name: arfcnMinCap
attribute.description: The minimum ARFCN.

attribute.name: arfcnMaxCap
attribute.description: The maximum ARFCN.

attribute.name: bandCap
attribute.description:
Describes the band capability.
This bitmap is expressed as a string of bits, where:
Bit 0 - GSM 1900 Bit 1 - GSM 1800 Bit 2 - GSM 900 Bit 3 - GSM 800

attribute.name: rxDivCap
attribute.description:
Describes capability of RX diversity.
This bitmap is expressed as a string of bits, where:
Bit 0 - B Bit 1 - A Bit 2 - AB Bit 3 - ABCD

class.name: G12Ts
class.description:
Represents a TS MO in the BTS logical model G12.
Provides the functionality for controlling, signaling and processing for one time slot of a TDMA frame.

attribute.name: g12TsId
attribute.description:
Holds the number of TS MO and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RXMOI: MO RXMOE: MO

attribute.name: moOperState
attribute.description:
Actual global state of the TS MO.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: blState
attribute.description:
Blocking state of the TS MO.
If more than one blocking is active, the attribute is set to the blocking with highest priority.
Depends on RXMSP

attribute.name: moAdmState
attribute.description:
Wanted global state of the TS MO.
The actual TS MO state is stored in G12Ts.moOperState.
If the attribute G12Ts.forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of G12Ts.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking of the MO is delayed until traffic associated with this MO is ended for other reasons. If the MO carries a broadcast control channel, the blocking order is not accepted.
If the attribute G12Ts.forcedBlocking is set to YES during changing of G12Ts.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXESI RXESE RXBLI RXBLE
attribute.dependencies: To change moAdmState from OUT_OF_SERVICE the parent G12Trx moAdmState must be set to DEBLOCKED or BLOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute from DEBLOCKED may affect traffic.

attribute.name: forcedBlocking
attribute.description:
Forced TS MO blocking indication.
If the attribute G12Ts.forcedBlocking is set to NO during change of G12Ts.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking of the MO is delayed until traffic associated with this MO is ended for other reasons. If the MO carries a broadcast control channel, the blocking order is not accepted.
If the attribute G12Ts.forcedBlocking is set to YES during changing of G12Ts.moAdmState from DEBLOCKED to BLOCKED, then blocking order is executed immediately, and the MO is taken out of operation. This results in handover attempts for the traffic channels associated with each MO. If the handover attempts fail, the traffic associated with each MO is immediately ended.
Depends on RXBLI: FORCE

attribute.name: g12TsIndividual
attribute.description: internal individual id.

attribute.name: xRaCap
attribute.description:
Extended range indicator.
It indicates whether the TS handler is capable of extended range ON, extended range OFF, or both.

attribute.name: agcBlkCap
attribute.description:
Describes the number of CCCH blocks that are reserved for the access grant channel.
This bitmap is expressed as a string of bits, where:
Bit 0 - CCCH 0 Bit 1 - CCCH 1 Bit 2 - CCCH 2 Bit 3 - CCCH 3 Bit 4 - CCCH 4 Bit 5 - CCCH 5 Bit 6 - CCCH 6 Bit 7 - CCCH 7

attribute.name: fnOffSupMinCap
attribute.description: Minimum supported frame number offset.

attribute.name: fnOffSupMaxCap
attribute.description: Maximum supported frame number offset.

class.name: CoreNetwork
class.description: Contains the data the BSC needs for communicating with the CN. - Msc represents the MSC nodes which the BSC is connected to. - Plmn represents the PLMNs which the BSC is connected to. - SgsnIP represents the SGSNs over IP which the BSC is connected to. - SubscriberProfileIdTable represents SPID table in the BSC.

attribute.name: coreNetworkId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: callDropMsc
attribute.description:
Reporting of dropped call reason to MSC.
Indicates if the reason for dropped call is to be reported to the MSC. The reason is sent to the MSC in the message Clear Request.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=CALLDROPMSC

attribute.name: cicCoding
attribute.description:
CIC coding method.
Indicates how the BSC handles the CIC on the A-interface for T1 systems. Attribute is also valid for E1 systems, but the value must not be changed and must always be set to LSB_FIRST.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=CICCODING

attribute.name: clMrkMsg
attribute.description:
Classmark message handling.
Indicates how the message Classmark Change is handled, if it is received as a first RR message from the MS.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=CLMRKMSG
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute is ignored when the MS is CS multislot capable.

attribute.name: gbTransport
attribute.description:
Gb transport protocol activation. Controls which of the two protocols, IP or Frame Relay, is active for the Gb interface. When attribute is changed the network services can be activated and GPRS support can be switched on for all relevant cells.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=GBTRANSPORT
attribute.dependencies: At the time of changing the active transport protocol from Frame Relay to Gb over IP, or in the opposite way, there must be no network service established and the GPRS support must be switched off in all cells.

attribute.name: geranMaxIpep
attribute.description:
Maximum number of LIPs for GERAN.
The availability of the attribute values other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=GERANMAXIPEP
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute should be equal or greater than number of defined IP addresses.

attribute.name: gprsNwMode
attribute.description:
Specifies parameter NETWORK_OPERATION_MODE in the messages SYSTEM INFORMATION TYPE 13.
The availability of the attribute values other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=GPRSNWMODE

attribute.name: mncDigitHand
attribute.description:
Specifies how the BSC handles MNC.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=MNCDIGITHAND
attribute.dependencies: If the value of the attribute is A3_AIR2 then the third MNC digit must be 0. Changing the value from ALL3 to different value is only allowed if the third MNC digit is 0 for all defined cells and Subscriber Profile ID tables. If any cell or any Subscriber Profile ID table with the third MNC digit not equal to 0 exists then this cell or SPID table must be undefined before the attribute value can be changed from ALL3 to another value.

attribute.name: pcmLaw
attribute.description:
PCM law type.
Specifies PCM law encoding type on A-interface.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=PCMLAW

attribute.name: rtpSupervision
attribute.description:
A-interface over IP user plane supervision state.
Specifies whether A-interface over IP user plane supervision is activated in the BSC. If RTCP packets are sent at least every five seconds for each user plane connection by all MGW nodes, then it is recommended to activate A-interface over IP user plane supervision in the BSC.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=RTPSUPERVISION

attribute.name: traceMsgType
attribute.description:
Trace message type at Cell Traffic Recording.
Indicates which message is sent to the MSC and the new BSC to start Cell Traffic Recording at inter BSC handover.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TRACEMSGTYPE

attribute.name: uTdoaMRMode
attribute.description:
U-TDOA measurement report mode.
Indicates if measurement reports are sent in the 3GPP TS 48.071 U-TDOA RESPONSE and 48.071 RESET messages.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=UTDOAMRMODE
attribute.disturbances: When the uTdoaMRMode is activated, the optional IE Measurement Report will not be sent.

attribute.name: sgsnSelMeth
attribute.description:
SGSN selection method for the BSC.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRCOC: SGSNSELMETH
attribute.precondition: No PLMN assigned to any NSEI.

attribute.name: mscNriLength
attribute.description:
Length of NRI values used by CS services.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNLC: MSCNRILENGTH
attribute.precondition: All active MSCs must be connected to any PLMN.

attribute.name: sgsnNriLength
attribute.description:
Length of NRI values used by PS services.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNLC: SGSNNRILENGTH
attribute.precondition: All active NSEs must be connected to any PLMN.

attribute.name: sgsnRel
attribute.description:
Specifies the value of the parameter SGSNR included in messages SYSTEM INFORMATION TYPE 13.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=SGSNREL

attribute.name: aoIpState
attribute.description:
State of the functionality A-Interface over IP.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRAII RRAIE RRAIP: STATE

attribute.name: aoIpDscpRtp
attribute.description:
DSCP for RTP traffic used by A-Interface over IP.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRAGC: DSCP

attribute.name: aoIpDscpRtcp
attribute.description:
DSCP for RTCP traffic used by A-Interface over IP.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRAGC: DSCP1

attribute.name: aoIpJitterBufferSize
attribute.description:
Jitter buffer size used by A-Interface over IP.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRAGC: JBS

attribute.name: aoIpMaxBundlingTime
attribute.description:
Maximum bundling time for multiplexing session used by A-Interface over IP.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRAGC: MBT

attribute.name: aoIpMaxPacketSize
attribute.description:
Maximum packet size in multiplexing session used by A-Interface over IP.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRAGC: MPS

attribute.name: timer13
attribute.description:
Specifies the minimum time before sending RESET ACK message to the MSC.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TIMER13
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute can be changed only when Market Adaptation M-260 is activated.

attribute.name: timer4
attribute.description:
Specifies the maximum waiting time for RESET ACK message from the MSC or SMLC.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=TIMER4
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute can be changed only when Market Adaptation M-260 is activated.

class.name: Msc
class.description: Contains data needed for MSC configuration. This MOC contains the MSC identity and MSC mode, and also other data which should be configured separately. It is possible to define only 32 MSCs. For removing MSC next actions should be performed: - specific MSC mode must be set to INACTIVE - all related NRIs must be deleted - all relations with PLMNs must be deleted - all A-interface devices must not be connected to this MSC.

attribute.name: mscId
attribute.description:
Holds the symbolic name of the MSC and is also used when identifying the MO.
The MSC name ALL is not allowed. Symbolic name 1 - 7 characters. Symbolic name 1 - 8 characters, when Market Adaptation M-110 is active.
Depends on RRMBI: MSC
attribute.dependencies: 8 character name is allowed when Bsc.support8Char is set to 8.

attribute.name: usedByPlmn
attribute.description:
PLMN to which the MSC is related.
Depends on RRPRP

attribute.name: cap
attribute.description:
Capacity of the MSC relative to other MSCs.
Specifies the capacity of the MSC relative to other MSCs in an MSC pool area, and is used at distribution of subscribers at MSC selection.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLTDC: CAP
attribute.dependencies: To change this attribute, each active MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned. The inactive MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned in case this MSC is related to the CN with active MSC or in case if functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell. If the attribute CoreNetwork.gprsNwMode is set to NETWORK_MODE_1, the MSC must have a CNID assigned. If at least one PLMN is defined or functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell, the MSC must be connected to a PLMN, and all other MSCs in mode other than INACTIVE must also be connected to a PLMN.

attribute.name: cnId
attribute.description:
Identifies a paging MSC, used at CS paging through SGSN, when MS is identified using IMSI.
It is used in BSC to be able to send the page response back to the originating MSC. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The attribute value must be unique for each MSC, represented by MOs Msc. This attribute is not valid for stand-alone TRCs.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRMBC: CNID RRMBI: CNID

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description:
Defines the mode of the MSC in the BSC.
In mode ACTIVE the MSC is in normal operation. MSC reselection is initiated by setting the attribute to RESELECT and is a procedure that allows operators to move MSs between MSCs in a pool at the next location update. The mechanism works by moving a certain fraction of the MSs, specified by the attribute part, from one MSC, and distribute the load over the other MSCs in mode ACTIVE in the MSC pool according to the MSC selection procedure. The reselection algorithm that decides which MSs to move, is designed in such a way that the moved MSs represents an avarage user in terms of user behavior. It uses the last eight bits of the TMSI value, and the value ot the attribute rand for the calculations. By setting the attribute to BARRED, the subscribers in the MSC will be redistributed at the next MS originating access to the network. The mode should be kept during at least a time period that corresponds to the timer for periodic registration. This to make sure that the remaining MSs are moved to other MSCs in the pool. To remove an MSC from an MSC pool and take it out of service, this attribute must be set to INACTIVE. In this case, all ongoing calls are terminated. It is therefore strongly recommended that MSC reselection is used to move as many subscribers as possible from that MSC to other MSCs before setting attribute to INACTIVE. This can be done by setting it to RESELECT and after a while to BARRED.
The possibility to have more than one MSC in mode ACTIVE, and to change MSC mode from INACTIVE or ACTIVE to RESELECT or BARRED depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLTDC: MODE
attribute.dependencies: To change this attribute, each active MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned. The inactive MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned in case this MSC is related to the CN with active MSC or in case if functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell. If the attribute CoreNetwork.gprsNwMode is set to NETWORK_MODE_1, the MSC must have a CNID assigned. If at least one PLMN is defined or functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell, the MSC must be connected to a PLMN, and all other MSCs in mode other than INACTIVE must also be connected to a PLMN.
attribute.disturbances: Changing the attribute to INACTIVE ends all ongoing calls.

attribute.name: part
attribute.description:
Sets the percentage of subscribers moved at MSC reselection. It is possible to change the value of the attribute during an ongoing reselection session without terminating the session.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLTDC: PART
attribute.dependencies: To change this attribute, each active MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned. The inactive MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned in case this MSC is related to the CN with active MSC or in case if functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell. If the attribute CoreNetwork.gprsNwMode is set to NETWORK_MODE_1, the MSC must have a CNID assigned. If at least one PLMN is defined or functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell, the MSC must be connected to a PLMN, and all other MSCs in mode other than INACTIVE must also be connected to a PLMN.

attribute.name: rand
attribute.description:
Sets random value used at MSC reselection.
Attribute must be set to different values for different MSC reselection sessions. A change of the value in an ongoing session means that the session is terminated, and a new session is initiated.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLTDC: RAND
attribute.dependencies: To change this attribute, each active MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned. The inactive MSC must have an NRI, set by attribute nri, assigned in case this MSC is related to the CN with active MSC or in case if functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell. If the attribute CoreNetwork.gprsNwMode is set to NETWORK_MODE_1, the MSC must have a CNID assigned. If at least one PLMN is defined or functionality GSM MOCN, set by attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated in at least one cell, the MSC must be connected to a PLMN, and all other MSCs in mode other than INACTIVE must also be connected to a PLMN.

attribute.name: relCap
attribute.description:
Relative capacity.
The MSC capacity, related to all active MSCs CAP values defined in Pool.

attribute.name: csfb
attribute.description:
Indicates if the functionality Circuit Switched Fallback is supported in the MSC.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFMSC: CSFB

attribute.name: nri
attribute.description:
NRI is a part of TMSI and is used to route messages to the specified MSC.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNRI: NRI RRNRE: NRI
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Multiple Core Network Support is activated, the MSCs connected to the same PLMN must not have the same NRI. If the functionality GSM MOCN, set by the attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated, then the MSCs must not have the same NRI, regardless of the MSCs’ state. The maximum value of this attribute depends on the attribute Plmn.mscNriLength or CoreNetwork.mscNriLength and is calculated using the following formula: (2^mscNriLength - 1). If a transaction contains a creation of an MSC-PLMN relation, set by the attribute Plmn.usesMsc, this attribute must be set in a separate transaction, unless the value of the attribute CoreNetwork.mscNriLength equals or exceeds the length of this attribute. It is not possible to associate NRI to MSC when attribute mscNriLength is equal to 0. The NRI can be associated with MSC which are related to only one PLMN. If at least one PLMN is defined in BSC, NRIs can only be associated with the MSCs related to a PLMN. The MSCs connected to the PLMN must not have the same NRI value as any of the other CS domain null NRI values defined for any of sharing PLMN operator.

attribute.name: sp
attribute.description:
Signaling point of MSC.
For signalling networks based on CCITT standard, it is expressed as nei-dpc, where:
nei Network indicator Numeral 0 - 3
dpc Destination point code Numeral 0 - 16383
For signalling networks based on ANSI standard, it is expressed as n-c-m, where:
n Network code Numeral 0 - 255
c Cluster code Numeral 0 - 255
m Member code Numeral 0 - 255
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The attribute value must be unique for each MSC, represented by MOs Msc.
Depends on RRMBC: SP RRMBI: SP
attribute.dependencies: Change of this attribute is only allowed when the MSC mode, set by the attribute mode, is INACTIVE.

attribute.name: mscIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

class.name: Plmn
class.description:
Contains PLMN data.
Maximum number of PLMN operator names depends on such conditions: If functionality Multiple Core Network Support is activated in the BSC, it is allowed to define the maximum of eight PLMN operator names. If functionalities Multiple Core Network Support and GSM MOCN are activated in the BSC, it is allowed to define the maximum of five PLMN operator names. If functionalities Multiple Core Network Support and GSM MOCN are activated in the BSC and the cell has the mcc-mnc part of CGI that differs from any of thePLMN mcc-mnc, it is allowed to define the maximum of four PLMN operator names. If functionality GSM MOCN is activated, and Multiple Core Network Support is not activated, it is allowed to define the maximum of one PLMN operator name.
During creation of the first PLMN, all active SGSNs and MSCs should be added to this PLMN. When there is a need to add SGSNs or MSCs to a PLMN, other then the first PLMN, these SGSNs or MSCs must set to passive before the creation of the first PLMN.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='mccAndMncSetTogether' test="( (exists(@mcc) and exists(@mnc)) or (not(exists(@mcc)) and not(exists(@mnc))) )"> Attributes mcc and mnc must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='mccAndMncSetTogether' test="( (exists(@mcc) and exists(@mnc)) or (not(exists(@mcc)) and not(exists(@mnc))) )"> Attributes mcc and mnc must be set together in one transaction in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: plmnId
attribute.description:
Holds the symbolic name of PLMN operator and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RRPRI: PLMNNAME RRPRE: PLMNNAME

attribute.name: usesMsc
attribute.description:
MSC to which the PLMN is related.
Definition of the PLMN relation to MSC node in modes, other than inactive, is allowed only if there is an active cell with the mcc-mnc part of CGI corresponding to a PLMN operator identity or no cell is active. Definition of the PLMN relations for the second PLMN operator to the MSC is allowed only if all not inactive MSCs are already related to a PLMN operator. The PLMN relation to one PLMN for both pooled and shared nodes is not allowed. The last PLMN relation to an active MSC node cannot be deleted, except for relation to the last active MSC in the BSC where no active shared cells exist. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRPRI: MSC RRPRE: MSC

attribute.name: usesSgsnIp
attribute.description:
SGSN to which the PLMN is related.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRPRI: NSEI RRPRE: NSEI
attribute.dependencies: Definition of the PLMN relation to an active NSE node with existing active cells, that have GPRS support activated, is allowed only if there is an active cell with GPRS support activated and the mcc-mnc part of the CGI that is corresponding to the PLMN operator identity. When the functionality GSM MOCN is active in cells, a PLMN relation to an NSE node cannot be defined, if there is any existing active non-shared cell with GPRS support activated and mcc-mnc part of the CGI is not corresponding to the PLMN operator identity. The PLMN relation to a passive NSE can be defined only if all active NSEs are related to the PLMN. The PLMN relation to the node with assigned NRIs is allowed only, if the nodes NRI length matches PLMN NRI length. The node with associated NRIs cannot be shared between multiple PLMN operators. To delete a relation, the network service state, set by the attribute SgsnIp.nsState, must be PASSIVE. A relation cannot be deleted if there is any active GPRS non-shared cell belonging to this PLMN, that is a cell with the mcc-mnc part of the CGI corresponding to this PLMN operator identity.

attribute.name: mcc
attribute.description:
Mcc part of the PLMN operator identity.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRPRI: PLMN
attribute.dependencies: Must be set together with the attribute mnc. Only one PLMN operator name can be assigned to the PLMN operator identity and it must be unique in the system.

attribute.name: mnc
attribute.description:
Mnc part of the PLMN operator identity.
The availability of this attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRPRI: PLMN
attribute.dependencies: Must be set together with the attribute mcc. Allowed mnc length depends on the setting of the attribute CoreNetwork.mncDigitHand. Only one PLMN operator name can be assigned to the PLMN operator identity and it must be unique in the system.

attribute.name: plmnDistr
attribute.description:
Relative weight in traffic distribution.
Changes the relative weight of this PLMN operator in relation to other sharing PLMN operators concerning distribution of subscribers not related to any of the PLMNs defined in the BSC.
The availability of this command depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRPDC: PLMNDISTR

attribute.name: nullNriCs
attribute.description:
Null NRI for the CS domain.
A null NRI is a specific value of NRI, used for load distribution purposes. The load distribution concerns CN nodes connected to a PLMN. The maximum value of this attribute depends on the attribute mscNriLength and is calculated using the following formula: (2^mscNriLength - 1).
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNRI: NULLNRICS RRNRE: NULLNRICS
attribute.dependencies: It is not possible to set this attribute, when the attribute mscNriLength is set to 0. The value of this attribute must not be equal to any of the other CS domain null NRI values, defined for any other sharing PLMN operator. The value of this attribute must not be the same as the value of the attribute Msc.nri, defined for any MSC connected to the BSC. The value of the attribute nullNriCs cannot exceed the maximum value specified by the attribute Plmn.mscNriLength or CoreNetwork.mscNriLength.

attribute.name: nullNriPs
attribute.description:
Null NRI for the PS domain.
A null NRI is a specific value of NRI, used for load distribution purposes. The load distribution concerns CN nodes connected to a PLMN. The maximum value of this attribute depends on the attribute sgsnNriLength and is calculated using the following formula: (2^sgsnNriLength - 1).
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNRI: NULLNRIPS RRNRE: NULLNRIPS
attribute.dependencies: It is not possible to set this attribute, when the attribute mscNriLength is set to 0. The value of this attribute must not be equal to any of the other PS domain null NRI values, defined for any other sharing PLMN operator. The value of this attribute must not be equal to the value of the attribute Msc.nri, defined for any MSC connected to the BSC. The value of the attribute nullNriPs cannot exceed the maximum value specified by the attribute Plmn.sgsnNriLength or CoreNetwork.sgsnNriLength.

attribute.name: imsiPat
attribute.description:
IMSI series patterns.
A subscriber, with IMSI, which matches defined IMSI series pattern, is routed to a corresponding sharing PLMN operator.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRPDC: IMSIPAT

attribute.name: sgsnSelMeth
attribute.description:
SGSN selection method for the PLMN.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRCOC: SGSNSELMETH
attribute.precondition: PLMN must be assigned to defined NSEIs.

attribute.name: sgsnNriLength
attribute.description:
Length of NRI values used by PS services.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRCOC: SGSNNRILENGTH
attribute.precondition: All active NSEs must be connected to any PLMN.

attribute.name: plmnIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

attribute.name: mscNriLength
attribute.description:
Length of NRI values used by CS services.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRCOC: MSCNRILENGTH
attribute.precondition: All active MSCs must be connected to any PLMN.

attribute.name: nri
attribute.description:
NRI is a part of TMSI and is used to route messages to the specified MSC.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNRI: NRI RRNRE: NRI
attribute.statusInformation: Since G18.Q3 release, change of this attribute has no impact on the BSC behavior.
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Multiple Core Network Support is activated, the MSCs connected to the same PLMN must not have the same NRI. If the functionality GSM MOCN, set by the attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated, then the MSCs must not have the same NRI, regardless of the MSC state. The maximum value of this attribute depends on the attribute CoreNetwork.sgsnNriLength and is calculated using the following formula: (2^sgsnNriLength - 1). It is not possible to associate NRI to MSC when attribute sgsnNriLength is equal to 0. The NRI can be associated with NSE which are related to only one PLMN. If at least one PLMN is defined in BSC, NRIs can only be associated with the MSCs related to a PLMN. The NSEs connected to the PLMN must not have the same NRI value as any of the other PS domain null NRI values defined for any of sharing PLMN operator.

class.name: SgsnIp
class.description: This MOC represents the SGSN connected with Gb over IP.

attribute.name: sgsnIpId
attribute.description:
Holds the NSE identifier for the SGSN and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RRINI: NSEI RRINE: NSEI

attribute.name: usedByPlmn
attribute.description:
PLMN to which the SGSN is related.
Depends on RRPRP

attribute.name: cap
attribute.description:
The capacity of SGSN relative to other SGSNs.
The availability of the attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRINI: CAP RRINC: CAP

attribute.name: nsState
attribute.description:
Network service state.
Depends on RRINC: NSSTATE
attribute.disturbances: Change of the attribute to PASSIVE affects ongoing GPRS traffic on the Gb interface.

attribute.name: pPort
attribute.description:
The primary port number represents an end point for IP based network communication.
Depends on RRINI: PPORT RRINC: PPORT

attribute.name: pRip
attribute.description:
Primary remote IP address.
The primary remote IP address is used for dynamic configurationof IP based network communication between local IP end point and remote IP end point.
Depends on RRINI: PRIP RRINC: PRIP

attribute.name: nsStatus
attribute.description:
Status of NS entity.
Depends on RRINP: NSSTATUS

attribute.name: nri
attribute.description:
NRI is a part of TMSI and is used to route messages to the specified NSEI.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRNRI: NRI RRNRE: NRI
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Multiple Core Network Support is activated, the NSEs connected to the same PLMN must not have the same NRI. If the functionality GSM MOCN, set by the attribute IdleModeAndPaging.mocnState, is activated, then the NSEs must not have the same NRI, regardless of the NSE state. The maximum value of this attribute depends on the attribute Plmn.sgsnNriLength or CoreNetwork.sgsnNriLength and is calculated using the following formula: (2^sgsnNriLength - 1). If a transaction contains a creation of an SGSN-PLMN relation, set by the attribute Plmn.usesSgsnIp, this attribute must be set in a separate transaction, unless the value of the attribute CoreNetwork.mscNriLength equals or exceeds the length of this attribute. It is not possible to associate NRI to NSE when attribute sgsnNriLength is equal to 0. The NRI can be associated with NSE which are related to only one PLMN. If at least one PLMN is defined in BSC, NRIs can only be associated with the NSEs related to a PLMN. The NSEs connected to the PLMN must not have the same NRI value as any of the other PS domain null NRI values defined for any of sharing PLMN operator.

attribute.name: poolFeat
attribute.description:
Bitmap of BSC features supported for the SGSNs in the pool.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bits where: B0 - Packet Flow Context B1 - Current Bucket Level B2 - INR B3 - LCS B4 - RIM B5 - PFC Flow Control B6 - ERS B7 - MBMS B8 - PS Handover B9 - Gigabit Interface B10 - MOCN B11 - Not used B12 - EC-GSM IoT B13 - Not used B14 - Extended DRX B15 - Not used
Each bit position, if set, indicates support of an optional feature.
Depends on RRBVP

attribute.name: sgsnFeat
attribute.description:
Bitmap of BSC features supported for a single SGSN.
This bitmap is expressed as a set of bits where: B0 - Packet Flow Context B1 - Current Bucket Level B2 - INR B3 - LCS B4 - RIM B5 - PFC Flow Control B6 - ERS B7 - MBMS B8 - PS Handover B9 - Gigabit Interface B10 - MOCN B11 - Not used B12 - EC-GSM IoT B13 - Not used B14 - Extended DRX B15 - Not used
Each bit position, if set, indicates support of an optional feature.
Depends on RRBVP

attribute.name: sigBvcState
attribute.description:
Signaling BVC state.
Depends on RRBVP

attribute.name: sgsnIpIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

class.name: Rnc
class.description:
Contains attributes related to RNC in the BSC and set a signaling point for this RNC.
This MOC is available only in BSC/TRC nodes.

attribute.name: rncId
attribute.description:
Holds the identifier of the RNC and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RRRBI: RNC RRRBE: RNC

attribute.name: nei
attribute.description:
Network indicator part of the signaling point of RNC.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRRBI: NEI
attribute.dependencies: Can only be set together with the attribute dpc.

attribute.name: dpc
attribute.description:
Destination point code part of the signaling point of RNC.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RRRBI: DPC
attribute.dependencies: Can only be set together with the attribute nei.

attribute.name: rncIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

class.name: SubscriberProfileIdTable
class.description:
Contains SPID table data in the BSC.
This class can also contain instances of SpidDefaultEutranFrequency and SpidDefaultUtranFddFrequency classes, which represent default priority data for E-UTRAN ARFCN frequencies and UTRAN FDD frequencies. To create these classes, the value of the attribute SubscriberProfileIdTable.tState must be set to INACTIVE and specified SubscriberProfileIdTable.tableType must match priority type. If not all 256 SPIDs, represented by MOs SubscriberProfileId, are defined, the DEFAULT SPID for the SPID table, set by attributes dafaultAction and defaultGPrio, must be defined.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id ='actionForActionInSpidTable' test="((@defaultSpid = 1 and exists(@defaultAction)) or (@defaultSpid=0))">The value of the attribute defaultAction must be defined when the attribute defaultSpid is set to YES in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id ='gprioForActionInSpidTable' test="(((@defaultAction = 0 and exists(@defaultGPrio)) or ((@defaultAction = 1 or @defaultAction = 2) and not(exists(@defaultGPrio))) and @defaultSpid=1) or (@defaultSpid=0))">Attribute defaultGPrio can only be set when the attribute defaultAction is set to DEFPRIO in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id ='actionForActionInSpidTable' test="((@defaultSpid = 1 and exists(@defaultAction)) or (@defaultSpid=0))">The value of the attribute defaultAction must be defined when the attribute defaultSpid is set to YES in <name path="."/></assert> <assert id ='gprioForActionInSpidTable' test="(((@defaultAction = 0 and exists(@defaultGPrio)) or ((@defaultAction = 1 or @defaultAction = 2) and not(exists(@defaultGPrio))) and @defaultSpid=1) or (@defaultSpid=0))">Attribute defaultGPrio can only be set when the attribute defaultAction is set to DEFPRIO in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: subscriberProfileIdTableId
attribute.description:
Specifies the subscriber profile table ID and is used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RFSTI: TABLEID RFSTE: TABLEID
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute SubcriberProfileIdTable.tState must be set to INACTIVE when the values of the attributes: defaultGPrio, defaultPci, defaultPl, or defaultPvi are changed.

attribute.name: tableType
attribute.description:
Defines SPID table configuration type.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSTI: TABLETYPE

attribute.name: tState
attribute.description:
Changes the SPID table activation status for the BSC.
To activate a SPID table, either all 256 SPIDs must be defined, by creating appropriate MOCs SubscriberProfileId or, if not all 256 SPIDs are defined, the DEFAULT SPID for the SPID table must be defined. Default SPID is created by setting attributes defaultAction, defaultGPrio, and creation SpidDefaultEutranFrequency and SpidDefaultUtranFddFrequency MOCs. The SPID table must be deactivated before it can be deleted.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSTC: TSTATE
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute tState must be set to INACTIVE to change the value of the attribute defaultSpid.

attribute.name: defaultAction
attribute.description:
Defines the default type of action on the air interface.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDI: ACTION
attribute.dependencies: The attribute value DEFPRIO must be set together with the attribute defaultGPrio. If the value of the attribute defaultSpid is set to NO, this attribute is cleared automatically.

attribute.name: defaultGPrio
attribute.description:
Default GERAN individual priority.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDI: GPRIO RFSDC: GPRIO
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if the value of the attribute SubscriberProfileIdTable.defaultAction is set to DEFPRIO. If the value of the attribute defaultSpid is set to NO, this attribute is cleared automatically. Attributes SubscriberProfileIdTable.defaultGPrio, SpidDefaultEutranFrequency.defaultLPrio, and SpidDefaultUtranFddFrequency.defaultWPrio must not have the same priority values.

attribute.name: mcc
attribute.description:
Mcc part of the PLMN operator identity.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSTI: PLMN
attribute.dependencies: Only one SPID table can be defined for each PLMN. Must be set together with mnc attribute.

attribute.name: mnc
attribute.description:
Mnc part of the PLMN operator identity.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSTI: PLMN
