attribute.dependencies: Allowed mnc length depends on CoreNetwork.mncDigitHand attribute setting. Must be set together with mcc attribute.

attribute.name: spidTableIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

attribute.name: defaultSpid
attribute.description:
Default configuration settings applied for any SPID value are not explicitly defined.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDI RFSDE
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute defaultSpid must be set to YES in the same transaction to change the value of the attribute defaultAction.
attribute.sideEffects: If set to NO, attributes defaultAction, defaultgPrio and MOCs SpidDefaultEutranFrequency SpidDefaultUtranFddFrequency are cleared automatically.

attribute.name: defaultPci
attribute.description:
Describes the default preemption capability indicator.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: PCI
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute defaultPl is set to undefined value, this attribute has no effect on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: defaultPvi
attribute.description:
Describes the default preemption vulnerability indicator.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: PVI
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute defaultPl is set to undefined value, this attribute has no effect on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: defaultPl
attribute.description:
Describes the default allocation priority level.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: PL
attribute.sideEffects: When this attribute is set to undefined value, attributes defaultPci and defaultPvi have no effect on the BSC behavior.

class.name: SubscriberProfileId
class.description:
Contains SPID data.
This class can also contain instances of SpidEutranFrequency and SpidUtranFddFrequency classes, which represent priority data for E-UTRAN ARFCN frequencies and UTRAN FDD frequencies. To create these classes, the value of the attribute SubscriberProfileIdTable.tState must be set to INACTIVE and the specified SubscriberProfileIdTable.tableType must match priority type.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id ='gprioForActionInSpid' test="((@action = 0 and exists(@gPrio)) or ((@action = 1 or @action = 2) and not(exists(@gPrio))))">Attribute gPrio can only be set it the attribute action is set to DEFPRIO in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id ='gprioForActionInSpid' test="((@action = 0 and exists(@gPrio)) or ((@action = 1 or @action = 2) and not(exists(@gPrio))))">Attribute gPrio can only be set it the attribute action is set to DEFPRIO in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: subscriberProfileIdId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RFSDI: SPID RFSDE: SPID
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute SubcriberProfileIdTable.tState must be set to INACTIVE when the values of the attributes gPrio, pl, pvi, pci, fastReturnLteControl, or fastReturnWcdmaControl are changed. The value of the attribute SubcriberProfileIdTable.tState must be set to INACTIVE to delete MO SubcriberProfileId.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description:
Defines the type of action on the air interface.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDI: ACTION
attribute.dependencies: The attribute value DEFPRIO must be set together with the attribute gPrio.

attribute.name: gPrio
attribute.description:
Sets the GERAN individual priority. Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDI: GPRIO RFSDC: GPRIO
attribute.dependencies: Can be set only if the value of the attribute SubscriberProfileId.action is set to DEFPRIO. To change this attribute, the value of the attribute SubscriberProfileIdTable.tState must be set to INACTIVE. Attributes SubscriberProfileId.gPrio, SpidEutranFrequency.lPrio, and SpidUtranFddFrequency.wPrio must not have the same priority values. If set to no value, attribute SubscriberProfileIdTable.defaultGPrio is used instead.

attribute.name: spidIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

attribute.name: pci
attribute.description:
Describes the preemption capability indicator.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: PCI
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute pl is set to undefined value, this attribute has no effect on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: pvi
attribute.description:
Describes the preemption vulnerability indicator.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: PVI
attribute.dependencies: If attribute pl is set to undefined value, this attribute has no effect on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: pl
attribute.description:
Describes the allocation priority level.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: PL
attribute.sideEffects: When this attribute is set to undefined value, attributes pci and pvi have no effect on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: fastReturnLteControl
attribute.description:
Sets the state of the functionality Fast Return to LTE after Call Release.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: FRLCTRL

attribute.name: fastReturnWcdmaControl
attribute.description:
Sets the state of the functionality Fast Return to WCDMA after Call Release.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFSDC: FRWCTRL

class.name: GeranCellRelation
class.description:
Holds characteristics of the handover relation between the current cell and a neighboring GeranCell.
When this MOC is created with the attribute relationDirection set to MUTUAL, the system creates a twin MOC under the GeranCell that the relation refers to. The system keeps the configuration state of these two MOCs synchronized. Changes to any of these two MOCs, including deletion, will result in changes to the corresponding twin MOC.
When this MOC is created with the attribute relationDirection set to SINGLE, it is not allowed to create the GeranCellRelation MOC with the relation to this GeranCell under the related GeranCell.
This MOC can be created or removed by the functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations when the value of the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr is set to ACTIVE and the value of the attribute SonBsc.anrMode is set to UPDATE.
The availability of more than 8192 neighbor relations in the BSC depends on commercial agreements.

attribute.name: geranCellRelationId
attribute.description:
Holds the name of the neighboring GeranCell and is also used when identifying the MO.
Depends on RLNRI: CELLR RLNRE: CELLR
attribute.precondition: The MO identified by this attribute cannot be created or deleted if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell referenced by this attribute or in the cell referenced by the parent MO GeranCell.

attribute.name: awOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor, where assignment to worse cell is allowed.
Depends on RLNRC: AWOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: bqOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor for bad quality urgency handover .
Depends on RLNRC: BQOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: bqOffsetAfr
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor for bad quality urgency handover for the codec type AMR FR.
Depends on RLNRC: BQOFFSETAFR
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: tROffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when transition between K-cells and L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: TROFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: bqOffsetAwb
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor for bad quality urgency handover for the codec type AMR-WB.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLNRC: BQOFFSETAWB
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: cand
attribute.description:
Indicates in which cases the related cell is treated as a possible handover candidate.
Depends on RLNRC: CAND
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: cs
attribute.description:
Indicates if the cell and neighbor cell coexist at the same site.
Depends on RLNRC: CS
attribute.sideEffects: Setting of this attribute to the value YES causes that the activated functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations, set by the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr to the value ACTIVE, cannot remove the MOCs GeranCellRelation because of the evaluated handover statistics.

attribute.name: gprsValid
attribute.description:
Defines whether the relation allows GPRS cell reselection in addition to CS handover.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLGNC: GPRSVALID
attribute.dependencies: A Packet Broadcast Control Channel (PBCCH) has to be allocated in the cell in order to apply the functionality of this command.
attribute.precondition: The optional feature Packet Specific Cell Plan must be available in the system.

attribute.name: hiHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when evaluating high signal strength cells.
Depends on RLNRC: HIHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: kHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when evaluating K-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: KHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: kOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when evaluating K-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: KOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: lHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when evaluating L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: LHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: lOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when evaluating L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: LOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: loHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when evaluating low signal strength cells.
Depends on RLNRC: LOHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: offset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when evaluating cells with the Ericsson3 locating algorithm.
Depends on RLNRC: OFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: pROffset
attribute.description:
Packet reselection offset.
Used to calculate GPRS_RESELECT_OFFSET using the formula attribute value pROffset - attribute value kHyst if Ericsson1 locating algorithm is applied and attribute value pROffset - attribute value loHyst if Ericsson3 locating algorithm is applied. From -52 dB to -12 dB the value is stepped by 4 dB, from -12 dB to 12 dB the value is stepped by 2 dB, and from 12 dB to 48 dB the value is again stepped by 4 dB. If the attribute is changed for a mutual relation, then the reverse relation is also updated. The attribute for the reverse relation will have the same value but with opposite sign. Since the value -52 dB does not have a corresponding positive value, the reverse relation is set to 48 dB.
0 -52 dB 1 -48 dB 2 -44 dB . . . 9 -16 dB 10 -12 dB 11 -10 dB 12 -8 dB . . . 21 10 dB 22 12 dB 23 16 dB 24 20 dB . . . 31 48 dB
If attribute is set to no value, then broadcast value from Locating Emulation is used.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLGNC: PROFFSET
attribute.dependencies: A Packet Broadcast Control Channel (PBCCH) has to be allocated in the cell in order to apply the functionality of this command.
attribute.precondition: The optional feature Packet Specific Cell Plan must be available in the system.

attribute.name: tRHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when transition between K-cells and L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: TRHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm for defined cell relations.

attribute.name: relationDirection
attribute.description:
Relation direction type.
When relation is mutual, handover in both directions is allowed. When single relation is created and both cells belong to the same LA/RA, then the related cell is added to the cell CS paging array, PS paging array, or both if there is any free space in those arrays. When mutual relation is created and both cells belong to the same LA/RA, then the cells are added to arrays. The related cell is added to the cell CS paging array, PS paging array, or both if there is any free space in those arrays. The cell is added to the related cell CS paging array, PS paging array, or both if there is any free space in those arrays.
Depends on RLNRI

attribute.name: cellRelationIndividual
attribute.description: Relation ID.

attribute.name: relType
attribute.description:
Relation preference type.
Used for evaluating cells with the Automatic Handover Optimization locating algorithm.
Depends on RLNRC: RELTYPE
attribute.sideEffects: Setting of this attribute to the value PREFER or RESTRICT causes that the activated functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations, set by the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr to the value ACTIVE, cannot remove the MOCs GeranCellRelation because of the evaluated handover statistics.

class.name: ExternalGeranCellRelation
class.description:
Defines handover relation between a GeranCell and a neighboring ExternalGeranCell. Shall be set to the name of the value component of the external GeranCell that the relation is with.
This MOC can be created or removed by the functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations when the value of the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr is set to ACTIVE and the value of the attribute SonBsc.anrMode is set to UPDATE.

attribute.name: externalGeranCellRelationId
attribute.description:
To be set to the name of the value component of the ExternalGeranCell that the relation is with.
Depends on RLNRI: CELLR RLNRE: CELLR
attribute.precondition: The MO identified by this attribute cannot be created or deleted if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell referenced by the parent MO GeranCell.

attribute.name: awOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor where assignment to worse cell is allowed.
Depends on RLNRC: AWOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: bqOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor for bad quality urgency handover.
Depends on RLNRC: BQOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: bqOffsetAfr
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor for bad quality urgency handover for the codec type AMR FR.
Depends on RLNRC: BQOFFSETAFR
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: tROffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when transition between K-cells and L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: TROFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: bqOffsetAwb
attribute.description:
Signal strength corridor for bad quality urgency handover for the codec type AMR-WB.
Depends on RLNRC: BQOFFSETAWB
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: hiHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis used by the Ericsson3 locating algorithm.
Depends on RLNRC: HIHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: kHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when evaluating K-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: KHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: kOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when evaluating K-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: KOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: loHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis used by the Ericsson3 locating algorithm.
Depends on RLNRC: LOHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: lOffset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when evaluating L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: LOFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: lHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when evaluating L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: LHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: offset
attribute.description:
Signal strength offset when evaluating cells with the Ericsson3 locating algorithm.
Depends on RLNRC: OFFSET
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: pROffset
attribute.description:
Packet reselection offset.
Used to calculate GPRS_RESELECT_OFFSET using the formula attribute value pROffset - attribute value kHyst if Ericsson1 locating algorithm is applied and attribute value pROffset - attribute value loHyst if Ericsson3 locating algorithm is applied. From -52 dB to -12 dB the value is stepped by 4 dB, from -12 dB to 12 dB the value is stepped by 2 dB, and from 12 dB to 48 dB the value is again stepped by 4 dB. If the attribute is changed for a mutual relation, then the reverse relation is also updated. The attribute for the reverse relation will have the same value but with opposite sign. Since the value -52 dB does not have a corresponding positive value, the reverse relation is set to 48 dB.
0 -52 dB 1 -48 dB 2 -44 dB . . . 9 -16 dB 10 -12 dB 11 -10 dB 12 -8 dB . . . 21 10 dB 22 12 dB 23 16 dB 24 20 dB . . . 31 48 dB
If attribute is set to no value, then broadcast value from Locating Emulation is used. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLGNC: PROFFSET
attribute.dependencies: A Packet Broadcast Control Channel (PBCCH) has to be allocated in the cell in order to apply the functionality of this command.
attribute.precondition: The optional feature Packet Specific Cell Plan must be available in the system.

attribute.name: tRHyst
attribute.description:
Signal strength hysteresis when transition between K-cells and L-cells.
Depends on RLNRC: TRHYST
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: gprsValid
attribute.description:
Defines whether the relation allows GPRS cell reselection in addition to CS handover.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLGNC: GPRSVALID
attribute.dependencies: A Packet Broadcast Control Channel (PBCCH) has to be allocated in the cell in order to apply the functionality of this command.
attribute.precondition: The optional feature Packet Specific Cell Plan must be available in the system.

attribute.name: cand
attribute.description:
Indicates in which cases the related cell is treated as a possible handover candidate.
Depends on RLNRC: CAND
attribute.dependencies: If the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization, set by the attribute Mobility.aHoState, is active in the cell, this attribute is not used by locating algorithm in the cell.

attribute.name: cellRelationIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

attribute.name: relType
attribute.description:
Relation preference type.
Used for evaluating cells with the functionality Automatic Handover Optimization.
Depends on RLNRC: RELTYPE
attribute.sideEffects: Setting of this attribute to the value PREFER or RESTRICT causes that the activated functionality Automatic Neighbor Relations, set by the attribute SonBsc.bscAnr to the value ACTIVE, cannot remove the MOCs ExternalGeranCellRelation because of the evaluated handover statistics.

class.name: ExternalGeranCellM
class.description: Entry point for the external GSM radio network configuration for the BSC. ExternalGeranCell children contain configuration attributes and relations to internal cells.

attribute.name: externalGeranCellMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: UtraNetwork
class.description:
Entry point for the external UMTS Terrestrial radio access network configuration for the BSC.
ExternalUtranCell MOs contain configuration data and relations to internal cells.

attribute.name: utraNetworkId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: coexUmts
attribute.description:
Coexistence of GSM and UMTS.
Indicates whether the possibility to perform cell reselection and handover from GSM to UMTS is activated.
The availability of the attribute values other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=COEXUMTS

attribute.name: coexUmtsLSh
attribute.description:
Load sharing between UMTS and GSM.
Indicates whether the possibility to regulate the load in a GSM cell by controlling number of handovers of speech connections between GSM and UMTS systems is activated.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=COEXUMTSLSH

attribute.name: coexUmtstInt
attribute.description:
Time interval for traffic load check.
Controls how often the traffic load in an internal cell is checked. The traffic load is used to determine whether handover to a UTRAN cell should be allowed.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=COEXUMTSTINT

attribute.name: fastRet3GNC2
attribute.description:
Fast return to WCDMA at call release state.
Indicates if the multi RAT MSs are redirected immediately to WCDMA cell at call release. This function is applicable for DTM connections in GSM cells with active NC2 having WCDMA neighbors.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=FASTRET3GNC2

attribute.name: sBHoActive
attribute.description:
Service based handover activation state.
When the attribute is set to ACTIVE, the IE Service Handover indicates how the target system, GSM or UMTS, will be chosen at handover.
The availability of the attribute value other than the default one depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RAEPC: PROP=SBHOACTIVE

attribute.name: wcdmaHoQueuing
attribute.description:
Queuing of WCDMA calls in BSS.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RFBQI RFBQE
attribute.precondition: The optional features MS Queuing and Queuing of WCDMA Calls must be available.

class.name: UtranCellRelation
class.description:
Defines handover relation between a GeranCell and a neighboring ExternalUtranCell.
This MO can be created only for the ExternalUtranCell, for which attributes fddArfcn, mrsl, utranId, and scrCode are set.

attribute.name: utranCellRelationId
attribute.description:
To be set to the name of the value component of the ExternalUtranCell that the relation is with.
Depends on RLNRI: CELLR RLNRE: CELLR
attribute.precondition: The MO identified by this attribute cannot be created or deleted if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell referenced by the parent MO GeranCell.

attribute.name: utranCellRelationIndividual
attribute.description: Internal id.

class.name: IdleModeAndPaging
class.description:
Contains cell level data. This data is used to handle MS Idle mode behavior, Paging and how the MS access the network.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

attribute.name: idleModeAndPagingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: agBlk
attribute.description:
Number of reserved access grant blocks.
Sets the number of CCCH blocks reserved for the access grant channel. The remaining CCCH blocks are used for paging channel.
Numeral 0 - 7, if SDCCH/4 is not supported; Numeral 0 - 2, if SDCCH/4 is supported.
Depends on RLDEC: AGBLK
attribute.dependencies: Must be set to 1 or greater when SMSCB is in use, that is when CBCH is defined. The value of the attribute agBlk must be in range from 0 to 2 when the value of the attribute GeranCell.bcchType is set to COMB or COMBC.
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: mFrms
attribute.description:
Multiframes period. Sets the period of transmission for PAGING REQUEST messages to the same paging subgroup. This attribute is expressed as the number of CCCH multiframes.
Depends on RLDEC: MFRMS
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: acc
attribute.description:
Access control class.
Defines which access classes are barred. These access classes replace previous access classes.
0 - 9 Access control classes that are barred
10 Access to emergency calls not allowed for MSs belonging to access control classes 0 - 9
11 - 15 Access control classes that are barred
If attribute is set to no value, no access control classes are barred.
Depends on RLSBC: ACC

attribute.name: accMin
attribute.description:
The minimum received signal level at the MS for permission to access the system.
47 Greater than -48 dBm
48 -49 dBm to -48 dBm . . . 108 -109 dBm to -108 dBm
109 -110 dBm to -109 dBm
110 Less than -110 dBm
Depends on RLSSC: ACCMIN

attribute.name: att
attribute.description:
Attach and detach allowed. Indicates whether an MS must apply IMSI attach and detach or it is not allowed to apply IMSI attach and detach.
Depends on RLSBC: ATT

attribute.name: cb
attribute.description:
Defines if the cell is barred for access.
Depends on RLSBC: CB

attribute.name: cbq
attribute.description:
Cell bar qualify, defines the cell priority.
Depends on RLSBC: CBQ

attribute.name: crh
attribute.description:
The RXLEV hysteresis for required cell reselection over location area border.
Depends on RLSSC: CRH

attribute.name: cro
attribute.description:
Offset to encourage or discourage MSs to reselect the cell.
0 0 dB
1 2 dB
2 4 dB . . . 61 122 dB
62 124 dB
63 126 dB
Depends on RLSBC: CRO

attribute.name: maxRet
attribute.description:
Maximum number of retransmissions an MS may do when accessing the system.
Depends on RLSBC: MAXRET

attribute.name: pt
attribute.description:
Penalty time, defines duration for which temporary offset is applied.
0 20 s
1 40 s
2 60 s . . . 30 620 s
31 Temporary offset is ignored and the sign of cell reselect offset is changed.
Depends on RLSBC: PT

attribute.name: siMsg1
attribute.description:
System Information Type 1 BCCH Message state. Enables the distribution of System Information Messages Type 1 in a cell, connected to BTS equipment supporting GSM phase 2 system information.
Depends on RLSMC: SIMSG

attribute.name: siMsg7
attribute.description:
System Information Type 7 BCCH Message state. Enables the distribution of System Information Messages Type 7 in a cell, connected to BTS equipment supporting GSM phase 2 system information.
Depends on RLSMC: SIMSG

attribute.name: siMsg8
attribute.description:
System Information Type 8 BCCH Message state. Enables the distribution of System Information Messages Type 8 in a cell, connected to BTS equipment supporting GSM phase 2 system information.
Depends on RLSMC: SIMSG

attribute.name: t3212
attribute.description:
T3212 time-out value.
Defines the time-out value, which controls the location updating procedure, that is, when notifying the availability of the MS to the network.
0 Infinite time-out
1 0.1 h
2 0.2 h
3 0.3 h . . . 255 25.5 h
Depends on RLSBC: T3212

attribute.name: to
attribute.description:
Negative offset applied to cell reselect offset.
0 0 dB
1 10 dB
2 20 dB . . . 6 60 dB
7 Infinite
Depends on RLSBC: TO

attribute.name: tx
attribute.description:
Number of slots, over which the MS may spread transmission when accessing the system.
Depends on RLSBC: TX

attribute.name: nccPerm
attribute.description:
Allowed PLMN NCCs on BCCH carriers for which the MS is permitted to report measurement results. Up to eight NCCs can be defined.
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLSSC: NCCPERM
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the value of the attribute AxeParameterBsc.cceBaR is ACTIVE and the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any BaRecording MO other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: siUpdateRate
attribute.description:
Rate of sending system information messages to idle MSs. Sending of system information messages is triggered after change of one of GSM system information attributes: acc, att, cb, cbq, cro, maxRet, pt, t3212, to or tx.
Depends on RLSBC: SLOW

attribute.name: csPagingArray
attribute.description:
Specifies cell pointers used for CS Cell Paging.
Depends on RFPAC: CSCPAGARRAY
attribute.dependencies: Only related cells, which belong to the same Location Area (LA) as the specified cell can be added to the CS cell paging array.

attribute.name: psPagingArray
attribute.description:
Specifies cell pointers used for PS Cell Paging.
Depends on RFPAC: PSCPAGARRAY
attribute.dependencies: Only related cells, which belong to the same Routing Area (RA) as the specified cell can be added to the PS cell paging array.

attribute.name: mocnState
attribute.description:
Activation state of the functionality GSM MOCN in the cell.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLSHI: MOCN RLSHE: MOCN
attribute.precondition: To change this attribute, attribute GeranCell.state must be set to HALTED.

attribute.name: abMaxTa
attribute.description:
Maximum allowed timing advance of the access burst.
Attribute is given in number of bit periods.
The attribute value ranges: For normal range cell: Numeral 0 - 63 For extended range cell: Numeral 0 - 219
The attribute value ranges, when Market Adaptation M-056 is activated: For normal range cell: Numeral 0 - 64 For extended range cell: Numeral 0 - 219.
Depends on RLSSC: ABMAXTA
attribute.dependencies: When Market Adaptation M-056 is activated, the value of the attribute for normal range cell can be set to 64. The value of the attribute can be greater than 63, when it is set for extended range cell, set by the attribute GeranCell.xRange to YES.

attribute.name: cre
attribute.description:
Call re-establishment allowed. It indicates if an MS in the cell is allowed to perform Call Re-establishment.
Depends on RLSBC: CRE
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute can be changed only when Market Adaptation M-335 is activated.

attribute.name: accabMin
attribute.description:
Minimum signal level at access burst.
0 Less than -137 dBm 1 -137 dBm to -136 dBm 2 -136 dBm to -135 dBm . . .
25 -113 dBm to -112 dBm . . .
126 -12 dBm to -11 dBm 127 Greater than -11 dBm 128 Filtering is deactivated in a cell
Depends on RLSSC: ACCABMIN
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute can be changed only when Market Adaptation M-328 is activated.

class.name: ChannelAllocAndOpt
class.description:
Contains cell level data used for channels allocation and re-allocation.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='puThreshLLessThanpuThreshU' test="(@puThreshL lt @puThreshU)">The value of the attribute puThreshL must be less than the value of the attribute puThreshU in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='puThreshLLessThanpuThreshU' test="(@puThreshL lt @puThreshU)">The value of the attribute puThreshL must be less than the value of the attribute puThreshU in <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: channelAllocAndOptId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: chap
attribute.description:
Channel allocation profile identifier.
Depends on RLHPC: CHAP
attribute.dependencies: When the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by the attribute qtaStatus is active in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: csPsAlloc
attribute.description:
CS and PS allocation preference.
Determines if non-hopping TCHs on the BCCH frequency should be selected first, last or if there is no preference at CS and PS channel allocation.
Depends on RLCLC: CSPSALLOC
attribute.dependencies: When the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by the attribute qtaStatus is active in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: csPsPrio
attribute.description:
CS or PS priority.
Indicates if the CS selection preference for non-hopping TCHs on the BCCH frequency has higher or lower priority than the criterion to avoid TCH groups with PS priority.
Depends on RLCLC: CSPSPRIO
attribute.dependencies: When the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by the attribute qtaStatus is active in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: gprsPrio
attribute.description:
GPRS priority.
Controls whether preemptable on-demand PDCHs will be treated as idle or busy for functions: Dynamic Half Rate Allocation and TCH Packing Functions, Cell Load Sharing, Subcell Load Distribution and GSM - UMTS Cell Reselection and Handover, BTS Power Savings, MCPA Power Savings.
Preemptable on-demand PDCHs will be treated as busy or idle for the different functions according to the following table.
gprsprio ----BTS Power Savings ----------MCPA Power Savings ----------------GSM - UMTS Cell Reselection and Handover ----------------------Subcell Load Distribution ----------------------------Cell Load Sharing ----------------------------------Dynamic HR Allocation and TCH Packing Functions 0 IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE 1 IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY 2 IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE 3 IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY 4 IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE IDLE 5 IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE BUSY 6 IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY IDLE 7 IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY BUSY 8 IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE IDLE IDLE 9 IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE IDLE BUSY 10 IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE BUSY IDLE 11 IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE BUSY BUSY 12 IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE 13 IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY 14 IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE 15 IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY 16 BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE IDLE IDLE 17 BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE IDLE BUSY 18 BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE BUSY IDLE 19 BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE BUSY BUSY 20 BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY IDLE IDLE 21 BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY IDLE BUSY 22 BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY BUSY IDLE 23 BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY BUSY BUSY 24 BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE IDLE 25 BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE BUSY 26 BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY IDLE 27 BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY BUSY 28 BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE IDLE 29 BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE BUSY 30 BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY IDLE 31 BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY BUSY
Depends on RLCLC: GPRSPRIO
attribute.dependencies: When functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation is active in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: pdchPreempt
attribute.description:
Sets which on-demand PDCHs, that are possible to preempt, to use for circuit switched calls.
0 All on-demand PDCHs are possible to preempt.
1 On-demand PDCHs not used for DTM are possible to preempt.
2 On-demand PDCHs not used for streaming are possible to preempt. This attribute value is obsolete, kept for compatibility reasons. The value is automatically changed to 0.
3 On-demand PDCHs not used for DTM nor for streaming are possible to preempt. This attribute value is obsolete, kept for compatibility reasons. The value is automatically changed to 1.
4 On-demand PDCHs that are not essential are possible to preempt.
5 On-demand PDCHs that are not essential nor DTM PDCHs are possible to preempt.
6 On-demand PDCHs that are not essential nor streaming PDCHs are possible to preempt. This attribute value is obsolete, kept for compatibility reasons. The value is automatically changed to 4.
7 On-demand PDCHs that are not essential nor DTM nor streaming PDCHs are possible to preempt. This attribute value is obsolete, kept for compatibility reasons. The value is automatically changed to 5.
8 Idle on-demand PDCHs are possible to preempt.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLGSC: PDCHPREEMPT

attribute.name: puThreshU
attribute.description:
The upper threshold for PDCH use. When the average PDCH use in the cell exceeds this value, new on-demand or semi-dedicated PDCHs are ordered.
Initially, and with a buffer level below this threshold, the MS is allocated with at most one PDCH in both uplink and downlink directions. When the buffer level for the MS exceeds this threshold, the allocation is according to the MS multislot class.
The values 1-39 are obsolete, kept for compatibility reason. When set, the values are automatically changed to 40. The values 81-100 are obsolete, kept for compatibility reason. When set, the values are automatically changed to 80.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLPUC: PUTHRESHU
attribute.dependencies: The vaule of the attribute must be greater than the value of the attribute puThreshL. When the attribute TbfReservation.pdeAuto is set to ON then this attribute has no impact on the system.

attribute.name: puThreshL
attribute.description:
The lower threshold for PDCH use. When the average PDCH use in the cell drops below this value, on-demand or semi-dedicated PDCHs are returned.
Initially, and with a buffer level below this threshold, the MS is allocated with at most one PDCH in both uplink and downlink directions. When the buffer level for the MS exceeds this threshold, the allocation is according to the MS multislot class.
The values 0-19 are obsolete, kept for compatibility reason. When set, the values are automatically changed to 20. The values 61-99 are obsolete, kept for compatibility reason. When set, the values are automatically changed to 60.
The availability of this attribute depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLPUC: PUTHRESHL
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute must be less than the value of the attribute puThreshU. When the attribute TbfReservation.pdeAuto is set to ON then this attribute has no impact on the system.

attribute.name: primpLim
attribute.description:
Sets the maximum number of GPRS dedicated and semi-dedicated channels allowed in the primary PSET.
Depends on RLGSC: PRIMPLIM
attribute.dependencies: When the functionality Packet Data Efficiency, set by the attribute TbfReservation.packetDataEffState, is ACTIVE in the cell, this attribute can be changed automatically.

attribute.name: codecRest
attribute.description:
Preferred speech version and channel rate restriction for a cell.
Depends on RLCLC: CODECREST
attribute.dependencies: It is not possible to change this attribute when one of the following functionalities is active: Dynamic Half Rate Allocation, set by the attribute DynamicHrAllocation.dha, Abis-triggered Half Rate Allocation, set by the attribute DynamicAllocationOnAbis.athAbis, or Dynamic Full Rate/Half Rate Mode Adaptation, set by the attribute DynamicFrHrModeAdaption.dmSupp, or Voice Capacity Optimization, set by attribute ChannelAllocAndOpt.vcoStatus.

attribute.name: fPdch
attribute.description:
Requested number of GPRS dedicated channels.
If the cell is active, GPRS support is activated for the cell, and a value higher than the current value is specified for the attribute, the corresponding number of TCHs is allocated and activated as GPRS dedicated channels. If there are not enough idle TCHs, TCHs will be allocated and activated as GPRS dedicated channels, as they become available. If the cell is halted, GPRS support is activated for the cell, and a value other than zero is specified for the attribute, TCHs will be allocated and activated as GPRS dedicated channels when the cell is activated.
Numeral 0-8, when extended range is defined in the cell. Numeral 0-16, when extended range is not defined in the cell. Numeral 0-24, when Market Adaptation M-340 is activated.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLGSC: FPDCH
attribute.dependencies: Total number of GPRS dedicated and semi-dedicated channels cannot exceed the number of PDCHs that can be allocated in two PSETs. When the functionality Packet Data Efficiency, set by the attribute TbfReservation.packetDataEffState, is ACTIVE in the cell, this attribute can be changed automatically. When Market Adaptation M-340 is activated, additional eight PDCHs are allocated in the third PSET. In that case, the total amount of PDCHs must not exceed 24.

attribute.name: sPdch
attribute.description:
Requested number of GPRS semi-dedicated channels.
Numeral 0-8, when extended range is defined in the cell. Numeral 0-16, when extended range is not defined in the cell. Numeral 0-24, when Market Adaptation M-340 is activated.
Depends on RLGSC: SPDCH
attribute.dependencies: Total number of GPRS dedicated and semi-dedicated channels cannot exceed the number of PDCHs that can be allocated in two PSETs. When the functionality Packet Data Efficiency, set by the attribute TbfReservation.packetDataEffState, is ACTIVE in the cell, this attribute can be changed automatically.

attribute.name: mc
attribute.description:
Status of the functionality Multiple Channel Switch in the cell.
Determines if more than one TCH/F are allowed to be allocated for each MS connection in the cell.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLCDC MC
attribute.dependencies: The attribute value can be changed to ON only if the attribute GeranCell.xRange is set to NO.

attribute.name: cmdr
attribute.description:
Defines the maximum channel data rate that is allowed in the cell.
When the value of the attribute is changed, the channel data rate of the existing connections remains unchanged. The new channel data rate may be used when the channel allocation is performed for the new or changed connections. The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLDRC: CMDR
attribute.dependencies: When value of this attribute is different from the value of attribute CircuitSwitchedDataBsc.maxChDataRate, the lower of the two data rate values has precedence over the other.

attribute.name: abf
attribute.description:
Determines if non-hopping TCHs on the BCCH frequency should be avoided for CS speech and data.
Depends on RLCLC: ABF
attribute.dependencies: When the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation, set by the attribute qtaStatus is active in the cell, change of this attribute has no impact on BSC behavior.

attribute.name: qtaStatus
attribute.description:
Activation status of the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation in the cell.
The availability of the attribute value ACTIVE depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLQAI RLQAE
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is automatically set to ACTIVE, when the functionality Automatic FLP, set by the attribute Son. aFlp, is ACTIVE.
attribute.sideEffects:
Setting of the attribute to ACTIVE has following side effects:
- SDCCHs are removed from all CHGRs in the cell. If the attribute GeranCell.bcchType is set to NCOMB, then one BPC with SDCCH/8 channel combination is automatically created in Channel Group 0.
- B-TCHs are created instead of removed SDCCHs. Overall number of required BPCs and number of required GPRS CS-3, CS-4 or Enhanced GPRS BPCs in the CHGRs are not changed.
- The functionality Adaptive Configuration of Logical Channels is substituted with the functionality Quality based Timeslot Allocation. SDCCHs are created and deleted automatically, based on the demand for signalling channels.
- G-TCHs, E-TCHs, and SDCCH/8s are placed on TNs for each carrier in the CHGR according to TN priority order.
- The attribute ChannelGroup.sdcch does not influence the channel group configuration.
- The attributes LchAdaptiveConf.sLevel, LchAdaptiveConf.sTime, ChannelGroup.tn, ChannelGroup.eTchTn, ChannelAllocAndOpt.abf, ChannelAllocAndOpt.chap, ChannelAllocAndOpt.csPsAlloc, ChannelAllocAndOpt.csPsPrio, gprs.scAlloc, SubcellLoadDistribution.scld, SubcellLoadDistribution.scldLol, SubcellLoadDistribution.scldLul and SubcellLoadDistribution.scldSc have no impact on the BSC behavior.
When this attribute is set to INACTIVE, the functionality Reduced BCCH Spectrum, set by attribute rBcchSp, is deactivated. Change of the attribute qtaStatus automatically triggers recalculation of the attributes numReqEgprsBpc and numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if the attribute numReqEgprsBpc, or both, is set to 255. Change of the attribute qtaStatus automatically triggers recalculation of the attribute numReqCs3Cs4Bpc, if the attribute numReqCs3Cs4Bpc is set to 255.

attribute.name: ssCarrier0
attribute.description:
Sets the first Shared Spectrum Central Carrier for the Shared Spectrum Bandwidth.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLASC: SSCARRIER
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q4 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute SharedCarrier.sharedCarrierId.
attribute.dependencies: Attributes ssCarrier0 and ssBandwidth0 should be created or deleted together.

attribute.name: ssBandwidth0
attribute.description:
Sets the first Shared Spectrum Bandwidth for Shared Spectrum Central Carrier.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLASC: SSBANDWIDTH
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q4 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute SharedCarrier.ssBandwidth.
attribute.dependencies: Attributes ssCarrier0 and ssBandwidth0 should be created or deleted together.

attribute.name: ssBandwidth1
attribute.description:
Sets the second Shared Spectrum Bandwidth for Shared Spectrum Central Carrier.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLASC: SSBANDWIDTH
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q4 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute SharedCarrier.ssBandwidth.
attribute.dependencies: Attributes ssCarrier1 and ssBandwidth1 should be created or deleted together. Data will be shifted up after the deletion of previous bandwith and synchronization.

attribute.name: ssBandwidth2
attribute.description:
Sets the third Shared Spectrum Bandwidth for Shared Spectrum Central Carrier.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLASC: SSBANDWIDTH
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q4 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute SharedCarrier.ssBandwidth.
attribute.dependencies: Attributes ssCarrier2 and ssBandwidth2 should be created or deleted together. Data will be shifted up after the deletion of previous bandwith and synchronization.

attribute.name: ssBandwidth3
attribute.description:
Sets the fourth Shared Spectrum Bandwidth for Shared Spectrum Central Carrier.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLASC: SSBANDWIDTH
attribute.statusInformation: Since G19.Q4 release, this attribute is replaced by the attribute SharedCarrier.ssBandwidth.
attribute.dependencies: Attributes ssCarrier3 and ssBandwidth3 should be created or deleted together. Data will be shifted up after the deletion of previous bandwith and synchronization.

attribute.name: ssBandwidth4
attribute.description:
Sets the fifth Shared Spectrum Bandwidth for Shared Spectrum Central Carrier.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.

attribute.dependencies: Attributes ssCarrier4 and ssBandwidth4 should be created or deleted together. Data will be shifted up after the deletion of previous bandwith and synchronization.

attribute.name: rBcchSp
attribute.description:
Activation status of the functionality Reduced BCCH Spectrum in the cell.
The availability of the attribute value ACTIVE depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLQAI RLQAE
attribute.dependencies: It is not allowed to set attribute to value ACTIVE if the attribute qtaStatus is set to INACTIVE. This attribute can be set to ACTIVE when the functionality BTS Soft Synchronization, set by the attribute G12Tf.btsSoftSyncState or G31Tf.btsSoftSyncState, is active for all TGs, that are connected to channel groups of the current cell.
attribute.sideEffects: If this attribute is set to ACTIVE, change of the attribute PowerSavings.pro has no effect on the BSC behavior.

attribute.name: vcoStatus
attribute.description:
Activation state of the functionality Voice Capacity Optimization.
The availability of the attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLVCI RLVCE

class.name: InterRanMobility
class.description:
Contains cell system information data for the BSC.
Child MO UtranFddFrequency is created when FDD ARFCN is added to idle list in attribute umfiIdleList. And vise versa, when FDD ARFCN is removed from idle list then child MO is removed accordingly.
Child MO UtranTddFrequency is created when TDD ARFCN is added to idle list in attribute tmfiIdleList. And vise versa, when TDD ARFCN is removed from idle list then child MO is removed accordingly.
Instance of this MO is automatically created during the parent MO creation.

attribute.name: interRanMobilityId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: isHoLev
attribute.description:
Intersystem handover level.
Changes a threshold for intersystem handover from GSM to UTRAN. Intersystem handover from GSM to UTRAN is only allowed when the percentage of idle TCH BPCs left in the cell is less than or equal to this value given as percentage. When the percentage of idle TCH BPCs is greater than this value, then only handovers from UTRAN to GSM are allowed.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreement.
Depends on RLLOC: ISHOLEV
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is not supported when the optional feature GSM to TD-SCDMA Cell Reselection is available.

attribute.name: maxIsHo
attribute.description:
Maximum number of outgoing inter system handovers per second.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreement.
Depends on RLLOC: MAXISHO

attribute.name: fddMrr
attribute.description:
Multi-RAT reporting for UTRAN FDD.
Changes the number of UTRAN FDD neighboring cells a MS must include in a measurement report or an enhanced measurement report.
If there are remaining positions left in the measurement report or the enhanced measurement report and the attribute is not set to zero, additional UTRAN FDD neighboring cells may be included independent of the value of this attribute.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLSUC: FDDMRR
attribute.specification: Corresponds to the 3GPP specification parameter FDD_MULTIRAT_REPORTING.
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the value of the attribute AxeParameterBsc.gwBaR is ACTIVE or the value of the attribute AxeParameterBsc.cceBaR is ACTIVE, and the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: fddQMin

The minimum threshold for Ec/No for cell reselection to UTRAN FDD.

1 - 6 dB
2 -18 dB
3 - 8 dB
4 -16 dB
5 -10 dB
6 -14 dB
7 -12 dB
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLSUC: FDDQMIN

attribute.name: fddQMinOff
attribute.description:
Minimum quality offset for UTRAN FDD.
Describes an offset for the value of the attribute fddQMin.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLSUC: FDDQMINOFF

Depends on RLSUC: FDDQOFF

attribute.name: qsc
attribute.description:
RXLEV threshold for start of UTRAN FDD measurements in active mode.
For the values 0-6, an MS searches for UTRAN FDD cells if the signal level is below the threshold.
For the values 8-14, an MS searches for UTRAN FDD cells if the signal level is above the threshold.
0 -98 dBm
1 -94 dBm
2 -90 dBm
3 -86 dBm
4 -82 dBm
5 -78 dBm
6 -74 dBm
7 Infinite, always search for UTRAN FDD cells.
8 -78 dBm
9 -74 dBm
10 -70 dBm
11 -66 dBm
12 -62 dBm
13 -58 dBm
14 -54 dBm
15 Infinite, never search for UTRAN FDD cells.
Depends on RLSUC: QSC

attribute.name: qsci
attribute.description:
Initial active mode quality search indicator for UTRAN FDD.
Changes the quality search value to be used in active mode before the active mode quality search indicator is downloaded to the MS.
Depends on RLSUC: QSCI

13 -58 dBm
14 -54 dBm
15 Infinite, never search for UTRAN FDD cells.
Depends on RLSUC: QSI

attribute.name: sPrio
attribute.description:
Search priority for UTRAN FDD.
Sets if UTRAN FDD cells may be searched when BSIC decoding is required.
Depends on RLSUC: SPRIO
attribute.specification: Corresponds to 3GPP specification parameter 3G_SEARCH_PRIO. In 3GPP Release-8 and later this parameter is removed and an MS that is compatible with Release-8 or later ignores this attribute and always searches UTRAN FDD cells.

Reporting threshold for CPICH RSCP measurement reporting of UTRAN FDD.
0 FDD reporting threshold is not considered for cell reselection.
1 -115 dBm

.
.
.

The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.

attribute.name: fastRet3g
attribute.description:
State of the functionality Fast Return to WCDMA at Call Release.
The availability of the attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLRWI RLRWE

attribute.name: fastRetLte
attribute.description:
State of the functionality Fast Return to LTE After Call Release in the cell.
The availability of the attribute value ACTIVE depends on commercial agreements. The number of TSs supporting the functionality Fast Return to LTE After Call Release depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLRLI RLRLE

attribute.name: prioCr
attribute.description:
State of the functionality RAT priority based cell reselection in the cell.
The availability of the attribute value ON depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLSRI RLSRE
attribute.dependencies: To set this attribute to ON, the attribute ratPrio must be defined, and attributes UtranTddFrequency.ratPrioT, UtranFddFrequency.ratPrioU, or EUtranFrequency.ratPrioE must be defined.
attribute.sideEffects: When this attribute is set to ON, it is not allowed to remove an UTRAN TDD ARFCN with RAT priority defined, if there is no other E-UTRAN or UTRAN TDD ARFCN with RAT priority defined in the cell. When this attribute is set to ON, it is not allowed to remove an UTRAN FDD ARFCN with RAT priority defined, if there is no other E-UTRAN or UTRAN FDD ARFCN with RAT priority defined in the cell. When this attribute is set to ON, it is not allowed to remove an E-UTRAN ARFCN from the idle measurement frequency list with RAT priority defined, if there is no other E-UTRAN or UTRAN ARFCN with RAT priority defined in the cell.

attribute.name: ratPrio
attribute.description:
The RAT priority for the cell in priority based cell reselection algorithm.
0 Lowest priority
.
.
.
7 Highest priority
Attribute can be set to no value only by the system.
Depends on RLSRC: RATPRIO
attribute.dependencies: The value of the attribute ratPrio cannot be the same as the value of already set attributes ratPrioE and ratPrioU, ratPrioT.

If there are remaining positions left in the measurement report or the enhanced measurement report and the attribute is not set to zero, additional UTRAN TDD neighboring cells may be included independent of the value of this attribute.

Changes the absolute threshold of RSCP for UTRAN TDD. An MS reselects a suitable TD-SCDMA cell for which the measured RSCP value is equal to or greater than value of this attribute for a period of 5 seconds.

attribute.name: emrr
attribute.description:
Multi-RAT reporting for E-UTRAN.
Changes the number of E-UTRAN neighboring cells that MSs must include in the measurement report or in the enhanced measurement report.
If there are remaining positions left in the measurement report or in the enhanced measurement report and the attribute is not set to zero, additional E-UTRAN neighboring cells can be included independent of the value of this attribute.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLESC: EMRR
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: eRepGran
attribute.description:
Reporting granularity for E-UTRAN RSRP.
Changes value of reporting granularity, which indicates whether fine or coarse granularity is used by MSs in case of 3-bit measurement reporting with measurement reports. This attribute, together with attributes eFddMrOff or eTddMrOff, is used by MSs in the calculation of the reported E-UTRAN 3-bit RSRP level.
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLESC: EREPGRAN
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.

attribute.name: eFddMrOff
attribute.description:
FDD 3-bit measurement reporting offset for E-UTRAN RSRP.
Changes the offset for RSRP measurement reporting of E-UTRAN FDD, used by MSs in case of 3-bit measurement reporting with measurement reports.This attribute, together with attribute eRepGran, is used by MSs in the calculation of the reported E-UTRAN 3-bit RSRP level. MSs may only report those E-UTRAN FDD cells, for which the measured value of RSRP is equal to or higher than value of this attribute.
0 -140 dBm
1 -139 dBm
2 -138 dBm
.
.
.
61 -79 dBm
62 -78 dBm
63 -77 dBm
The availability of attribute values depends on commercial agreements.
Depends on RLESC: EFDDMROFF
attribute.precondition: It is not allowed to change the attribute if the function Active BA-list Recording is active in the cell for any MO BaRecording other than system defined instance with identity GENNAMEBAR64.
